translated: Let these seeds of rice and barley grow by the grace of the sun.

original: somenārpitā grahair nirvyādhikāś śuddhāś śubhā bhavantu
analyzed: somena arpitāḥ grahaiḥ nirvyādhikāḥ śuddhāḥ śubhāḥ bhavantu
translated: Given to Soma, free from disease, pure, and auspicious by the planets,🔽I sow the seeds that grow, which were created by Brahma, the ten and seven.

original: prarohabījān nirvapāmi bhūmau ye brahmasṛṣṭā daśa sapta caiva / te vardhitā vṛṣṭivaśena sarve saṃpālyamānā hy amṛtena lokān
analyzed: praroha bījān nirvapāmi bhūmau ye brahma sṛṣṭāḥ daśa sapta ca eva te vardhitāḥ vṛṣṭi vaśena sarve saṃpālyamānāḥ hi amṛtena lokān
translated: All of them have grown by the power of rain, and being protected by nectar, they sustain the worlds.

original: sapta grāmyās sapta cāraṇyakāś ca ye gharmanaṣṭā himavarṣasṛṣṭās te vṛṣṭibhūtā hy amṛtaṃ rakṣantu
analyzed: sapta grāmyāḥ sapta ca āraṇyakāḥ ca ye gharma naṣṭāḥ hima varṣa sṛṣṭāḥ te vṛṣṭi bhūtāḥ hi amṛtam rakṣantu
translated: The seven domesticated and seven wild plants, which are lost in the heat and created by snow and rain, may they become rain and protect nectar.

analyzed: dīrṇa ārdra saṃśuṣka vivardhamānāḥ mūlaiḥ phalaiḥ śākaiḥ
translated: Growing from roots, fruits, and abundant vegetables, which are torn, wet, dry, and increasing,

original: annena martyānāṃ haviṣā surāṇān te vai ruhantāṃ tṛṇavat paśubhyaḥ
analyzed: annena haviṣā surāṇān te vai ruhantām tṛṇa vat paśubhyaḥ
translated: May they grow like grass for animals, with food for humans and oblations for the gods.

analyzed: tān bhūmi śuddhyai nirvapāmi bījān deva sthiti kāraṇāya
translated: I sow these seeds for the purification of the earth, for the sake of establishing the gods.

original: ye vyomabhūmyagnijalasya vāyos saṃyogabhūtāḥ praruhanti sarve
translated: All those that grow from the conjunction of space, earth, fire, water, and wind,

original: tān daivike śuddhikarāya bījān nirvapāmi devasthitikāraṇāya
analyzed: tān daivike śuddhi karāya bījān nirvapāmi deva sthiti kāraṇāya
translated: I sow these seeds for purification in the divine, for the sake of establishing the gods.

original: edition shows the incorrect reading pamṛddhaiḥ which was corrected in the edition / In Telegu script /
analyzed: edition shows the incorrect reading pamṛddhaiḥ which was corrected in the edition in telegu script
translated: This edition shows the incorrect reading pamṛddhaiḥ, which was corrected in the edition. In Telugu script.

original: pa and sa are very similar /
analyzed: pa and sa are very similar
translated: P and S are very similar.

original: text reads martyānṃ / The text reads martyān /
analyzed: text reads martyān the text reads martyān
translated: The text reads marttyān. The text reads marttyān.

original: assuming that what appears to be a second r is actually a symbol for final n with one loop broken off / Otherwise as it stands /
analyzed: assuming that what appears to be a second r is actually a symbol for final n with one loop broken off otherwise as it stands
translated: Assuming that what appears to be a second r is actually a symbol for final n with one loop broken off. Otherwise as it stands.

original: the edition would read marrtyā / I have corrected all these unintelligible forms to martyānāṃ /
analyzed: the edition would read marrtyāḥ i have corrected all these unintelligible forms to martyānām
translated: The edition would read marrtya. I have corrected all these unintelligible forms to marttyānām.

original: which combined with annena provides an intelligible reading parallel to haviṣā surāṇān /
analyzed: which combined with annena provides an intelligible reading parallel to haviṣā surāṇān
translated: Which combined with annena provides an intelligible reading parallel to haviṣā surāṇām.

original: The text places an anudatta under the ū of bhūmy and then a svarita over the a in agni /
analyzed: the text places an anudatta under the ū of bhūmī and then a svarita over the a in agni
translated: The text places an anudatta under the ū of bhūmy and then a svarita over the a in agni.

original: seemingly an impossible feat of recitation /
analyzed: seemingly an impossible feat of recitation
translated: Apparently an impossible feat of recitation.
That which is the seed of this firmament.

original: yad bījaṃ cāgniḥ pṛthivī rasaś ca tad bījarohāya vahantu vātās /
analyzed: yat bījam ca agniḥ pṛthivī rasaḥ ca tat bīja rohāya vahantu vātāḥ
translated: Let the winds carry that seed, fire, earth, and sap, for the growth of the seed.
Let the sprouts grow and increase,

original: nirītikās te bahavo ruhantas saṃpālyamānā hy amṛtavāyunā ca
analyzed: nirītikāḥ te bahavaḥ ruhantaḥ saṃpālyamānāḥ hi amṛta vāyunā ca
translated: growing without disease, well-protected by the immortal wind.

original: kālena bījāḥ praruhanti coptā bījād ahaṃ pracariṣyāmi dharmam
analyzed: kālena bījāḥ praruhanti ca uptāḥ bījāt aham pracariṣyāmi dharmam
translated: In due time, the sown seeds sprout; from the seed, I shall practice the Dharma.

original: ete bījā rasabhūtā vahantu somena sṛṣṭā amṛtavat paśubhyaḥ
analyzed: ete bījāḥ rasa bhūtāḥ vahantu somena sṛṣṭāḥ amṛta vat paśubhyaḥ
translated: Let these seeds, full of sap, be carried, created by Soma, like nectar for the cattle.

original: etān prarohān rasabhūtajātān dattān me bhuktvā pracarantu gāvaḥ🔽tasmān mamaitān pravapāmi gehe te me paśūnām amṛtā vahantu
analyzed: etān prarohān rasa bhūta jātān dattān me bhuktvā pracarantu gāvaḥ  tasmāt mama etān pravapāmi gehe te me paśūnām amṛtāḥ vahantu
translated: Having eaten these sprouts, full of sap, given by me, let the cows move about.🔽Therefore, I sow these in my house; let them carry immortality to my cattle.

original: etaṃ stutā me pravahantv amutra te puṇyaloke mama dehabhūtāḥ
analyzed: etam stutāḥ me pravahantu amutra te puṇya loke mama deha bhūtāḥ
translated: Praised by me, let them carry me to the other world; in the world of the gods, let them be my very body.
On the peak of the ocean-encompassed earth,

original: devi tvayi vāpayāmy amūn kuruṣva tvag🔽ṃ sasyasaṃpattim
analyzed: devi tvayi vāpayāmi amūn kuruṣva tvac  ṃ sasya saṃpattim
translated: O Goddess, in you I deposit these; make them grow.🔽Give me the abundance of crops.

original: kāmaduhe duhāmi tvāṃ kāmaduhe sasyavatse dhanarāśiṃ prapūraya
analyzed: kāmaduhe duhāmi tvām kāmaduhe sasya vatse dhana rāśim prapūraya
translated: I milk you, O wish-fulfilling cow, I fill the heap of wealth with crops, O wish-fulfilling cow.
May Indra milk the heaven.

original: dharā sā yā purā yena dhṛtā yā śobhanaṃ padam
analyzed: dharā sā purā yena dhṛtā yā śobhanam padam
translated: That earth which was formerly held by him, which is the auspicious place,

original: kariṣyāmy asya sā prītā bhava tvag🔽ṃ śubhalakṣaṇe
analyzed: kariṣyāmi asya sā prītā bhava tvac  ṃ śubha lakṣaṇe
translated: I will do that which will please him, be happy, O you of auspicious marks.

original: daivike tu tathā śauce gobhiḥ kartum iha prabho
analyzed: daivike tu tathā śauce gobhiḥ kartum iha prabho
translated: But in the case of the divine and pure cows, O lord, I wish to perform with them.

original: kartum arhasi nitye tu vidye vai tvatprasādataḥ
analyzed: kartum arhasi nitye tu vidye vai tvad prasādataḥ
translated: You should always do it with the knowledge of the Vedas, through your grace.

original: sasyā ime suhaviṣas suśuddhā yathā cāhutir yajñamukhe samṛddhāḥ
analyzed: sasyāḥ ime su haviṣaḥ su śuddhāḥ yathā ca āhutiḥ yajña mukhe samṛddhāḥ
translated: These crops are well-offered, well-purified, as the oblation is successful at the beginning of the sacrifice.

original: śuddhāmṛtās sūribhir agrapeyās sarvāṅgadevā avayavaiś śubhānām
analyzed: śuddha amṛtāḥ sūribhiḥ agra peyāḥ sarva aṅga devāḥ avayavaiḥ śubhānām
translated: Pure and immortal, to be drunk first by the wise, all the gods in all the limbs of the auspicious ones.

original: śubhā bhavantu prabhavantu puṣṭyai🔽śuddhā ime paśava eṣāg
analyzed: śubhāḥ bhavantu prabhavantu puṣṭyai  śuddhāḥ ime paśavaḥ eṣā ak
translated: Be auspicious, be prosperous for growth.
These pure animals, this sacrificial post, the horns Indra and Vishnu, the head Brahma.

original: pṛṣṭho rudra ṛṣayo romāṇy uro guhas tīrthā lāṅgūlam
analyzed: pṛṣṭhaḥ rudraḥ ṛṣayaḥ romāṇi uraḥ guhaḥ tīrthāḥ lāṅgūlam
translated: The back Rudra, the hairs the sages, the chest Guha, the tail the holy places.

original: kukṣir medinī cakṣuṣī candrādityau vālā vidyādharāḥ
analyzed: kukṣiḥ medinī cakṣuṣī candra ādityau vālāḥ vidyādharāḥ
translated: The belly the earth, the eyes the moon and sun, the whiskers the Vidyadharas.

original: ūdhas sāgarāḥ stanā nadyo gātraṃ bhūdharāḥ🔽asthīni parvatā rudhiraṃ mitrāvaruṇau māṃsam agnir jāhnavī mūtram
analyzed: ūdhar stanāḥ nadyaḥ gātram bhūdharāḥ  asthīni parvatāḥ rudhiram mitrāvaruṇau māṃsam agniḥ jāhnavī mūtram
translated: The udder the oceans, the teats the rivers, the body the mountains.🔽The bones the mountains, the blood Mitra and Varuna, the flesh Agni, the urine Jahnavi.

original: khura uragā jyeṣṭhā nāsikā dantā marutaḥ
translated: The hooves the serpents, the nostrils the Maruts, the teeth the Maruts.

original: jihvā sarasvatī karṇaḥ kavīndraś śakṛt puṇyadeśam
analyzed: jihvā sarasvatī karṇaḥ kavi indraḥ śakṛt
translated: The tongue Sarasvati, the ear the lord of poets, the dung the holy land.

analyzed: etāḥ sa vatsāḥ gāvaḥ sa vṛṣāḥ

Let them rejoice as they please, let them rejoice.

let the heroes enjoy the offered Bali today.

translated: The inner self, the supreme inner self, the great inner self, and the inner self beyond that, the self that pervades all,

original: ṃ sakalaṃ bibharti yo vyaktapuṇyas satunaḥ pradhānaḥ
analyzed: sakalam bibharti yaḥ vyakta puṇyaḥ satunaḥ pradhānaḥ
translated: who supports the entire manifest, is the foremost of the self-existent,🔽May my breath be Prāṇa, the leader, that is Udāna, the beginning, the giver of boons, the boar, and Vyāna,

original: prāṇaḥ praṇītis sa udāna ādir varado varāho vyānaś ca me syāt tapasāñ ca mūrtiḥ kapilo munīndro yaś cāpāno hayaśīrṣo naḥ
analyzed: prāṇaḥ praṇītiḥ saḥ udānaḥ ādiḥ vara daḥ varāhaḥ vyānaḥ ca me syāt tapasām ca mūrtiḥ kapilaḥ muni indraḥ yaḥ ca apānaḥ haya śīrṣaḥ naḥ
translated: and may the form of austerities be the great sage Kapila, and Apāna be Hayagrīva for us.
May that which the imperishable one eats entirely,

original: ṃ śriyam ūrjayuktāṃ sa tu me samānaḥ
analyzed: ṃ śriyam ūrja yuktām sa tu me samānaḥ
translated: along with prosperity endowed with energy, be my Samāna.

original: balam āsuraṃ yat satataṃ nihantā brahmā buddhir me gopa īśvaraḥ
analyzed: balam āsuram yat satatam nihantā brahmā buddhiḥ me gopaḥ īśvaraḥ
translated: May the destroyer of the demon's strength always be my intellect, and Brahmā be my protector, the lord.

original: savitā ca vīryam induś ca dhāturasabhūtabhūtā bhūtās sabhūtāḥ🔽dyaur me astu mūrdhodaranābho vā bhūmir yathāṅghrir vavṛdhe 'ham īśaḥ
analyzed: savitā ca vīryam induḥ ca bhūtāḥ sa bhūtāḥ  dyauḥ me astu vā bhūmiḥ vavṛdhe ham īśaḥ
translated: May Savitṛ be my valor, and the moon be my creator, the essence of all beings, the beings with the elements,🔽May the sky be my head, and the earth my belly and navel, and as my feet grew, I became the lord.

original: asthīni me syur atha parvatākhyā bhujagāś ca keśā divi ye carantaḥ🔽dvau netrarūpau vithu pṛścni /
analyzed: asthīni me syuḥ atha parvata ākhyāḥ bhujagāḥ ca keśāḥ divi ye carantaḥ  dvau netra rūpau vithu pṛścni
translated: May my bones be known as mountains, and the serpents moving in the sky be my hair,🔽The two forms of the eyes are the moon and the sun,
the blood and the essence,
and all the water,

original: snāyavo me āsannā dyaur bhṛgur me hṛdayam astu
analyzed: snāyavaḥ me āsannāḥ dyauḥ bhṛguḥ me hṛdayam astu
translated: Let my sinews be the clouds, let Bhrigu be my heart.

original: sarve anye munayo 'ṅgabhūtā vedā me āsyaṃ jihvā me sarasvatī
analyzed: sarve anye munayaḥ ṅga bhūtāḥ vedā me āsyam jihvā me sarasvatī
translated: Let all the other sages be the limbs, let the Vedas be my mouth, let Sarasvati be my tongue.
Let the Maruts be my teeth, let the Upanishads be my palate,

original: vṛṣaṇau mitrāvaruṇāv upasthaḥ prajāpatir āntrā me vedāś śrutismṛtī medādhāraṇe🔽svedam me varṣaṃ mūtra kośag
analyzed: vṛṣaṇau mitrāvaruṇau upasthaḥ prajāpatiḥ āntrāḥ me vedāḥ medā dhāraṇe  svedam me varṣam mūtra kośa g
translated: Let Mitra and Varuna be my testicles, let Prajapati be my anus, let the Vedas be my entrails, let Smriti and Sruti be my intestines.
Let my sweat be rain, let my urine be the ocean, let my feces be gold.

original: sāvitrī gāyatrī maryādā vedihṛtpuṇḍarīke vimale praviṣṭas sakalas salakṣmīs savibhūtikāṅgo yat sarvaṃ puṇyaṃ mayy adhiṣṭhānam

translated: May Savitri, Gayatri, the boundary, the altar, the pure white lotus of the heart, the entire universe with Lakshmi and its parts, all that is meritorious, be established in me.

analyzed: kṛṇuṣva pājaḥ prasitim na pṛthvīm yāhi rājā iva amavāgṃ ibhena
translated: Make thy path wide as the earth, go with the steed as a king to the assembly.

original: tṛṣvīm anu prasitiṃ drūṇāno 'stāsi vidhya rakṣasas tapiṣṭhaiḥ
analyzed: tṛṣvīm anu prasitim drūṇānaḥ stāsi vidhya rakṣasaḥ tapiṣṭhaiḥ
translated: Stretching thy long rope along the nights, shoot, pierce the Raksases with thy sharpest (darts).

original: tava bhramāsa āśuyā patanty anu spṛśa dhṛṣatā śośucānaḥ
analyzed: tava bhramāsaḥ āśuyā patanti anu spṛśa dhṛṣatā śośucānaḥ
translated: Thy flames fall with swift force; touch with thy tongue, shining fiercely.

original: tapūgṃṣy agne juhvā pataṅgān asaṃdito vi sṛja viṣvag ulkāḥ
analyzed: tapūgṃṣi agne juhvā pataṅgān a saṃditaḥ vi sṛja viṣvak ulkāḥ
translated: O Agni, with thy tongue lick the flying sparks; loose in all directions the unyoked firebrands.

original: prati spaśo vi śṛja tūrṇitamo bhavā pāyur viśo asyā adabdhaḥ🔽yo no dūre aghaśag
analyzed: prati spaśaḥ vi śṛja tūrṇitamaḥ bhava pāyuḥ viśaḥ asyāḥ adabdhaḥ  yaḥ naḥ dūre agha śak
translated: Scatter the spies, O thou most active one; be thou the unfailing guardian of this people.

original: ṃso yo anty agne mākiṣ ṭe vyathir ā dadharṣīt🔽ud agne tiṣṭha praty ā tanuṣva ny amitrāg
analyzed: ṃsaḥ yaḥ anti agne mākir te vyathiḥ ā dadharṣīt  ud agne tiṣṭha prati ā tanuṣva ni amitrāk
translated: He who from afar or from near, O Agni, would injure us,🔽Let not his spite prevail over thee.🔽Rise up, O Agni, stretch forth,
strike down the enemies, O thou of sharp arrows.

original: ṃ samidhāna cakre nīcā taṃ dhakṣy atasaṃ na śuṣkam
analyzed: ṃ samidhāna cakre nīcā tam dhakṣi atasam na śuṣkam
translated: He who has kindled thee against us, O thou of sharp arrows,🔽burn him down, O Agni, as a dry (log) is easily burnt.🔽Rise up, pierce through our enemies,

original: ūrdhvo bhava prati vidhyādhy asmad āviṣ kṛṇuṣva daivyāny agne
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ bhava prati vidhya adhi asmat āviḥ kṛṇuṣva daivyāni agne
translated: show forth thy heavenly powers, O Agni.

original: ava sthirā tanuhi yātujūnāṃ jāmim ajāmiṃ pra mṛṇīhi śatrūn
analyzed: ava sthirā tanuhi yātu jūnām jāmim ajāmim pra mṛṇīhi
translated: Destroy the firm foundations of the demons, crush the kinsman and the stranger, crush the foes.

analyzed: sa te jānāti sumatim yaviṣṭha yaḥ īvate brahmaṇe gātum airat
translated: He who has brought to Yavi's son, to the Brahman, the most ancient path to the favour, O most ancient one,

original: viśvāny asmai sudināni rāyo dyumnāny aryo vi duro abhi dyaut
analyzed: viśvāni asmai su dināni rāyaḥ dyumnāni aryaḥ vi duraḥ abhi dyaut
translated: To him all the fair days, the riches, the glories, the doors of the noble one shine forth.

original: sed agne astu subhagas sudānur yas tvā nityena haviṣā ya ukthaiḥ
analyzed: sa id agne astu subhagaḥ sudānuḥ yaḥ tvā nityena haviṣā yaḥ ukthaiḥ
translated: Let him, O Agni, be prosperous, rich in good gifts, who delights in thee with perpetual oblation and hymns,

original: piprīṣati sva āyuṣi duroṇe viśved asmai sudinā sāsad iṣṭiḥ
analyzed: piprīṣati sve āyuṣi duroṇe viśvā id asmai su dinā sā asat iṣṭiḥ
translated: In his own abode, in his own life. May all the fair days be settled for him, the sacrifice.

original: arcāmi te sumatiṃ ghoṣy arvāk saṃ te vāvātā jaratām iyaṃ gīḥ
analyzed: arcāmi te sumatim ghoṣi arvāk sam te vāvātā jaratām iyam gīḥ
translated: I praise thy favour, O Agni, I proclaim it. May this our song of praise come to thee, O thou who art to be invoked by many.

original: svaśvās tvā surathā marjayemāsme kṣatrāṇi dhārayer anu dyūn
analyzed: su aśvāḥ tvā su rathāḥ marjayema asme kṣatrāṇi dhārayeḥ anu dyūn
translated: With good horses, with good chariots may we serve thee. In our dwellings mayst thou uphold the powers of rule through the days.

original: iha tvā bhūry ā cared upa tman doṣāvastar dīdivāg
analyzed: iha tvā bhūri ā caret upa tman doṣā vastar dīdivāc
translated: Here may the abundant one come to thee, O thou who layest the dust, shining
through the days.

original: krīḍantas tvā sumanasas sapemābhi dyumnā tasthivāg
analyzed: krīḍantaḥ tvā sumanasaḥ sapema abhi dyumnā tasthivāc
translated: May we, rejoicing, serve thee with cheerful hearts, with high glory standing
in the house of the people.

original: yas tvā svaśvas suhiraṇyo agna upayāti vasumatā rathena
analyzed: yaḥ tvā su aśvaḥ su hiraṇyaḥ agne upayāti vasumatā rathena
translated: He, O Agni, who comes to thee with a good horse and good gold, with a chariot rich in goods,

analyzed: tasya trātā bhavasi tasya sakhā yaḥ te ātithyam ānuṣak
translated: thou art his protector, his friend, who duly delights in thy hospitality.

analyzed: mahaḥ rujāmi bandhu tā vacobhiḥ tat mā pituḥ gotamāt anu iyāya
translated: I greatly injure with words the kinship; that has come to me from my father Gotama.

original: tvan no asya vacasaś cikiddhi hotar yaviṣṭha sukrato damūnāḥ
analyzed: tvat naḥ asya vacasaḥ cikiddhi hotar yaviṣṭha su krato damūnāḥ
translated: Do thou, O Hotar, most youthful, most wise, who art to be worshipped, heed this speech of ours.

original: asvapnajas taraṇayas suśevā atandrāso 'vṛkā aśramiṣṭhāḥ🔽te pāyavas sadhriyañco niṣadyāgne tava naḥ pāntv amūra
analyzed: a svapnajaḥ taraṇayaḥ atandrāsaḥ vṛkāḥ aśramiṣṭhāḥ  te pāyavaḥ sadhriyañcaḥ niṣadya agne tava naḥ pāntu amūra
translated: Who are sleepless, skilful, very gracious, not heedless, not rapacious, most diligent,🔽Those, O Agni, who are thy companions, thy associates, thy guests, protect us, O thou who art free from error.

original: ye pāyavo māmateyan te agne paśyanto andhaṃ duritād arakṣan
analyzed: ye pāyavaḥ māmateyan te agne paśyantaḥ andham duritāt arakṣan
translated: Those companions of thine, O Agni, who, watching, have guarded the blind one from misfortune,

original: rarakṣa tānt sukṛto viśvavedā dipsanta id ripavo nāha debhuḥ🔽tvayā vayag
analyzed: rarakṣa su kṛtaḥ viśva vedāḥ dipsantaḥ id ripavaḥ na aha debhuḥ  tvayā vayak
translated: He protected them, the righteous, the all-knowing one. The enemies, indeed, the haters, did not overcome him.

original: ṃ sadhanyas tvotās tava praṇīty aśyāma vājān
analyzed: ṃ sadhanyaḥ tvotāḥ tava praṇītī vājān
translated: Through you, O Agni, may we be most wealthy, urged on by you may we win strength.

original: ubhā śagṃsā sūdaya satyatāte 'nuṣṭhuyā kṛṇuhy ahrayāṇa🔽ayā te agne samidhā vidhema prati stomag
analyzed: ubhā śagṃsā sūdaya satyatāte nuṣṭhuyā kṛṇuhi ahrayāṇa  ayā te agne samidhā vidhema prati stoma g
translated: O you whose thoughts are true, unite both your powers, make them ready, and roar.
O Agni, we will serve you with this fuel; accept the praise-song being sung to you.

original: dahāśaso rakṣasaḥ pāhy asmān druho nido mitramaho avadyāt
analyzed: daha aśasaḥ rakṣasaḥ pāhi asmān druhaḥ nidaḥ mitra mahas
translated: Burn up the Raksases, O you of burning flame, protect us from the treacherous snare, O you who are the friend of men, from blame.

original: rakṣohaṇaṃ vājinam ā jigharmi mitraṃ prathiṣṭham upa yāmi śarma
analyzed: rakṣaḥ haṇam vājinam ā jigharmi mitram prathiṣṭham upa yāmi śarma
translated: I warm the powerful one who slays the Raksases; I go to the widest friend for protection.

original: śiśāno agniḥ kratubhis samiddhas sa no divā sa riṣaḥ pātu naktam
analyzed: śiśānaḥ agniḥ kratubhiḥ samiddhaḥ sa naḥ divā sa riṣaḥ pātu naktam
translated: Agni, being sharpened by the sacrifices, may he protect us by day and night from distress.

original: vi jyotiṣā bṛhatā bhāty agnir āvir viśvāni kṛṇute mahītvā🔽prādevīr māyās sahate durevāś śiśīte śṛṅge rakṣase vinikṣe

original: devī viṣṇur māṃ pātv asmin deśe pra tad viṣṇur hiraṇyavarṇāḥ pavamānas suvarjano
analyzed: devī viṣṇuḥ mām pātu asmin deśe pra tat viṣṇuḥ hiraṇya varṇāḥ pavamānaḥ suvarjano
translated: The goddess. May Vishnu protect me in this place. That Vishnu, of golden color, the purifier, the one with the heavenly path,

original: medase nama eto nv indraṃ viṣṇur māṃ pātu rudhirāya tvace namo jīvāya namo brahma
analyzed: medase namaḥ eta u nu indram viṣṇuḥ mām pātu rudhirāya tvace namaḥ jīvāya namaḥ brahma
translated: For the fat. Salutations. Let us go to Indra. May Vishnu protect me from blood. Salutations to the skin. Salutations to the living being. Salutations to the Brahman.

original: jajñānam ācāryaṃ tvām ahaṃ vāstoṣpate maulimālāyai svāhā sthūpikāyai svāhā
analyzed: jajñānam ācāryam tvām aham vāstoṣpate svāhā sthūpikāyai svāhā
translated: The one born. I invoke you, the teacher. You, O Vastospati. Salutations to the garland of flowers. Salutations to the pinnacle.

original: śuddhā ime śukram asy agnim īle gārhapatyayajñam āvāhayāmīṣe tvorje tvāpo vā idag
analyzed: śuddhāḥ ime śukram asi agnim īḍe gārhapatya yajñam āvāhayāmi iṣe tvā ūrje tvā apaḥ vai idak
translated: These are pure. You are the pure essence. I invoke Agni. I invoke the Garhapatya fire. I invoke the sacrifice. I offer to you for food. I offer to you for strength. The waters are this.

original: ṃ sarvam ātmātmāṇor aṇīyān ato devā idaṃ viṣṇur om āyātu bhagavān atharvavedam āvāhayāmi
analyzed: sarvam ātmā ātmā aṇoḥ aṇīyān atas devāḥ idam viṣṇuḥ om āyātu bhagavān atharvavedam āvāhayāmi
translated: The entire self is smaller than the smallest. From that the gods. This is Vishnu. Om. May the Blessed One come. I invoke the Atharvaveda.

original: dhārāsu saptasu vedāham etam oṃ viṣṇum āvāhayāmy oṃ hotar ehi viṣṇave svāhaikacatvārigmśat
analyzed: dhārāsu saptasu veda aham etam om viṣṇum āvāhayāmi om hotar ehi viṣṇave svāhā ekacatvāriṃśat
translated: In the seven streams. I know this. Om. I invoke Vishnu. Om. O Hotar, come. To Vishnu, svāhā. One hundred and four.

original: priyatāṃ bhagavān druhiṇyai svāhā rudrājam āvāhāyāmy atra svasti savitādite

original: hariḥ oṃ tatth sat🔽Śrī Śrī vikhanasa mahāgurave namaḥ
analyzed: hariḥ om tatth sat  śrī śrī vikhanasa mahā gurave namaḥ
translated: Hari Om Tat Sat
Salutations to the illustrious great preceptor of the Vaikhanasa lineage.🔽In the eight questions of the Vaikhanasa Mantras,
The beginning of the sixty-first question.
Hari Om

original: ato devā avantu no yato viṣṇur vicakrame
analyzed: atas devāḥ avantu naḥ yatas viṣṇuḥ vicakrame
translated: May the gods protect us from there, from where Vishnu has spread.
To the seven abodes of the earth, svāhā.

original: idaṃ viṣṇur vi cakrame tredhā ni dadhe padam
analyzed: idam viṣṇuḥ vi cakrame tredhā ni dadhe padam
translated: This Vishnu has spread, he has placed his foot in three ways.
The beginning of this,
to the gods, svāhā.

original: trīṇi padā vi cakrame viṣṇur gopā adābhyaḥ
analyzed: trīṇi padā vi cakrame viṣṇuḥ gopāḥ adābhyaḥ
translated: Vishnu, the protector, the infallible one, has spread with three steps.
From there, upholding the laws, svāhā.

original: viṣṇoḥ karmāṇi paśyata yato vratāni paspaśe
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ karmāṇi paśyata yatas vratāni paspaśe
translated: Behold the deeds of Vishnu, from where he has observed the vows.
The friend of Indra, who is to be yoked, svāhā.
That is the highest place of Vishnu,
the wise always behold it,
like an eye stretched out in the sky, svāhā.

original: tad viprāso vipanyavo jāgṛvāṃsas sam indhate
analyzed: tat viprāsaḥ vipanyavaḥ jāgṛvāṃsaḥ sam indhate
translated: The wise ones, the discerning ones, the watchful ones, kindle it,
the highest place of Vishnu, svāhā.
From that
an eye stretched out,
svāhā, and two

analyzed: sahasra śīrṣā puruṣaḥ sahasra akṣaḥ sahasra pād
translated: The Person has a thousand heads, a thousand eyes, a thousand feet,

original: sa bhūmiṃ viśvato vṛtvāty atiṣṭad daśāṅgulaggṃ svāhā🔽puruṣa evedag
analyzed: sa bhūmim viśvatas vṛtvā ati atiṣṭat daśa aṅgu laggṃ svāhā  puruṣaḥ eva idak
translated: he pervades this earth on all sides and stands ten finger-breadths beyond. Svāhā.

original: ṃ sarvaṃ yad bhūtaṃ yac ca bhavyam
analyzed: sarvam yat bhūtam yat ca bhavyam
translated: The Person indeed is this all. Whatever has been and whatever will be,

original: utāmṛtatvasyeśāno yad annenātirohati svāhā🔽etāvān asya mahimāto jyāyāg
analyzed: uta amṛta tvasya īśānaḥ yat annena atirohati svāhā  etāvān asya mahimā atas jyāyāc
translated: and the Lord of immortality that which transcends food. Svāhā.
So great is his greatness. The Person is greater than that.

original: pādo 'sya viśvā bhūtāni tripād asyāmṛtaṃ divi svāhā
analyzed: pādaḥ u sya viśvā bhūtāni tri pād asya amṛtam divi svāhā
translated: His feet are all existing things. Three of his feet are immortal in heaven. Svāhā.

original: tripād ūrdhva ud ait puruṣaḥ pādo 'syehābhavāt punaḥ
analyzed: tri pād ūrdhvaḥ ud ait puruṣaḥ pāda u sya iha abhavāt punar
translated: The Person rose up, three-footed, above this (earth). One foot of him is here again.

original: tato viṣvaṅ vy akrāmat sāśanānaśane abhi svāhā
analyzed: tatas viṣvaṅ vi akrāmat sa aśana anaśane abhi svāhā
translated: From that he went forth in all directions, over the eaten and the uneaten. Svāhā.

original: tasmād virāḍ ajāyata virājo adhi pūruṣaḥ
translated: From that the Virāj was born. From the Virāj the Person.

original: sa jāto aty aricyata paścād bhūmim atho puras svāhā🔽Begin TA /🔽RV / virāl
analyzed: sa jātaḥ ati aricyata paścāt bhūmim atha u puras svāhā 🔽begin 🔽ru virāl
translated: When he was born, he surpassed in greatness the earth and the heaven.

original: yat puruṣena haviṣā devā yajñam atanvata
analyzed: yat puruṣena haviṣā devāḥ yajñam atanvata
translated: When the gods spread the sacrifice with the oblation of Purusha,

original: vasanto asyāsīd ājyam grīṣma idhmaś śarad dhavis svāhā
analyzed: vasantaḥ asya āsīt ājyam grīṣmaḥ idhmaḥ śarad haviḥ svāhā
translated: Spring was its ghee, summer its fuel, autumn its offering, Svâhâ!

original: saptāsyāsan paridhayas tris sapta samidhaḥ kṛtāḥ
analyzed: sapta asya āsan paridhayaḥ tris sapta samidhaḥ kṛtāḥ
translated: Seven were its enclosing-sticks, thrice seven the kindling-sticks prepared,

original: devā yad yajñaṃ tanvānā abadhnan puruṣaṃ paśuggṃ svāhā
analyzed: devāḥ yat yajñam tanvānāḥ abadhnan puruṣam paśuggṃ
translated: When the gods, spreading the sacrifice, bound Purusha as the sacrificial animal, Svâhâ!

original: taṃ yajñaṃ barhiṣi praukṣan puruṣaṃ jātam agrataḥ
analyzed: tam yajñam barhiṣi praukṣan puruṣam jātam agratas
translated: They strewed that sacrifice on the sacrificial grass, the first-born Purusha,

original: tena devā ayajanta sādhyā ṛṣayaś ca ye svāhā
analyzed: tena devāḥ ayajanta sādhyāḥ ṛṣayaḥ ca ye svāhā
translated: With him the gods offered sacrifice, and the Sâdhyas and the Rishis, Svâhâ!

original: tasmād yajñāth sarvahutas saṃbhṛtaṃ pṛṣadājyaṃ🔽paśūgṃs tāg
analyzed: tasmāt sarva hutaḥ saṃbhṛtam pṛṣadājyam  paśūgṃn tāk
translated: From that sacrifice, the All-conquering, the mixed ghee was produced,🔽And the sacrificial animals,

original: ṃś cakre vāyavyān āraṇyān grāmyāś ca ye svāhā🔽tasmād yajñāth sarvahuto ṛcas sāmāni jajñire
analyzed: cakre vāyavyān āraṇyān grāmyāḥ ca ye svāhā  tasmāt ṛcaḥ sāmāni jajñire
translated: and the wild beasts and the domestic animals that belong to Vâyu, Svâhâ!🔽From that sacrifice, the All-conquering, the Rikas and Sâmans were born,

original: chandāgṃsi jajñire tasmād yajus tasmād ajāyata svāhā
analyzed: chandāgṃsi jajñire tasmāt yajuḥ tasmāt ajāyata svāhā
translated: The metres were born from it, and from it the Yagus was produced, Svâhâ!

original: RV / / out of order / TA / VC p / 🔽RV / yajñāt
analyzed: ru out order ta vc p  ru yajñāt
translated: Out of order.🔽From the sacrifice
From the sacrifice
The All-conquering

original: tasmād aśvā ajāyanta ye ke cobhayādataḥ
analyzed: tasmāt aśvāḥ ajāyanta ye ke ca ubhaya adataḥ
translated: From it were born the horses, and all the animals with two rows of teeth,

original: gāvo ha jajñire tasmāt tasmāj jātā ajāvayas svāhā
analyzed: gāvaḥ ha jajñire tasmāt tasmāt jātāḥ aja avayaḥ svāhā
translated: And cows were born from it, and from it goats and sheep were born, Svâhâ!

original: yat puruṣam vy adadhuḥ katidhā vy kalpayan
analyzed: yat puruṣam vi adadhuḥ katidhā vi kalpayan
translated: When they divided Purusha how many portions did they make?

original: mukhaṃ kim asya kau bāhū kā ūrū pādāv ucyete svāhā
analyzed: mukham kim asya kau bāhū kau ūrū ucyete svāhā
translated: What is his mouth? What are his arms? What are said to be his thighs and feet? Svāhā

original: brāhmaṇo 'sya mukham āsīd bāhū rājanyaḥ kṛtaḥ
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ sya mukham āsīt bāhū rājanyaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: His mouth became the Brahmin, his arms were made the Kshatriya,

original: ūrū tad asya yad vaiśyaḥ padbhyāg
analyzed: ūrū tat asya yat vaiśyaḥ padbhyāk
translated: His thighs that which is the Vaishya, from his feet
The Shudra was born. Svāhā

original: candramā manaso jātaś cakṣos sūryo ajāyata🔽mukhād indraś cāgniś ca prāṇād vāyur ajāyata svāhā
analyzed: candramāḥ manasaḥ jātaḥ cakṣoḥ sūryaḥ ajāyata  mukhāt indraḥ ca agniḥ ca prāṇāt vāyuḥ ajāyata svāhā
translated: The moon was born from the mind, the sun was born from the eye,🔽From the mouth Indra and Agni, from the breath the wind was born. Svāhā

original: nābhyā āsīd antarikṣaṃ śīrṣṇo dyaus sam avartata🔽padbhyāṃ bhūmir diśaś śrotrāt tathā lokāg
analyzed: nābhyāḥ āsīt antarikṣam śīrṣṇaḥ dyauḥ sam avartata  padbhyām bhūmiḥ diśaḥ śrotrāt tathā lokāk
translated: The atmosphere was from his navel, from his head the sky was formed,
From his feet the earth, from his ears the directions, thus they created the worlds. Svāhā

original: vedāham etaṃ puruṣaṃ mahāntam ādityavarṇaṃ tamasas tu pāre
analyzed: veda aham etam puruṣam mahāntam āditya varṇam tamasaḥ tu pāre
translated: I know this great Person, of the color of the sun, beyond darkness,

original: sarvāṇi rūpāṇi vicitya dhīro nāmāni kṛtvābhivadan yadāste svāhā
analyzed: sarvāṇi rūpāṇi vicitya nāmāni kṛtvā abhivadan yadā āste svāhā
translated: Having pervaded all forms, the wise one, speaking with names, as he abides. Svāhā

original: dhātā purastād yam udājahāra śakrah pravidvān pradiśaś catasraḥ
analyzed: dhātā purastāt yam udājahāra śakraḥ pravidvān pradiśaḥ catasraḥ
translated: Dhatr proclaimed him in the east, Shakra, the knower, the four directions,

original: tam evaṃ vidvān amṛta iha bhavati nānyah panthā ayanāya vidyate svāhā
analyzed: tam evam vidvān amṛtaḥ iha bhavati na anyaḥ panthāḥ ayanāya vidyate

analyzed: bhūmiḥ bhūmnā dyauḥ variṇā antarikṣam mahitvā
translated: Earth by its extent, sky by its expanse, the atmosphere by its greatness,

original: upasthe te devy adite 'gnim annādam annādyāyādadhe svāhā
analyzed: upasthe te devi adite gnim anna adam annādyāya ādadhe
translated: In your lap, O divine Aditi, I have placed Agni, the eater of food, for the sake of food. Svāhā.

original: āyaṃ gauḥ pṛśnir akramīd asanan mātaraṃ punaḥ
analyzed: ā ayam gauḥ pṛśniḥ akramīt asanat mātaram punar
translated: This speckled cow has come forth, having made her mother sit down again,
And her father, having praised. Svāhā.

original: trigṃśad dhāma vi rājati vāk pataṅgāya śiśriye
analyzed: trigṃśat dhāma vi rājati vāc pataṅgāya śiśriye
translated: The thirtyfold abode shines forth. Speech has mounted the bird.
Return with its lights. Svāhā.

original: asya prāṇād apānaty antaś carati rocanā
analyzed: asya prāṇāt apānatī antar carati rocanā
translated: From his in-breath and out-breath, it moves within the luminous realm.
The great bull has opened up the heaven. Svāhā.

original: ya tvā kruddhaḥ paro vapa manyunā yad avartyā
analyzed: tvā kruddhaḥ paras vapa manyunā yat avartyā
translated: What you, being angry, have cast away in wrath, what you have turned away from,

original: sukalpam agne tat tava punas tvod dīpayāmasi svāhā
analyzed: su kalpam agne tat tava punar tvā ud dīpayāmasi
translated: That is well-formed for you, O Agni. We kindle you again. Svāhā.

original: TS / prayant suvaḥ replaces prayan sthuvas
analyzed: ts prayan suvar replaces prayan sthuvas
translated: vvc replaces pratan sthuva

analyzed: yat te manyu paroptasya pṛthivīm anu dadhvase
translated: What you, being angry, have placed upon the earth,

original: ādityā viśve tad devā vasavaś ca samābharan svāhā
analyzed: ādityāḥ viśve tat devāḥ vasavaḥ ca samābharan
translated: The Ādityas, the Viśve Devas, and the Vasus all brought it together, svāhā.🔽May the mind, the light, enjoy the ghee.

original: mano jyotir juṣatām ājyaṃ vicchinnaṃ yajñag🔽ṃ sam imaṃ dadhātu
analyzed: manaḥ jyotiḥ juṣatām ājyam vicchinnam yajña ga  ṃ sam imam dadhātu

original: bṛhaspatis tanutām imaṃ no viśve devā iha mādayantāgṃ svāhā
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ tanutām imam naḥ viśve devāḥ iha mādayanta agm
translated: May Bṛhaspati extend this for us. May all the gods rejoice here in the fire, svāhā.

original: sapta te agne samidhas sapta jihvās sapta ṛṣayas sapta dhāma priyāṇi
analyzed: sapta te agne samidhaḥ sapta jihvāḥ sapta ṛṣayaḥ sapta dhāma priyāṇi
translated: You have seven kinds of fuel, O Agni, seven tongues, seven ṛṣis, seven dear abodes,

original: sapta hotrās saptadhā tvā yajanti sapta yonīr ā pṛṇasvā ghṛtena svāhā
analyzed: sapta hotrāḥ saptadhā tvā yajanti sapta yonīḥ ā pṛṇasva ghṛtena
translated: Seven priests offer you in seven ways. Fill yourself with the seven wombs with ghee, svāhā.

original: punar ūrjā ni vartasva punar agna iṣāyuṣā
analyzed: punar ūrjā ni vartasva punar agne iṣā āyuṣā
translated: Return again with strength, return again, O Agni, with food and life,
Protect us again from all sides, svāhā.

original: saha rayyā ni vartasvāgne pinvasva dhārayā
analyzed: saha rayyā ni vartasva agne pinvasva dhārayā
translated: Return with wealth, O Agni, swell with your stream,
With all-pervading, from all sides, svāhā.

original: medinī devī vasuṃdharī syād vasudhā devī vāsavī
analyzed: medinī devī vasuṃdharī syāt vasudhā devī vāsavī
translated: May the goddess Medini, the supporter of wealth, be the goddess Vasundhari, the bearer of wealth,
May the father's Brahmic glory,
May the ear be Vishnu, the mind, svāhā.
O goddess, you who are filled with gold, O goddess, you who have a protruding belly,
Sit in the true path of the tongue, svāhā.

analyzed: samudravatī sāvitrī iha naḥ devī mahyakī
translated: O Savitri, you who are full of the ocean, be our great goddess,
O great earth, stand firm, great support, svāhā.
On the peak, at the peak, in the sacrifice, in the sacrifice, the frightening one

analyzed: indra patnī vyājanī su rasitā iha
translated: The wife of Indra, the announcer, the divine sound, here, svāhā
The one who lies in the water, the one who is surrounded by the wind, the one who has a natural flow, the one who has true words, the one who moves around the earth
Place her above, svāhā to the one who has a cow

analyzed: dhanurdharāyai vidmahe sarva siddhyai ca dhīmahi
translated: We meditate on the one who has a bow, we contemplate all accomplishments
May she inspire us, svāhā

analyzed: punar tvā uddīpayāmasi svāhā viśvatas pari svāhā sa upari dhattaṃgāya svāhā dve

To Agni, the wise one, svāhā🔽To the Ādityas, svāhā
To the Viśvedevas, svāhā
To the hosts of Maruts, svāhā

original: bhūr agnaye ca pṛthivyai ca mahate ca svāhā
analyzed: bhūḥ agnaye ca pṛthivyai ca mahate ca svāhā
translated: Bhūḥ, svāhā, to Agni and to Earth and to the Great One

original: bhuvo vāyave cāntarikṣāya ca mahate ca svāhā
analyzed: bhuvaḥ vāyave ca antarikṣāya ca mahate ca svāhā
translated: Bhuvaḥ, svāhā, to Vāyu and to the Atmosphere and to the Great One

original: suvar ādityāya ca dive ca mahate ca svāhā
analyzed: suvar ādityāya ca dive ca mahate ca svāhā
translated: Suvaḥ, svāhā, to Āditya and to Heaven and to the Great One

original: bhūr bhuvas suvaś candramase ca nakṣatrebhyaś ca digbhyaś ca mahate ca svāhā
analyzed: bhūḥ bhuvaḥ suvar candramase ca nakṣatrebhyaḥ ca digbhyaḥ ca mahate ca svāhā
translated: Bhūḥ, Bhuvaḥ, Suvaḥ, svāhā, to the Moon and to the Stars and to the Directions and to the Great One

original: imam me varuṇa prajāpate na tvac cittaṃ cāgnir bhūtānām ṛtāṣāṭ
analyzed: imam me varuṇa prajāpate na tvat cittam ca agniḥ bhūtānām ṛtāṣāh
translated: This is my mind, O Varuṇa, O Prajāpati, your mind, O Agni, the lord of beings, the fulfiller of truth.

original: yad devā yad devā yad adīvyan āyuṣ ṭe vaiśvānarāya
analyzed: yat devāḥ yat devāḥ yat āyuḥ te vaiśvānarāya
translated: Whatever the gods, whatever the gods have gambled, life to you, to Vaisvānara.

original: cirāyuṣaṃ yaṃ pravadanti dhīrās samastavedārthavidāṃ varāya
analyzed: cira āyuṣam yam pravadanti dhīrāḥ samasta veda artha vidām varāya
translated: To the best among those who know the meaning of the entire Veda,
to the great sage Markandeya, svāhā.

original: puṇyaughaniṣṭhāya purātanāya nityātmane brahmavidāṃ varāya svāhā
analyzed: puṇya ogha niṣṭhāya purātanāya nitya ātmane brahma vidām varāya svāhā
translated: To the ancient one who has perfected the flow of merit, to the one whose soul is eternal, to the best among those who know Brahman, svāhā.
To the father of Lakṣmī, the best among the upholders of the Vedas,
to the one of great valor, of immeasurable splendor, svāhā.
To the great sage Bhṛgu, the eternal Brahman,
to the soul of Brahman, to the son of Brahman, svāhā.
Cf. VMP

original: brahma jajñānaṃ prathamaṃ purastād visīmatas suruco vena āvaḥ
analyzed: brahma jajñānam prathamam purastāt visīmataḥ su rucaḥ venaḥ āvaḥ
translated: The Brahman, born first, in the beginning, from the boundless, Vena brought forth the well-shining one.

original: sa budhniyā upamā asya viṣṭhās sataś ca yonim asataś ca vivas svāhā
analyzed: sa budhniyāḥ upamāḥ asya viṣṭhāḥ sataḥ ca yonim a sataḥ ca vivas svāhā
translated: His abode is in the depths of the waters, the womb of the existent and the non-existent, svāhā.

original: hiraṇyagarbhas sam avartatāgre bhūtasya jātaḥ patir eka āsīt
analyzed: hiraṇya garbhaḥ sam avartata agre bhūtasya jātaḥ patiḥ ekaḥ āsīt
translated: Hiranyagarbha, in the beginning, was born, the lord of what was created, he was alone.

original: sa dādhāra pṛthivīṃ dyām utemāṃ kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema svāhā
analyzed: sa dādhāra pṛthivīm dyām uta imām kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema svāhā
translated: He supports the earth and this sky. To which god shall we offer oblation? Svāhā.

original: rudram anyaṃ bahuto hutaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ namas te astu
analyzed: rudram anyam bahutas hutam vṛṣabham namaḥ te astu
translated: Another Rudra, much offered, like a bull, homage to you.

original: tan me astu bāhubhyāṃ vītaye svāhā
analyzed: tat me astu bāhubhyām vītaye svāhā
translated: Let that be for me to enjoy with my arms, svāhā.
We worship the three-eyed one, fragrant, the increaser of prosperity,

original: urvārukam iva bandhanān mṛtyor mukṣīya mā 'mṛtāt svāhā
analyzed: urvārukam iva bandhanāt mṛtyoḥ mukṣīya mā mṛtāt svāhā
translated: like a cucumber from bondage, may I be freed from death, not from immortality, svāhā.

original: dyāvāpṛthivyoś śug aśuk sanniyoktroḥ🔽sammānyayoḥ khyātī tu kauram etāgṃ svāhā
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivyoḥ śuc a śuc sanniyoktroḥ  sammānyayoḥ khyātī tu kauram svāhā
translated: The heat of heaven and earth, well-joined,🔽of the two honored ones, let fame be to the Kaura family, svāhā.

original: yasyāś śriyo vā anujā agrajāyā yām evājasrag
analyzed: yasyāḥ śriyaḥ vai anujāḥ agra jāyāḥ yām eva ajasrak
translated: Of that glory which is the younger sister of the elder, which is always
well-offered by the two all-knowing ones,
to those two pleased ones,

analyzed: ṃ hrāsa vṛddhī bhaveta agṃ svāhā
translated: let there be decrease and increase, svāhā.
By the firmness of the firm ones, he supports those which are praised,

original: yasyeha tasmai bhuva evaṃ juhomi svāhā
analyzed: yasya iha tasmai bhuvaḥ evam juhomi svāhā
translated: to him here, to that one, I offer this, svāhā.

original: ya eṣa bibhraty uru tejaḥ pataṅgaḥ🔽divas pari stho bhavato yasya vettu svāhā
analyzed: yaḥ eṣa bibhrati uru tejaḥ pataṅgaḥ  divaḥ pari sthaḥ bhavataḥ yasya vettu svāhā
translated: This bird who bears great splendor,🔽around the heaven, you two are established, to whom I know, svāhā.

original: vi tatya viśvaṃ vidadhāty ṛtaṃn naḥ
translated: He spreads out everything, he establishes the truth for us,

original: vṛtyā vṛttaṃ tasya nītaṃ tam etat svāhā
analyzed: vṛtyā vṛttam tasya nītam tam etat svāhā
translated: the conduct that has been conducted, that has been led to this, svāhā.

original: yo no 'bhirakṣaty avamāya nas tu yas trayyā saṃvardhayan pūrayati
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ bhirakṣati avamāya naḥ  yaḥ trayyā saṃvardhayan pūrayati
translated: He who protects us, who does not oppress us, who, increasing with the three, fills,
To him, distributing all the meters, that

original: ṃ sā no devī mānasīm ānam etāgṃ svāhā
translated: That goddess, the mental one, has brought this to us, svāhā.
Edition.
Edition. But despising

analyzed: muni indram brahma nityāya vara utkṛṣṭāya
translated: The lord of sages, to the one who is always Brahman, to the one who is excellent with boons,
To the chief doorkeeper, to Maṇika, svāhā.

analyzed: sandhyāyai muni patnyai prabhāvatyai dṛḍha vratāyai svāhā
translated: To Sandhyā, the sage's wife, to Prabhāvatī, who is firm in her vows, svāhā.
To the Vaikhānasa, who is devoted to Acyuta,
To the one who is steadfast in intense austerities, and to the one who sees Brahman, svāhā.
To the ascetic, to the king of accomplishments,
To the one who has conquered, to the one who has performed a thousand horse sacrifices, svāhā.
To Kiṣkindhā, to the one who crushes many,
To the one with many armies, to the one who is firm in his vows, svāhā.
To the holy place, to the one who grants all happiness,

original: sarvayogyāya sarvadarśine svāhā🔽mahate ca svāhā brahmasutāya svāhā kauram etāg🔽ṃ svāhā mānam etāg
analyzed: sarva yogyāya sarva darśine svāhā  mahate ca svāhā brahma sutāya svāhā kauram etāg  ṃ svāhā mānam etāk
translated: To the one who is suitable for everything, to the one who sees everything, svāhā.

original: ṃ svāhā dṛdhavratāya svāhā dve ca
analyzed: ṃ svāhā dṛdhavratāya svāhā dve ca
translated: And to the great one, svāhā. To the son of Brahmā, svāhā. To the one who is to be honored, svāhā. To the one who is to be respected, svāhā. To the one who is firm in his vows, svāhā. And two

original: trātāram indram avitāram indrag🔽ṃ havehave suhavag🔽ṃ śūram indram
analyzed: trātāram indram avitāram indra gā  ṃ havehave su havak  ṃ śūram indram
translated: To Indra, the protector, to Indra, the deliverer,🔽To the good Indra to be invoked in every invocation,🔽To the heroic Indra,
I invoke Indra, the powerful, the invoked by many, the mighty one,

original: ṃ svasti no maghavā dhātv indras svāhā
analyzed: ṃ svasti naḥ maghavā dhātu indraḥ
translated: May the bountiful Indra bestow well-being upon us, svāhā.

original: mahāgṃ indro ya ojasā parjanyo vṛṣṭimāgṃ iva
analyzed: indraḥ yaḥ ojasā parjanyaḥ vṛṣṭimān iva
translated: Indra, the great one, who with might is like Parjanya with rain,
has grown with the praises of Vatsa, svāhā.

original: mahāgṃ indro nṛvad ā carṣaṇiprā uta dvibarhā aminas sahobhiḥ
analyzed: indraḥ nṛ vat ā carṣaṇi prāḥ uta dvibarhāḥ aminaḥ sahobhiḥ
translated: Indra, the great one, like a man, the leader of the people, with his twofold strength, with his irresistible might,

original: asmadriyag vāvṛdhe vīryāyoruḥ pṛthus sukṛtaḥ kartṛbhir bhūt svāhā
analyzed: asmadriyak vāvṛdhe vīryāya uruḥ pṛthuḥ su kṛtaḥ kartṛbhiḥ bhūt
translated: has grown near to us for heroic power. May the vast, wide one, well-made by the makers, be for us, svāhā.

original: bhuvas tvam indra brahmaṇā mahān bhuvo viśveṣu savaneṣu yajñiyaḥ
analyzed: bhuvaḥ tvam indra brahmaṇā mahān bhuvaḥ viśveṣu savaneṣu yajñiyaḥ
translated: You have become great, O Indra, through the holy power; you have become worthy of sacrifice at all the libations;

original: bhuvo nṝgṃś cyautno viśvasmin bhare jyeṣṭhaś ca mantro viśvacarṣaṇe svāhā
analyzed: bhuvaḥ nṝn cyautnaḥ viśvasmin bhare jyeṣṭhaḥ ca mantraḥ viśvacarṣaṇe
translated: you have become the lord of men, the shaker, in every contest; and the highest prayer, O you who are worshipped by all, svāhā.

analyzed: ā indra sānasik  ṃ ra yik  ṃ sa jitvā anag
translated: O Indra, the one who prospers,🔽the one who brings wealth,🔽the victorious one,
the ever-conquering one,
bring the highest help, svāhā.🔽I invoke🔽RV🔽VS🔽MK

original: pra sasāhiṣe puruhūta śatrūñ jyeṣṭhas te śuṣma iha rātir astu🔽indrā bhara dakṣiṇenā vasūni patis sindhūnām asi revatīnāgṃ svāhā
analyzed: pra sasāhiṣe puruhūta śatrūm jyeṣṭhaḥ te śuṣmaḥ iha rātiḥ astu  indra ā bhara dakṣiṇena vasūni patiḥ sindhūnām asi revatīnām
translated: O Indra, you conquer the enemies, may your highest strength be here, may your bounty be here🔽O Indra, bring the treasures with your right hand, you are the lord of the rivers and the abundant ones, svāhā

original: asmākam indras samṛteṣu dhvajeṣv asmākaṃ yā iṣavas tā jayantu
analyzed: asmākam indraḥ samṛteṣu asmākam yāḥ iṣavaḥ tāḥ jayantu
translated: May Indra be with our victorious banners, may our arrows be victorious

original: asmākaṃ vīrā uttare bhavantv asmān u devā avatā haveṣu svāhā
analyzed: asmākam vīrāḥ uttare bhavantu asmān u devāḥ avata haveṣu
translated: May our heroes be superior, may the gods help us in our invocations, svāhā

original: indro 'bhūd asya bhuvanasya rājendro dādhāra pṛthivīn dyām ute mām
analyzed: indraḥ bhūt asya bhuvanasya rājā indraḥ dādhāra pṛthivīn dyām uta e mām
translated: Indra has become the king of this world, Indra supports the earth and the sky and me

original: indro ha viśvāni bhūtāni bhuvanāśritāni svāhā
analyzed: indraḥ ha viśvāni bhūtāni bhuvana āśritāni svāhā
translated: Indra is all the beings and the worlds that rest on him, svāhā

original: indro dyaur vyoma bhūr indras samudbhava no virāṭ paśca
analyzed: indraḥ dyauḥ vyoma bhūḥ indraḥ samudbhava naḥ virāj paśca
translated: Indra is the sky, the firmament, the earth, Indra is the origin of the world, the great one, the all-encompassing one, in the west

original: urvantarikṣasvargapavanam indrād indraṃ manye pitaraṃ mātaraṃ ca svāhā
analyzed: uru antarikṣa svarga pavanam indrāt indram manye pitaram mātaram ca svāhā
translated: The wide atmosphere, the heavenly wind, I consider Indra to be the father and the mother, svāhā
Indra, the one who is led forth, the form, Indra-Agni
the one who flows,
may Savitar place Indra

original: śakras sukṛtasya lokam indraṃ manye pitaraṃ mātaraṃ ca svāhā
analyzed: śakraḥ sukṛtasya lokam indram manye pitaram mātaram ca svāhā
translated: Śakra, the world of the virtuous, I consider Indra to be the father and the mother, svāhā
etc.

analyzed: indraḥ vṛtram vajreṇa avadhīt indraḥ vyayaḥ samudra śuṣkaḥ
translated: Indra killed Vṛtra with the thunderbolt, Indra dried up the ocean

original: indraṃ manye pitaraṃ mātaraṃ ca svāhā
analyzed: indram manye pitaram mātaram ca svāhā
translated: I think of Indra as the father and mother, svāhā

analyzed: indraḥ babhūva brahmaṇaḥ gambhīram ābhūti parituṣṭiḥ
translated: Indra became the profound Brahman, satisfied with prosperity

original: indro bhaviṣyad uta bhūtam indraṃ manye pitaraṃ mātaraṃ ca svāhā
analyzed: indraḥ bhaviṣyat uta bhūtam indram manye pitaram mātaram ca svāhā
translated: I think of Indra as the future and the past, the father and mother, svāhā

original: indro 'smān avatu vajrabāhur indro bhūtāni bhuvanāni
analyzed: indraḥ smān avatu vajra bāhuḥ indraḥ bhūtāni bhuvanāni
translated: May Indra, with his thunderbolt arm, protect us, may Indra

original: indro 'smākam avatu vajraprasādam indraṃ manye pitaraṃ mātaraṃ ca svāhā
analyzed: indraḥ smākam avatu vajra prasādam indram manye pitaram mātaram ca
translated: I think of Indra as the father and mother, svāhā

original: agnir mūrdhā divaḥ kakutpatiḥ pṛthivyā ayam🔽apāgṃ retāg
analyzed: agniḥ mūrdhā divaḥ kakud patiḥ pṛthivyāḥ ayam  apāk retāk
translated: Agni is the head of the sky, the lord of the earth🔽Agni impels the seed
to growth, svāhā

original: ayam agnis sahasriṇo vājasya śatinas patiḥ
analyzed: ayam agniḥ sahasriṇaḥ vājasya śatinaḥ patiḥ
translated: This Agni is the lord of a thousandfold strength and a hundredfold wealth
The head of the wise, the wealth-giver, Agni, svāhā
Ms. . . . Vc. P.

original: yamo dādhāra pṛthivīṃ yamo dyām uta sūryaḥ
analyzed: yamaḥ dādhāra pṛthivīm yamaḥ dyām uta
translated: Yama upholds the earth, Yama the sky and the sun

original: yamas sarvamṛtyus stenaḥ prāṇānāṃ vāyūnāgṃ svāhā
analyzed: yamaḥ sarva mṛtyuḥ prāṇānām vāyūnām agm svāhā
translated: Yama, the lord of death, the thief of life, the wind, the fire, hail!

original: namas te nirṛtaye ghanatejāya tasmai visṛja bandhanāt
analyzed: namaḥ te nirṛtaye ghana tejāya tasmai visṛja bandhanāt
translated: Homage to you, O Yama, to the one with dense splendor, release him from bondage!
O Yama, lead him!

original: ṃ savitā deva uttamān anīke abhirocaya yāyināgṃ svāhā
analyzed: savitā devaḥ uttamān anīke abhirocaya svāhā
translated: May Savitar, the god, the most excellent one, shine forth in the highest region, the moving one, hail!
The Vasus are the first of the gods,

analyzed: ṃ saḥ sya prajām paśūn pāhi
translated: protect his offspring and cattle.

original: ato devebhyaḥ paśubhir yo vai vasavas svasty astu svāhā
analyzed: atas devebhyaḥ paśubhiḥ yaḥ vai vasavaḥ svasti astu svāhā
translated: From them, the gods, with the animals, he who is the Vasus, may he be well, hail!

original: sahasrākṣo vā ayam agniḥ pitaro devatānām
analyzed: sahasra akṣaḥ vai ayam agniḥ pitaraḥ devatānām
translated: This Agni has a thousand eyes, the Pitrs are the gods.

original: vasūn yatra vasavo bhūtānāṃ pālayanti tasmā anyavasubhya svāhā
analyzed: vasūn yatra vasavaḥ bhūtānām pālayanti tasmai anya vasubhyaḥ svāhā
translated: Where the Vasus, the Vasus of beings, protect, for that reason to the other Vasus, hail!

original: ye te śataṃ varuṇa ye sahasraṃ yajñiyāḥ pāśā vitatāḥ purutrā
analyzed: ye te śatam varuṇa ye sahasram yajñiyāḥ pāśāḥ vitatāḥ purutrā
translated: O Varuṇa, your hundred, your thousand sacrificial bonds that are spread out in many places,

original: tebhyo na indras savitota viṣṇur viśvedevā muñcantu marutas svastyā svāhā
analyzed: tebhyaḥ naḥ indraḥ savitā uta viṣṇuḥ viśve devāḥ muñcantu marutaḥ svastyā svāhā
translated: from them may Indra, Savitar, and Viṣṇu, the Viśvedevas, the Maruts, release us for well-being, hail!🔽The sun
Cf. VMP

original: cf / VMP / / / / te naḥ instead of stenaḥ
translated: instead of the thief

original: ud uttamaṃ varuṇa pāśam asmad avādhamaṃ vi madhyamaggṃ śrathāya
analyzed: ud uttamam varuṇa pāśam asmat ava adhamam vi madhyamaggṃ śrathāya
translated: Raise up the highest bond of Varuna from us, loosen the lowest and the middle one.

original: athā vayam āditya vrate tavānāgaso aditaye syāma svāhā
analyzed: athā vayam āditya vrate tava anāgasaḥ aditaye syāma svāhā
translated: Then may we, O Āditya, in your vow, be sinless and belong to Aditi, hail!

analyzed: ayās ca agne si an abhiśastīḥ ca āyātaḥ
translated: And, O Agni, may I have prosperity and freedom from blame.

original: yajñaṃ vahatu sadā dhehi bheṣajaggṃ svāhā
analyzed: yajñam vahatu sadā dhehi bheṣajaggm svāhā
translated: Carry the sacrifice, always bestow healing. Svâhâ!

original: āpas sṛjantu snigdhāni ciklīta vasa me gṛhe
analyzed: āpas snigdhāni ciklīta vasa me gṛhe
translated: May the waters grant me smooth and slippery. Dwell with me in my house.

original: ni ca devīṃ mātaraṃ śriyaṃ vāsaya me kule svāhā
analyzed: ni ca devīm mātaram śriyam vāsaya me kule svāhā
translated: And the divine mother, may I dwell with Sridevi in my family. Svâhâ!

original: marutaḥ paramātmā paramā gatiḥ paraṃ brahma paraṃ yogam
analyzed: marutaḥ parama ātmā paramā gatiḥ param brahma param yogam
translated: The Maruts are the supreme self, the supreme goal, the supreme Brahman, the supreme yoga.

original: paramātmānaṃ manye ajaraṃ yo 'gnir aham annaṃ vāyave svāhā
analyzed: paramātmānam manye ajaram yaḥ gniḥ aham annam vāyave svāhā
translated: I consider the supreme self, the unborn, the fire, the food, for Vayu. Svâhâ!

original: maruto gaṇānāṃ prathamas saptadhānāṃ mūrdhā vāyo anyam ajaraggṃ śriyam
analyzed: marutaḥ gaṇānām prathamaḥ saptadhānām mūrdhā vāyo anyam ajaraggn śriyam
translated: The Maruts are the first of the groups, the head of the seven-seeded, Vâyu another unborn glory.

original: hotāraṃ vai rayan tvāhur agne havyaṃ marudbhyas svāhā
analyzed: hotāram vai rayan tvā āhuḥ agne havyam marudbhyaḥ svāhā
translated: They call the priest the wealth-giver, O Agni, the oblation for the Maruts. Svâhâ!

analyzed: miśra vāsasaḥ kauberakāḥ rakṣaḥ rājena preṣitāḥ
translated: The dwellers in mixed garments, sent by the king of the Rakshasas,

analyzed: grāma gam sa jānayaḥ gacchanti icchantaḥ svāhā
translated: Go to the village, O you with good companions, desiring to seize those who have been given up. Svâhâ!

original: etān ghnataitān gṛhṇītety ayaṃ brahmaṇas putraḥ
analyzed: etān ghnata etān gṛhṇīta iti ayam brahmaṇaḥ putraḥ
translated: Kill these, seize these, this is the son of the Brahman.

original: tān agniḥ paryasarat tān indras tān bṛhaspatiḥ
analyzed: tān agniḥ paryasarat tān indraḥ tān bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: Agni surrounded them, Indra them, Brihaspati them.

original: tān ahaṃ veda brāhmaṇaḥ pramṛśataḥ kūṭadantān vikeśāṇ lambanastanānth svāhā
analyzed: tān aham veda brāhmaṇaḥ pramṛśataḥ kūṭa dantān vikeśān svāhā
translated: I know them, the Brahman, the destroyers, the ones with pointed teeth, the ones with long hair, the ones with hanging breasts. Svâhâ!

analyzed: īśānaḥ sarva lokānām tryambakaḥ sarva vidyānām
translated: Isha is the lord of all worlds, Tryambaka of all knowledge,
Not a second for the arising of existence, hail!

original: īśa īśitre bhūr bhuvas suvar īśāya lokānām
analyzed: īśe īśitre bhūḥ bhuvaḥ suvar īśāya lokānām
translated: Isha for lordship, earth, atmosphere, heaven, for the lord of worlds,

analyzed: bhīmāya vāmadevāya svāhā  rvkh sravantu  text paridākṛtānth
translated: To the terrible, to Vamadeva, hail!

analyzed: prajāpate na tvat etāni anyaḥ viśvā jātāni pari tā babhūva

analyzed: yat kāmāḥ te juhumaḥ tat naḥ astu vayaggh

analyzed: subhūḥ svayambhūḥ mahati arṇave dadhe ha garbham ṛtviyam

Bhū, the beautiful one, the prosperous one, for every prosperity,

analyzed: bhūḥ bhuvaḥ suvar loka pāvanyai svāhā
translated: Bhūḥ, Bhuvaḥ, Suvaḥ, for the purification of the worlds, svāhā.

translated: The one who goes to the desired destination, the remover of the undesired, the lotus-born one, who stands on one peak, to Jāhnavī, svāhā.

original: soma yās te mayobhuva ūtayas santi dāśuṣe
analyzed: soma yāḥ te mayobhuvaḥ ūtayaḥ santi dāśuṣe
translated: O Soma, whatever aids of thine are blissful to the worshipper,
With them be thou our protector, svāhā.

analyzed: yā te dhāmāni divi yā pṛthivyām yā parvateṣu oṣadhīṣu apsu

analyzed: tebhiḥ naḥ viśvaiḥ sumanāḥ soma prati havyā gṛbhāya svāhā

Rudra, another, the three-eyed one,
The first within,🔽The lotus-born one,
The one who is not to be blamed,
The king,
On the sacrificial grass, Svâhâ! The variegated one,
Svâhâ! In the well-encircled one,

analyzed: jagadbhuvam bahutas hutam yajadbhuvat namaḥ te astu
translated: The support of the world, the much-offered one, the support of sacrifice, I offer homage to you.
To the all-supporting one, Svâhâ!

analyzed: jagat bhavaḥ dhipatiḥ senā nīḥ mayūra priyaḥ ṣaṣ ānanaḥ āṅgāraḥ

analyzed: sañjayāḥ ha namaḥ te stu sukha āvahāya svāhā

The good priest, the abode of Rudra, the abode of Brahman,
The origin of existence, for my immortality, Svâhâ!
The support of the world, the good priest, the son of the Krittikâs,
To the sixty-year cycle, Svâhâ!
In the book.
In the edition. The good priest,

analyzed: jagadbhuvaḥ yaḥ yajat bhuvaḥ skanda viśākha netā
translated: The support of the world, the support of sacrifice, the leader of Skanda and Visâkha,
The oblation from this to the Six-faced One, svāhā.
From this, the gods.
This is Viṣṇu.

original: yā brahmacāriṇy amarāṇām udagrāyās sannamitā agra etā ramante
analyzed: yāḥ brahmacāriṇī amarāṇām udagrāyāḥ sannamitāḥ agre etāḥ ramante
translated: Those who are celibate, exalted by the immortals, bowed to in front, they delight in front.

original: tasyā ānaya tvaṃ haviṣo mātariśvanth svāhā
analyzed: tasyāḥ ānaya tvam haviṣaḥ mātariśvan svāhā
translated: Bring those oblations to the mothers, O Mātariśvan, svāhā.

analyzed: hṛṣā adhṛṣyā bahis antar vasūnām svāhā
translated: to be honored by the delighted, to be honored outside and inside by the Vasus, svāhā.

original: eṣāmarāṇāṅ gurave satyam ādadhāti yā prādadhac cāvanigopām
analyzed: eṣām arāṇām gurave satyam ādadhāti yā prādadhat ca avani gopām

original: sadasyā rameta sā rakṣatu nas sadā vai svāhā
analyzed: sadasyā rameta sā rakṣatu naḥ sadā vai svāhā

original: dattaṃ japtaṃ pūjitaṃ vā hutan nas tasyā agnāv etu pātu sadā nas svāhā

translated: Whatever is given, muttered, worshipped, or offered as oblation, may it go into her fire, may she always protect us, svāhā.

analyzed: jātavedase sunavāma somam arātīyataḥ ni vedaḥ
translated: Let us press Soma for the all-knowing one, the dart burns away the enemy's spell.

original: sa naḥ parṣad ati durgāṇi viśvā nāveva sindhuṃ duritāty agni svāhā
analyzed: sa naḥ parṣat ati durgāṇi viśvā nāvā iva sindhum duritāti agni svāhā
translated: He shall carry us over all difficulties, as a boat over the river, O Agni, svāhā.

analyzed: ṃ śaraṇam aham prapadye su tarasi tarase svāhā
translated: I take refuge in the Goddess Durgā, I bow to the one who is easy to cross and difficult to cross, svāhā.

original: agne tvaṃ pārayā navyo asmānth svastibhir ati durgāṇi viśvā
analyzed: agne tvam pāraya navyo svastibhiḥ ati durgāṇi viśvā

analyzed: pūḥ ca pṛthvī bahulā naḥ urvī bhava tokāya tanayāya śam yos svāhā
translated: And be a wide and abundant earth for us, for the welfare of our offspring and children, svāhā.

original: viśvāni no durgahā jātavedas sindhuṃ na nāvā duritāti parṣi
analyzed: viśvāni naḥ durgahā jātavedaḥ sindhum na nāvā duritā ati parṣi
translated: O all-knower, carry us over all our difficulties, as one would cross a river by boat.

original: agne atrivan manasā gṛṇāno 'smākaṃ bodhy avitā tanūnāggṃ svāhā
analyzed: agne atrivan gṛṇānaḥ smākam bodhi tanūnāggṃ svāhā
translated: O Agni, being praised by the mind of Atri, be our protector, O Agni, of our bodies, svāhā.

analyzed: pṛtanājitak  ṃ sahamānam agnim ugra g
translated: The conqueror of armies,
We shall invoke Agni, the fierce one, from the highest abode.

original: sa naḥ parṣad ati durgāṇi viśvā kṣāmad devo ati duritāty agnis svāhā
analyzed: sa naḥ parṣat ati durgāṇi viśvā kṣāmat devaḥ ati duritā ati agniḥ svāhā
translated: He shall carry us over all difficulties, the god Agni shall carry us over all evils, svāhā.

original: pratno ṣi kam īḍyo adhvareṣu sanāc ca hotā navyaś ca sathsi
analyzed: pratnaḥ  kam īḍyaḥ adhvareṣu sanāt ca hotā navyaḥ ca sathsi
translated: You are the ancient one to be praised in sacrifices, you are the eternal and the new Hotṛ priest.

analyzed: svām ca agne tanuvam pipriyasva asmabhyam ca saubhagam ā yajasva svāhā

analyzed: veginī devī śarma deyāt sadā naḥ svāhā
translated: may the swift goddess always grant us protection, svāhā

original: śākhābhūta suśākhayā divo bhettum ayūyujat🔽dhātā devyā yajāma homāgryāṃ tatra vāhiny udetu svāhā
analyzed: śākhā bhūta su śākhayā divaḥ bhettum ayūyujat  dhātā devyā yajāma homa agryām tatra vāhinī udetu svāhā

original: bhajato me śivaṃ dhattāṃ jayā vṛttaṃ jarayatv ādhim eṣā svāhā
analyzed: bhajataḥ me śivam dhattām jayā vṛttam jarayatu ādhim eṣā svāhā
translated: May she, the victorious one, who worships me, grant me auspiciousness, may this oblation remove my anxiety.

original: bisinī bhūtā jananīvā sṛjanty utāvanītā brahmaṇy adhy upāste🔽tāṃ vidyutāg
analyzed: bisinī bhūtā jananī iva sṛjantī uta avanītā brahmaṇi adhi upāste  tām vidyutā ak
translated: She, like a mother, having become a lotus, creates and is brought forth, she worships in Brahman.
I properly satisfy her with the lightning-fire, svāhā.

original: pravidyutāyā sumanodharā cāmuṃ virañjaty ata eṣa panthāḥ
analyzed: pravidyutāyā sumanodharā ca amum atas eṣa panthāḥ
translated: The one who bears beautiful flowers to the lightning-struck, she adorns him, therefore this is the path.

original: tasyābhavat vindukarānurañjo juhomi sā no śivadā vidheyā svāhā🔽gaṅgāvāṇī sarasvatī phalaty ūrdhvag
analyzed: tasya bhavat vindukara anurañjaḥ juhomi sā naḥ śiva dā vidheyā svāhā  gaṅgā vāṇī sarasvatī phalati ūrdhva g
translated: Her son was born from the lightning-struck, I offer, may she be the bestower of auspiciousness to us, svāhā.

analyzed: ṃ śivāya naḥ sadā abhayā bhavet
translated: The Ganges, Vāṇī, and Sarasvatī bear fruit upwards, may she always be auspicious and fearless to us.

original: tata ādānam emi dhātus samastaṃ visṛjantīha devyās tasyā agnāv etu pātu sadā nas svāhā🔽vidyāṃ nno mātu vitanotu mānag

translated: From there I come, the entire element, releasing here, may the goddess's fire always protect us, svāhā.
May the mother's knowledge extend our honor, may they bring down the gentle one with Soma.

original: tayā pratyaṅgaṃ vivṛtaṃ yad viśāmo 'moghaṃ vidma prajayā brahma etat svāhā
analyzed: tayā pratyaṅgam vivṛtam yat viśāmaḥ mogham vidma prajayā brahma etat svāhā
translated: By that we enter what is opened in every limb, we know the unfailing offspring, this is Brahman, svāhā.

original: mātā hy ameyā mahī mūrtimatyā yayā satvaṃ vitanotīndriyeṣu
analyzed: mātā hi ameyā mahī mūrtimatyā yayā vitanoti indriyeṣu
translated: The immeasurable earth is the mother, the embodied one by whom she extends being in the senses,

original: yasyā asyā vaśaniṣṭham ajāyata svairiṇyā sā bhūtaye me bhavetāgṃ svāhā
analyzed: yasyāḥ asyāḥ vaśa niṣṭham ajāyata svairiṇyā sā bhūtaye me bhaveta āgṃ svāhā
translated: May she, whose will is supreme, who was born from a self-willed woman, be for my welfare, Svāhā.

original: āyām ahan tvā jananīṃ prāṇinas syuḥ prājñāḥ prajñātām etyādhyavasthāṃ mama dhiyo niyogam
analyzed: āyām ahan tvā jananīm prāṇinaḥ syuḥ prājñāḥ prajñātām etya adhyavasthām mama dhiyaḥ niyogam
translated: I have come to you, O mother, may beings be wise, having come to the known, establish my thoughts in command.
O flowing one, lead me, give me what is dear,

original: ṃ sā mā na higṃsī svāhā
analyzed: ṃ sā mā na higṃsī svāhā
translated: may she not harm me, Svāhā.

original: tata ujjihānāṃ tanubhiś caturbhir imām agacchat svakayā mahimnā svāhā
analyzed: tatas ujjihānām tanubhiḥ caturbhiḥ imām agacchat svakayā mahimnā svāhā
translated: She, having extended herself with four bodies, has come to this with her own greatness, Svāhā.

original: prasaviṇy aṅge manavo vicakṣavo yayā tu vṛddhiṃ vardhayanto viyāntaḥ
analyzed: prasaviṇi aṅge manavaḥ vicakṣavaḥ yayā tu vṛddhim vardhayantaḥ viyāntaḥ
translated: O fruitful one, the wise Manu, increasing by whom, increasing, goes forth,

analyzed: su bodham āninyuḥ prasavam prajānām tadā te ebhiḥ vahantu puṣṭiggṃ svāhā
translated: They have brought forth the easy-to-understand propagation of beings, may they carry my prosperity with these, Svāhā.

original: paro lokānām ajito jitātman bhavate 'bhavāya svāhā
analyzed: paras lokānām ajitaḥ jita ātman bhavate bhavāya svāhā
translated: The supreme one of the worlds, the unconquered one who has conquered the self, for the sake of non-existence, svāhā.

original: susūkṣmas sārvas sarveṣām antarātmā tasthus tasthuṣāṃ jaṃgamo jaṃgamānām
analyzed: su sūkṣmaḥ sarveṣām tasthuḥ tasthuṣām jaṃgamaḥ jaṃgamānām
translated: The very subtle one, the all-pervading one, the inner self of all, the stationary one of the stationary, the moving one of the moving ones,
The all-pervading one, for the sake of the origin of the existence of the existent ones, svāhā.

original: jyotir vā pāramātmikaṃ sārvaṃ viśvabhavaṃ bhavāya prabhūtaṃ prāhiṇvan paramparāya sukṛtaṃ kṛtāya tasmai varāya īśiṣe

original: īśo yasmād vitataṃ vitatya kaṃ kaṃ dhṛtaṃ kāmahuto juhoti
analyzed: īśaḥ yasmāt vitatam vitatya kam kam dhṛtam kāma hutaḥ juhoti

original: kakudaṃ kakuc chitvā bhūyaḥ parāya svāhā

The immortal self

analyzed: yat vā kṛtam amṛtam carāṇām yat sarva niṣṭham ajaram samastam

original: yo vā āyuḥ paramātmānaṃ mīḍhuṣaḥ pāraṃparyāt paraḥ parāyaṇaḥ paro lokānāṃ paramā dadhānaḥ parataḥ parāya svāhā

translated: Or he who, from the succession of the bountiful, is beyond the highest self, the highest support, the highest of the worlds, establishing the highest, beyond the highest, svāhā.

original: yo vā tejas tejasāṃ tejas teja ādadhānaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ vā tejaḥ tejasām tejaḥ tejaḥ ādadhānaḥ

translated: The true light of the lights, the light of the light, to the light of the light, svāhā.🔽You are the blessing of the blessing, the blessed of the blessed
The blessing of the blessing, the blessed of the blessed, the blessed of the blessed, svāhā.
The highest self, read as the highest self
The text. The blessed

original: yo vā saṃyogas saṃjuṣamāṇas sandhus sandhukṣaṇānām

translated: Or the conjunction, agreeing, the kindled one of the kindlers

analyzed: saṃyogam sandadhānaḥ puṇyaḥ puṇyānām puṇyāya svāhā
translated: The auspicious one who establishes conjunction, for the auspicious ones, for auspiciousness, svāhā

original: sahasraṃ vā yasyaiva vitānam ādadhānas sahasraṃ vā
analyzed: sahasram vā yasya eva vitānam ādadhānaḥ sahasram vā
translated: One who establishes a thousand or a thousandfold canopy, a thousand or

original: āsiṣas sāsikāḥ sahasraṃ yasya vai sāsikās sahasraṃ sahasrāya svāhā🔽svātigā guptayo guptis satyaṃ satyānāṃ sātvaṃ padam
analyzed: āsiṣaḥ sāsikāḥ sahasram yasya vai sāsikāḥ sahasram sahasrāya svāhā  sva atigāḥ guptayaḥ guptiḥ satyam satyānām sātvam padam
translated: Blessings with a thousand, a thousand with a thousand, for a thousand, svāhā🔽The well-protected protections, the protection, the truth of the truths, the foundation of the truth

original: tat satvaṃ satvam āsīt sātvaṃ sātvaṃ vai sātvam ādadhānāya svāhā
analyzed: tat satvam satvam āsīt sātvam sātvam vai sātvam ādadhānāya svāhā
translated: That truth, the truth was, the truth of the truth, for the one who establishes the truth of the truth, svāhā

original: satvaṃ vā udrekam āsīd yat satvam ubhayor anugoptā
analyzed: satvam vai udrekam āsīt yat satvam ubhayoḥ anugoptā
translated: The truth, the increase was, the truth which was the protector of both

original: tat satvaṃ satyaṃvadāya satyāya svāhā🔽satyo jyotis satyāntarātmā satyodyogas satyas satkarma
analyzed: tat satvam satyaṃvadāya satyāya svāhā  satyaḥ jyotiḥ satya antarātmā satya udyogaḥ satyaḥ sat karma
translated: That truth, the truth-speaking, for the truth, svāhā🔽The truth, the light, the truth, the inner self, the truth, the effort, the truth, the good deed

analyzed: satyam satya vitānam āsīt satya satyāya svāhā
translated: The truth, the truth, the canopy was, the truth of the truth, for the truth of the truth, svāhā
The earth, svāhā, for the truth, svāhā

original: satyas satvaṃ puṇyam āsīt puṇyo vā daivikam satyaṃ
analyzed: satyaḥ satvam puṇyam āsīt puṇyaḥ vā daivikam satyam
translated: The truth, the truth, the merit was, the truth or the divine, the truth

original: satvam ārṣaṃ satyaṃ satvaṃ satpathāya svāhā
analyzed: sattvam ārṣam satyam sattvam sat pathāya svāhā
translated: The truth, the truth, the truth of the sages, the truth, the truth, for the good path, svāhā

original: satyo jyotis satvaṃ prāṇās satvādhārās satvasaṃdhānaḥ
analyzed: satyaḥ jyotiḥ satvam prāṇāḥ sattva ādhārāḥ sattva saṃdhānaḥ
translated: The truth, the light, the truth, the life-breaths, the supports of the truth, the truth, the conjunction

original: satyas satvaṃ prakāśaṃ jyotir jyotiṣe svāhā
analyzed: satyaḥ satvam prakāśam jyotiḥ jyotiṣe svāhā
translated: The truth, the truth, the light, the light, for the light, svāhā

original: kāmīm umām īśiṣam īśiṣa satyam īśiṣam īśiṣāṇām tat satyaṃ satyarūpaṃ
analyzed: kāmīm umām īśiṣam īśiṣa satyam īśiṣam īśiṣāṇām tat satyam satya rūpam
translated: I rule Uma, the passionate one, I rule the truth, I rule the rulers, that truth, the form of truth,
the truth, for the sake of truth, to the one who joins together, svāhā.
The one who goes away or the one who comes back, the one who comes back,
this one who comes back, who delights, svāhā.

original: tat satvo vā viṣṇur udyogas sūryo go vā viṣṇur viśat
analyzed: tat satvaḥ vā viṣṇuḥ udyogaḥ sūryaḥ goḥ vā viṣṇuḥ viśat
translated: That being or Vishnu, the exertion, the sun, or the cow, Vishnu, the one who enters,

original: viśvaṃ viśvaṃ sandadhānas tad viśvaṃ viṣṇave viśvarūpāya svāhā
analyzed: viśvam viśvam sandadhānaḥ tat viśvam viṣṇave viśvarūpāya svāhā
translated: joining the universe, the universe, that universe, to Vishnu, the one of universal form, svāhā.

original: tad bhūr bhūsthaṃ bhūstho vā viśvarūpas tad bhūḥ prāṇasaṃkhyātaḥ
analyzed: tat bhūḥ bhū stham bhū sthaḥ vā viśva rūpaḥ tat bhūḥ prāṇa saṃkhyātaḥ
translated: That earth, the one on the earth, or the one on the earth, the one of universal form, that earth, counted as the vital breaths,

original: bhūr bhūr āsīd bhūr asi bhuvo 'si suvar asi bhūr bhūtaye svāhā
analyzed: bhūḥ bhūḥ āsīt bhūḥ asi bhuvaḥ u si suvar asi bhūḥ bhūtaye svāhā
translated: earth was, earth art thou, Bhuva art thou, Suva art thou, earth for the sake of being, svāhā.

original: āpo vā āpa āpo 'ntarātmā yo vedo vedānām ādhāraḥ
analyzed: āpaḥ vai āpaḥ āpaḥ ntarātmā yaḥ vedaḥ vedānām ādhāraḥ
translated: The waters or the waters, the waters, the inner self, the one who knows the Vedas, the support of the Vedas,

original: vedāntarātmā saraso rasasaṃkhyāto rasaṃ rasam āsīd rasāya svāhā
analyzed: veda antarātmā sarasaḥ rasa saṃkhyātaḥ rasam rasam āsīt rasāya svāhā
translated: the inner self of the Vedas, counted as the essence of the lake, the essence, the essence was, for the sake of essence, svāhā.

original: trayī vā kāmaṃ trayīmayaṃ triguṇaṃ tretātmakam
analyzed: trayī vā kāmam trayī mayam triguṇam tretā ātmakam
translated: The three or the one consisting of the three, the three qualities, the nature of the three ages,

original: trayī vā jyotis triguṇaṃ triguṇātmakaṃ tasmai tretāgnaye triguṇāya svāhā
analyzed: trayī vā jyotiḥ triguṇam triguṇa ātmakam tasmai tretāgnaye triguṇāya svāhā
translated: the three or the light, the three qualities, the nature of the three qualities, to that fire of the three ages, the one of three qualities, svāhā.

original: dvau vā mukhyau mukhyādhārau sasukhau sānandau
analyzed: dvau vā mukhyau mukhya ādhārau sa sukhau sa ānandau
translated: The two principal ones, the supports of the principal ones, with happiness, with bliss,

analyzed: sa smerau smera āyatau sa ānandam ānandate svāhā
translated: Smiling, with a smile, joyful, rejoicing, svāhā.

analyzed: saḥ ekaikaḥ sa ādhāraḥ sa adhiṣṭhānaḥ ina adhiṣṭhānaḥ
translated: He is each one, with a base, with a foundation, without a foundation.

original: kaṃ kaṃ pade pade pātaḥ pādāya pādite svāhā
analyzed: kam kam pade pade pātaḥ pādāya pādite svāhā
translated: Kam kam pada pada pātaḥ pādaye pādhite svāhā.
To the one with a universal form, svāhā, to the one who is placed, svāhā.
To the form,

original: svayam ādis sarvāntarātmā devas sa svayaṃ krīḍātmakam avāsṛjat
analyzed: svayam ādiḥ sarva antarātmā devaḥ sa svayam krīḍā ātmakam avāsṛjat
translated: The self-existent one, the inner soul of all, the god, he himself emitted the playful one.

original: yas svayaṃ lokam avadhāram avadhārayant svāhā
analyzed: yaḥ svayam lokam avadhāram avadhārayan svāhā
translated: He who himself, determining the world, determines, svāhā.

original: yas svayaṃ sṛṣṭam ātmanā guptam anu saṃvitānam acaraṃ carantam
analyzed: yaḥ svayam sṛṣṭam ātmanā guptam anu saṃvitānam acaram carantam
translated: He who himself, the created one, protected by himself, moving in accord with the mind, moving while unmoving,

original: svayaṃ krīḍan krīḍayan krīḍāntaram anuprāviśat svāhā
analyzed: svayam krīḍan krīḍayan krīḍā antaram anuprāviśat svāhā
translated: Playing himself, delighting, entered into another play, svāhā.

analyzed: sva ojasā sarvam ādadhāti yaḥ pāpīyāḥ
translated: He who, with his own vigor, bestows everything, the wicked one,
Following the step, he struck the step.

original: supuṇyaṃ puṇyātmakaṃ puṇyavitānan dadhāra devāya svāhā
analyzed: su puṇyam puṇya vitānan dadhāra devāya svāhā
translated: The very meritorious, meritorious-natured, meritorious one, he held the canopy for the god, svāhā.

original: kṣmām ekāṃ salilāvasannāṃ śrutvā svanantīm anu supatantīm
analyzed: kṣmām ekām salila avasannām śrutvā svanantīm anu su patantīm
translated: Hearing the one earth, submerged in water, resounding, well-moving,

original: svayaṃ bhūtvā varāho vara ujjahāra tasmai devāya sukṛtāya pitre svāhā
analyzed: svayam bhūtvā varāhaḥ varaḥ ujjahāra tasmai devāya su kṛtāya pitre svāhā
translated: Becoming himself the excellent boar, he lifted it up. To that excellent god, the father, svāhā.

original: yaḥ kundharamāṇaḥ kundharān kuṃdharatām ity avocat
analyzed: yaḥ kundharamāṇaḥ kundharān kundhara tām iti avocat
translated: He who, being the one with a hump, said to the humped ones, Become humped.

original: tāṃ sānumato vidadhat svatejasā tasmai variṣṭhāya varadāya pitre svāhā
analyzed: tām sānumataḥ vidadhat sva tejasā tasmai variṣṭhāya vara dāya pitre svāhā
translated: He, the one who is approved, arranging her with his own splendor, to that best one, the giver of boons, the father, svāhā.
Of very meritorious soul

analyzed: yaḥ vā pṛthām praskhalantīm pramṛjya amṛja aṃgīm
translated: He who wiped off Prithā who was slipping, whose limbs were smeared with dirt,

original: ya ūrvor upadadhāt tasmai mukhyāya varadāya pitre svāhā
analyzed: yaḥ ūrvoḥ upadadhāt tasmai mukhyāya vara dāya pitre svāhā
translated: Who placed her thighs, to that chief one, the giver of boons, the father, svāhā.

original: yāṃ gām uśantīm uśanābhipūrṇām āraktanīlām amṛtāṃ rajantīm
analyzed: yām gām uśantīm uśanā abhipūrṇām ārakta nīlām amṛtām rajantīm

analyzed: tām tasmai prajā īśāya vara dāya pitre svāhā
translated: Who made her fond, whose bracelets were fondled, to him, the lord of creatures, the giver of boons, the father, svāhā.

original: prajāpate na tvad etāny anyo viśvā jātāni pari tā babhūva
analyzed: prajāpate na tvat etāni anyaḥ viśvā jātāni pari tā babhūva
translated: O Prajāpati, none other than you has encompassed all these beings.

original: yatkāmās te juhumas tan no astu vayagg
analyzed: yad kāmāḥ te juhumaḥ tat naḥ astu vayaggh
translated: Whatever desires we offer to you, may that be ours.
May we be the lords of wealth. To Agni, svāhā.

original: yo dhūr dhuraṃ dhūr dhuraṃ dhūr varāṇām
analyzed: yaḥ dhūḥ dhuram dhūḥ dhuram dhūḥ varāṇām
translated: He who is the yoke, the yoke, the yoke of the yokes,

analyzed: su dhūḥ dhūḥ asi dhūḥ dhurāṇām dhūḥ asi dhūrvaṃga svāhā
translated: The good yoke, you are the yoke of the yokes, you are the yoke of the yokes. To me, svāhā.

analyzed: yaḥ vā vyahiṃṣīt jarayā a jarantam tat daitya mukhyam amṛta ātma rūpam
translated: He who would have destroyed the one who was decaying with old age, that chief of the demons, whose form is immortal and has a soul,

original: sukhuraṃ khurāṇāṃ kiñcit svanantaṃ tasmai nṛsiṃhāya sureśapitre svāhā
analyzed: su khuram khurāṇām kiñcid svanantam tasmai nṛsiṃhāya sura īśa pitre svāhā
translated: The good hoof, the hoof of the hoofs, slightly neighing, to him, the man-lion, the lord of the gods, the father, svāhā.
