original: digdoṣā yasya vidiśas svakarṇau dyaur āsa vaktram udaran nabho vā
analyzed: digdoṣāḥ yasya vidiśaḥ sva karṇau dyauḥ āsa vaktram nabhaḥ vā
translated: Whose directions are his ears, the sky is his face, and the atmosphere is his belly,

original: sāsi ṣma vā yās svayam āpa daṃtaṃ tasmai varatre varadāya kasmai svāhā
analyzed: sā asi sma vā yāḥ svayam āpa daṃtam tasmai varatre vara dāya kasmai svāhā
translated: To him, the best of all, the giver of boons, to whom the directions themselves have given teeth, Svāhā.

original: padmāsyavakṣāḥ paramas supuṇyaḥ padmā janitrī paramasya vāsaḥ
analyzed: padma āsya vakṣāḥ paramaḥ su puṇyaḥ padmā janitrī paramasya vāsaḥ
translated: The lotus-faced one, the supreme, the most meritorious, the lotus is the mother of the supreme abode,

original: sūkṣmaṃ sāvitraṃ svayam ādadhānas sāvitrarūpaṃ paramaṃ supuṇyaggṃ svāhā
analyzed: sūkṣmam sāvitram svayam ādadhānaḥ sāvitra rūpam paramam su puṇyaggṃ svāhā
translated: The subtle one, the Savitr, himself placing the supreme form of the Savitr, the most meritorious, Svāhā.

original: yaḥ puṇḍarīkaḥ paramāntarātmā kamrāṃgarūpaṃ kamalaṃ dadhāra
analyzed: yaḥ puṇḍarīkaḥ paramāntarātmā kamra aṅga rūpam kamalam dadhāra
translated: The one who is the lotus, the supreme inner self, holds the lotus in the form of a bent limb,
To the essence of rasa, Svāhā.

original: rayīṇāṃ patiṃ bṛhantaṃ rārāgamuktaṃ guruṃ sanīkam
analyzed: rayīṇām patim bṛhantam rā rāga muktam gurum
translated: The lord of wealth, the great one, the one freed from passion, the guru, the one with the sun,

original: taṃ rāyo rūpaṃ rayibhūtabhūtaṃ rayimatsuramitre svāhā
analyzed: tam rāyaḥ rūpam rayi bhūta bhūtam svāhā
translated: That form of wealth, the one become the essence of wealth, to the friend of the gods, Svāhā.

original: rāyāṃ patatre rayim ādadhātre rāyo bṛhantaṃ rayimat supuṣṭām
analyzed: rāyām patatre rayim ādadhātre rāyaḥ bṛhantam rayimat su puṣṭām
translated: To the one who places wealth in the falling rain, to the one who places wealth in the great wealth, the one with good nourishment,

original: rārājimantaṃ rataye ramantaṃ taṃ biṃbavantaṃ kakudāya bhadre svāhā
analyzed: rārājimantam rataye ramantam tam biṃbavantam kakudāya bhadre svāhā
translated: The one with the royal mark, the one who delights for the sake of truth, to him, the one with the bimba, to the one with the hump, to the good one, Svāhā.

original: From / sanī / gift / MW p / /🔽PUB / suratre instead of suramitre / US /
analyzed: from sanī gift mw  pup suratre instead of suramitre us
translated: From. Suni. Gift. MW🔽Pub. Suratre instead of surmitre. Us.
Suratras instead of surmitre
To the one who abides, svāhā, to the auspicious one, svāhā.

original: yat sārabhūtaṃ sakalaṃ dharitraṃ modaprāyeṇānubhūtam anuviddham
analyzed: yat sāra bhūtam sakalam dharitram moda prāyeṇa anubhūtam anuviddham
translated: Whatever essence there is, the entire earth, experienced with joy, pervaded by joy,

original: sūkṣmas sureśas sakalaṃ bibharti tasmai sureśāya sakalaṃ supuṇyaggṃ svāhā
analyzed: sūkṣmaḥ sureśaḥ sakalam bibharti tasmai sureśāya sakalam su puṇyaggṃ svāhā
translated: The subtle lord of gods sustains the entire universe. To that lord of gods, the entire, very meritorious, svāhā.

original: phalo vā eṣa lokānām ajaro mahātmā viśvaṃ yaḥ pāti vimalo 'malākhyaḥ
analyzed: phalaḥ vai eṣa lokānām ajaraḥ mahātmā viśvam yaḥ pāti vimalaḥ mala ākhyaḥ
translated: This is indeed the fruit of the worlds, the immortal, great-souled one, the pure one, called pure, who protects the entire universe.

analyzed: tasmai varatre vara dasya puṣṭyai svāhā
translated: To that excellent thread, for the nourishment of the bestower of boons, svāhā.

original: dhūr no vahantāṃ rataye ramantāṃ puṃbhūtimantas samayas suṣumnā
analyzed: dhūḥ naḥ vahantām rataye ramantām puṃbhūtimantaḥ samayaḥ suṣumnā
translated: May they bear us for pleasure, may they rejoice, having the prosperity of men, the auspicious time, the susumna.

original: aṃ rājimantaṃ sakalasya guptyai svāhā🔽viśvaṃ bibharṣi prasuro rudantaṃ
analyzed: aṃ rājimantam sakalasya guptyai svāhā  viśvam bibharṣi prasuraḥ rudantam
translated: The one with the variegated pattern, for the protection of the entire universe, svāhā.🔽You bear the entire universe, the flowing one, the crying one,
The one with the variegated pattern, the entire one, fully developed.

original: sa no vitatya prahiṇotu patre svāhā
analyzed: sa naḥ vitatya prahiṇotu patre svāhā
translated: May he, having spread out, send us forth in the leaf, svāhā.

original: so vā svarūpas samadṛk samagro vidhudaṃ tudan yo vidadhat padaṃ vā
analyzed: saḥ vā sva rūpaḥ samadṛś samagraḥ vidhudam tudan yaḥ vidadhat padam vā
translated: He, of his own form, the all-seeing one, the all-pervading one, striking the lightning, establishing his foot,

original: viyati prakāśaṃ bṛhate ruheṇa taṃ biṃbavantaṃ samadaṃ samagraggṃ svāhā
analyzed: viyati prakāśam bṛhate ruheṇa tam biṃbavantam samadam samagraggṃ svāhā
translated: In the sky, bearing the great light, to that one with the orb, the impartial one, the all-pervading one, svāhā.

original: bhūr bhuvaṃ vā bhuvo vā suvo vā kiñcit svanantaṃ suṣuve samastam
analyzed: bhūḥ bhuvam vā bhuvaḥ vā suvar vā kiñcid svanantam suṣuve samastam
translated: The earth, the ground, or the sky, or something shining, has given birth to the entire universe.

original: sarvasya dātāram ajaraṃ jaritre svāḥa🔽dākṣāyaṇyāṃ prasṛtaṃ samastaṃ samkocayitvā sakalaṃ vitānam
translated: To the giver of everything, the imperishable one, to the one who is praised by the old, to the one who is born from Daksha's daughter, to the one who has spread out the entire universe and then withdrawn it all back,

original: saṃvāsayan me sakalaṃ variṣṭaṃ tasmai prajeśāya dhuraṃdharāya svāhā
analyzed: saṃvāsayat me sakalam variṣṭam tasmai prajā īśāya dhuraṃdharāya svāhā
translated: To the one who sustains my entire best, to the lord of beings, to the one who bears the burden, I offer oblations.

original: āśās samastāḥ prataran v antas tās tā vased yā kamalā samastā
analyzed: āśāḥ samastāḥ prataran u antar tāḥ tāḥ vaset yā kamalā samastā
translated: The one who crosses all the desires within, may he dwell in all the lotuses.

original: sā me gṛhe vā samadatta puṣṭiggṃ svāhā
analyzed: sā me gṛhe vā samadatta puṣṭiggṃ svāhā
translated: May he grant me prosperity in the house. I offer oblations.

original: yo jaṃgamānāṃ sakalaṃ bibharṣi sarvaṃ viyad vā vicareta śakṣyan
analyzed: yaḥ jaṃgamānām sakalam sarvam viyat vā vicareta śakṣyan
translated: The one who supports the entire moving world, the one who can move through the entire sky,

original: tan naur jale vapuṣy anty ajasraggṃ svāhā
analyzed: tat nauḥ jale vapuṣi anti ajasraggṃ svāhā
translated: The boat in the water, the body, the endless one, I offer oblations.

original: yo vā daśānāṃ prasṛtās samastās tāṃs tān dadhānās samayāt sabījāḥ
analyzed: yaḥ vā daśānām prasṛtāḥ samastāḥ tān tān dadhānāḥ samayāt sa bījāḥ
translated: The one who holds all the ten directions, all of them, along with their seeds and time,

analyzed: śabda atiriktyai sva balam balāya svāhā
translated: For the sake of the excess of sound, for the strength of his own strength, I offer oblations.
The text has bibhirshi
I offer oblations to the complete one, I offer oblations to the strong one.

original: catvāro doṣāḥ praharanti yasya sarvasya goptre sarasāya dhāmne
analyzed: catvāraḥ doṣāḥ praharanti yasya sarvasya goptre sarasāya dhāmne
translated: To the protector of all, to the one who has the essence of everything, to the one who has the abode of everything,
For the increase of Soma's merit and wealth, I offer oblations.

original: vakṣo vasaty asya varāṃ variṣṭhaṃ vākan dadhānā vavṛdhe samastam
analyzed: vakṣaḥ vasati asya varām variṣṭham vākan dadhānā vavṛdhe samastam
translated: The best of the best dwells in his chest, holding the speech, he has grown completely,
To him, the best, for the increase of the best, svāhā

original: aṇor aṇīyān mahato mahīyān ātmā guhāyāṃ nihito 'sya jantoḥ
analyzed: aṇoḥ aṇīyān mahataḥ mahīyān ātmā guhāyām nihitaḥ u sya jantoḥ
translated: Smaller than the small, greater than the great, the Self is hidden in the cave of the creature.

original: tam akratuṃ paśyati vītaśoko dhātuḥ prasādān mahimānam īśaggṃ svāhā
analyzed: tam akratum paśyati vīta śokaḥ dhātuḥ prasādāt mahimānam svāhā
translated: The griefless one sees that incomprehensible one by the grace of the Creator, the greatness of the Lord, svāhā

original: viṣṇur variṣṭho varadānamukhyo yo viśvaṛṣīn dhyāyan nu kurvan
translated: Viṣṇu is the best, the chief of bestowing boons, he who, meditating on the universal sages, is acting

original: viśvaṃ hīṣad vyadadhat tam atra tad viṣṇave yāḥ prabhaviṣṇave yā amitaṃ bharatre svāhā
analyzed: viśvam vyadadhat tam atra tat viṣṇave yāḥ prabhaviṣṇave yāḥ amitam bharatre svāhā
translated: Having expanded the universe, that is here, to that Viṣṇu, to the powerful one, to the bearer of the immeasurable, svāhā

original: abjo juṣantaḥ pravadat patantaḥ pūṃ pūṃ puṣantaḥ punar yaḥ pravālaḥ
analyzed: abjaḥ juṣantaḥ pravadat patantaḥ pūm puṣantaḥ punar yaḥ
translated: The lotus-born ones, enjoying, speaking, falling, nourishing, again he who is the sprout

original: kaṃ kaṃ janitre samatejasan te svāhā
translated: The two, two, to the progenitor, of equal splendor, to you, svāhā
Text: hīhiṣat
Text: pūṃ
Text: pravālaḥ

original: mām ātmaguptāṃ vahate sma bhūtyaitāṃ rājimantāṃ sudhūr dhūrayantīm
analyzed: mām ātma guptām vahate sma bhūtyā etām rājimantām sudhūḥ dhūrayantīm
translated: She carries me, hidden in the Self, for prosperity, this one with stripes, the ploughman's wife, moving with a good plough
You are the plough, for the firm, svāhā

original: yaṃ cintayanto nigamāntarūpaṃ yaṃ viśvarūpaṃ paramātmarūpam
analyzed: yam cintayantaḥ nigama anta rūpam yam viśva rūpam paramātma rūpam
translated: Meditating on him, the form at the end of the Vedas, the form of the universe, the supreme Self

original: taṃ vindamānāṃ sakalaṃ vrajantīṃ taṃ devamukhyaṃ surataṃ bhavāya svāhā
analyzed: tam vindamānām sakalam vrajantīm tam deva mukhyam suratam bhavāya svāhā
translated: Finding him, going to the whole, the chief of gods, the god, for existence, svāhā

original: puṇyāṃ ca puṇyaḥ puruṣe puragre tāṃ rājimantāṃ niśi coditānām
analyzed: puṇyām ca puṇyaḥ puruṣe pur agre tām rājimantām niśi coditānām
translated: And the meritorious one, the meritorious one in the foremost city of men, that one with stripes, for the sake of nourishment, taking away the offerings made at night,

original: vidadhāti puṣṭyai haranparāya svāhā🔽so no bhūto yo vāmṛtātmā supuṣṭim asmat pitaraṃ pavitram
analyzed: vidadhāti puṣṭyai haran parāya svāhā  saḥ naḥ bhūtaḥ yaḥ vā amṛta ātmā su puṣṭim asmat pitaram pavitram
translated: he bestows for prosperity, taking away to the other world, svāhā.🔽May that being who is the immortal soul, well nourished, our father, the pure one,

analyzed: saḥ naḥ stu bhūtyai kamala avarāya svāhā
translated: may he be for our prosperity, for the sake of the excellent lotus, svāhā.

original: sa tv eva nityaṃ sakalās samūrtayas saratās tv anantāḥ
analyzed: sa tu eva nityam sakalāḥ sa mūrtayaḥ saratāḥ tu anantāḥ
translated: But he alone is always the complete forms, the infinite ones moving together,

original: te jījayanto viyati kṣayāṇāṃ tattatśavitre harate harāya svāhā
analyzed: te jījayantaḥ viyati kṣayāṇām tat tat śavitre harate harāya svāhā
translated: they, conquering in the sky, take away the various forms for Hara, svāhā.
To the existent ones, svāhā! To Hara, svāhā!

original: yā gā variṣṭhā sahasūr dharitrī vasuṃ vasuṃ vai vasunīha bhadrā
analyzed: yā gāḥ variṣṭhā sahasūḥ dharitrī vasum vasum vai vasunī iha bhadrā
translated: The cows, the best, together with the sun, the earth, each and every good thing here on earth,
conquering the enemy, shines forth, svāhā.

original: vāyur antarātmā vahatī samastas sapuṇya deveti sa sūrimuktaḥ
analyzed: vāyuḥ antarātmā vahatī samastaḥ sa puṇya deva iti sa sūri muktaḥ
translated: The wind, the inner soul, carries the entire one along with merit, thus declared by the sages.

original: sūris surāṇāṃ suraso 'py asundas samūhya devāya varadāya pitre svāhā
analyzed: sūriḥ surāṇām su rasaḥ pi asundaḥ devāya vara dāya pitre svāhā
translated: The sage, the best of the gods, the one with good essence, the one without impurity, having gathered the gods, to the father, the giver of boons, svāhā.

original: sarvopariṣṭād adhi tiṣṭhat ātmā yasyopariṣṭāt paramas samuktaḥ
analyzed: sarva upariṣṭāt adhi tiṣṭhat ātmā yasya upariṣṭāt paramaḥ samuktaḥ
translated: The soul that stands above all, above whom the supreme one is declared,
him, the one without dust, for the sake of the next world, svāhā.

original: tamas sarvabhūtam adhunod vareṇyas taṃ satvarūpaṃ sakalaṃ prakāśya
analyzed: tamaḥ sarva bhūtam adhunot vareṇyaḥ tam sattva rūpam sakalam prakāśya
translated: The most excellent one has now removed the darkness from all beings, and having revealed the entire form of goodness,

original: saṃkleśayant sṛṣṭinimittaye yas tasmai paraṃbrahmaṇe paraṃjyotiṣe svāhā
analyzed: saṃkleśayan sṛṣṭi nimittaye yaḥ tasmai paraṃbrahmaṇe paraṃjyotiṣe svāhā
translated: and for the sake of creation, he who afflicts, to that supreme Brahman, the supreme light, svāhā.

original: jyotir jyotiṣāṃ jyotir ojo balaṃ satvaṃ satvātmakaṃ saṃjyotir ittham tasmai sūkṣmasūkṣmāya tejase svāhā
analyzed: jyotiḥ jyotiṣām jyotiḥ ojaḥ balam satvam sattva ātmakam saṃjyotiḥ ittham tasmai sūkṣma sūkṣmāya tejase svāhā
translated: The light of lights, the light, the strength, the power, the goodness, the essence of goodness, thus to that subtle, subtle radiance, svāhā.

original: satvaṃ satvātmakaṃ vā rajo rajasa ātmakam tamas tamasa ādhāras
analyzed: sattvam sattva ātmakam vā rajaḥ rajasaḥ ātmakam tamaḥ tamasaḥ ādhāraḥ
translated: The goodness, the essence of goodness, or the passion, the essence of passion, the darkness, the support of darkness,
the single, that which is not under the control of Īśvara, to Īśvara, svāhā.

original: anirbhiṇṇaṃ yasyedam āsīd āsīd udakam ātmakam
analyzed: a nirbhiṇṇam yasya idam āsīt āsīt udakam ātmakam
translated: Whose this was, unbroken, was water, was of the nature of water,

original: yasyo dāvodanartham uccam uccair urugāya svāhā
analyzed: yasya u uccam uccais urugāya svāhā
translated: whose, the forest fire, for the sake of the high, the high, to the all-pervading one, svāhā.

original: yasyecchā loke vā prajāyatir loke yan naivāsīt tan naivāsīt
analyzed: yasya icchā loke vā prajāyatiḥ loke yat na eva āsīt tat na eva āsīt
translated: Whose desire in the world or birth in the world, that which was not, that was not,

original: yad vā saṃjātaṃ yat sarvam īśam īśiṣe svāhā
analyzed: yat vā saṃjātam yat sarvam īśam īśiṣe svāhā
translated: or that which was born, that which is all, you rule, svāhā.

original: yo vedādiḥ paramaḥ paro brahmā trimātras trayīmūrtikaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ veda ādiḥ paramaḥ paraḥ brahmā tri mātraḥ trayī mūrtikaḥ
translated: He who is the beginning of the Veda, the supreme, beyond, Brahman, consisting of three mātras, having the three Vedas as his form,

analyzed: śabdaḥ śabda atigaḥ paraṃbrahmaṇe paraṃjyotiṣe svāhā
translated: the sound, beyond sound, to the supreme Brahman, the supreme light, svāhā.

original: yo vā 'vyaktaṃ sakalaṃ pravṛddhyai yad idaṃ sarvam āsīt
analyzed: yaḥ vā vyaktam sakalam pravṛddhyai yat idam sarvam āsīt
translated: Or, the unmanifest, the whole, for prosperity, which was all this,

original: sānandaṃ sākṛtaṃ taṃ haran parāya svāhā
analyzed: sa ānandam sa akṛtam tam haran parāya svāhā
translated: The blissful, the created, I offer to the supreme, svāhā.
In the book
The first half of the chapter on the sacrificial post🔽Missing in Us
Missing in Us
For splendor, svāhā, for the supreme, svāhā.

original: yo vā bhūter bhūtir āsīt sā vānandaṃ pratyānandam
analyzed: yaḥ vā bhūteḥ bhūtiḥ āsīt sā vā ānandam pratyānandam
translated: Or, the prosperity that was, that is the bliss, the bliss that is returned,
Conjoining, I go to truth, to the true, svāhā.

original: satyas satyasthas satyalokasthas satyaṃ sañjanitram āsīt
analyzed: satyaḥ satya sthaḥ satya loka sthaḥ satyam san janitram āsīt
translated: The true, abiding in the true, abiding in the world of truth, truth was the original creation,
Truth to the true, for the impulse, svāhā.

original: ṛtagṃ satyaṃ amitaṃ purāṇam ādiṃ janitram amṛtaṃ surendram
analyzed: ṛtagm satyam amitam purāṇam ādim janitram amṛtam sura indram
translated: The truth of the ṛc, the immeasurable, the ancient, the beginning, the original creation, the immortal, the lord of the gods,
Rejoicing in the light, enjoy, svāhā.

original: aṃ rājimantaṃ sakalasya guptiṃ some juṣantam amṛtaṃ bibharti
analyzed: rājimantam sakalasya guptim some juṣantam amṛtam bibharti
translated: The one with the royal pattern, the protector of the whole, enjoying the soma, bears the immortal,

original: rayimat supuṣṭiṃ guṇavantam atra tasmai supuṇyāya varadāya pitre svāhā
analyzed: rayimat su puṣṭim guṇavantam atra tasmai su puṇyāya vara dāya pitre svāhā
translated: The one with wealth, the excellent nourishment, the virtuous, to that most meritorious, the giver of boons, to the father, svāhā.

original: mām ātmaguptāṃ satvasya sarvasya vitānarūpāṃ saṃjūjuṣantīṃ paramāṃ pavitrām
analyzed: mām ātma guptām satvasya sarvasya vitāna rūpām saṃjūjuṣantīm paramām pavitrām
translated: Me, the self-protected, the form of the expanse of all beings, rejoicing in the highest, the most sacred,

original: santārayantīṃ svayam apramattāṃ saṃyojayitre varadāya pitre svāhā
analyzed: santārayantīm svayam a pramattām saṃyojayitre vara dāya pitre svāhā
translated: The one who saves herself, the one who is not heedless, the one who unites, the one who bestows boons, to the Father, Svāhā.

Endowed with sixteen,

original: ṃ śatārdhāraṃ viṃśati pratyatarābhir aṣṭakaiṣ ṣaḍbhir viśvarūpaikapāśam
analyzed: ṃ śata ardha aram viṃśati pratyatarābhiḥ aṣṭakaiḥ ṣaḍbhiḥ viśvarūpa eka pāśam
translated: Having a hundred spokes, twenty cross-bars, eight sets of six, with a single noose in the form of the universe

analyzed: tri mārga bhedam dvi nimitta eka moham
translated: Having three paths, two causes, and one delusion

original: prajāpatiṃ prathamaṃ yajñiyānāṃ devānām agre yajataṃ yajadhvam
analyzed: prajāpatim prathamam yajñiyānām devānām agre yajatam yajadhvam
translated: Worship Prajāpati first, the gods worthy of sacrifice, worship him first among the gods
May he grant us wealth
And good heroism

original: ṃ rāyas poṣaṃ viṣyatu nābhim asme
analyzed: ṃ rāyaḥ poṣam viṣyatu nābhim asme
translated: May he extend the nourishment of wealth to our navel

original: raukmaṃ kūrmaṃ brahmasthāne 'haṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmy oṃ namaḥ
analyzed: raukmam kūrmam brahmasthāne haṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmi om namaḥ
translated: I install the golden tortoise in the place of Brahman, Om, salutations

original: tam ekanemim gajaṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmy oṃ namaḥ
analyzed: tam eka nemim gajam pratiṣṭhāpayāmi om namaḥ
translated: I install that single-spoked elephant, Om, salutations
Having a hundred spokes

original: ṃ hiraṇmayam garuḍaṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmy oṃ namaḥ
analyzed: ṃ hiraṇmayam garuḍam pratiṣṭhāpayāmi om namaḥ
translated: I install the golden Garuḍa, Om, salutations

original: brahmā devānām brahmaṇa imaṃ brahmamaṇiṃ brahmasthāne 'ham pratiṣṭhāpayāmy oṃ namaḥ
analyzed: brahmā devānām brahmaṇaḥ imam brahma maṇim brahma sthāne ham pratiṣṭhāpayāmi om namaḥ
translated: Brahmā of the gods, this Brahmam stone, I establish in the place of Brahmā, Om, salutations.

original: indraṃ praṇayantaṃ indrāyemaṃ vajramaṇim indrasthāne 'haṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmy oṃ namaḥ
analyzed: indram praṇayantam indrāya imam vajra maṇim indra sthāne haṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmi om namaḥ
translated: Indra, the beloved, to Indra this diamond stone, I establish in the place of Indra, Om, salutations.

original: agnāv agniś carati praviṣṭa ṛṣīṇāṃ putro adhirāja eṣaḥ
analyzed: agnau agniḥ carati praviṣṭaḥ ṛṣīṇām putraḥ adhirājaḥ eṣaḥ
translated: In the fire moves the fire, the son of the seers, the overlord, this one.

original: sāhākṛtya brahmaṇā te juhomi mā devānāṃ mithuyā kar bhāgadheyam🔽agnaya imaṃ mauktikam agnisthāne 'haṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmy oṃ namaḥ
analyzed: sāhākṛtya brahmaṇā te mā devānām mithuyā kaḥ bhāgadheyam  agnaye imam mauktikam agni sthāne haṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmi om namaḥ
translated: Having done together with Brahmā, I offer to you. Do not make a share of mine in the dispute of the gods.🔽To the fires, this pearl, I establish in the place of fire, Om, salutations.

original: yamo dādhāra yamāyemaṃ vaiḍūryamaṇiṃ yamasthāne 'haṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmy oṃ namaḥ
analyzed: yamaḥ dādhāra yamāya imam vaiḍūrya maṇim yama sthāne haṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmi om namaḥ
translated: Yama upholds, to Yama this lapis lazuli stone, I establish in the place of Yama, Om, salutations.

original: vasavaḥ prathamaḥ nirṛtaya imaṃ śaṅkhajaṃ nirṛtisthāne 'haṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmy oṃ namaḥ
analyzed: vasavaḥ prathamaḥ nirṛtayaḥ imam śaṅkha jam nirṛti sthāne haṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmi om namaḥ
translated: The Vasus are the first, the Nirrtis this conch-born stone, I establish in the place of Nirrti, Om, salutations.

original: Text / jahomi🔽ye te śatam varuṇāyemaṃ sphaṭikamaṇiṃ varuṇasthāne 'haṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmy oṃ namaḥ
analyzed: text jahomi  ye te śatam varuṇāya imam sphaṭika maṇim varuṇa sthāne haṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmi om namaḥ
translated: I offer.🔽Those of yours, a hundred, to Varuṇa this crystal stone, I establish in the place of Varuṇa, Om, salutations.

original: marutaḥ paramātmā vāyava imaṃ puṣyakāntamaṇiṃ vāyusthāne 'haṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmy oṃ namaḥ
analyzed: marutaḥ paramātmā vāyavaḥ imam puṣya kānta maṇim vāyu sthāne haṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmi om namaḥ
translated: The Maruts are the supreme self, the winds this pushyarāga stone, I establish in the place of Vāyu, Om, salutations.

original: somagṃ rājānam somāyemaṃ candrakāntamaṇiṃ somasthāne 'haṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmy oṃ namaḥ
analyzed: rājānam somāya imam candrakānta maṇim soma sthāne haṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmi om namaḥ
translated: I install this moonstone in the place of Soma, the king of the gods, ॐ, salutations.

original: īśānas sarvalokānām īśānāyemaṃ nīlamaṇim īśānasthāne 'haṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmy oṃ namaḥ

original: bhūmer vitanvan prataran prakāmaḥ popūyamānaḥ pañcabhis svaguṇaiḥ prasannais sarvāṇi mān dhārayiṣyasi svāhā
analyzed: bhūmeḥ vitanvan prataran prakāmaḥ popūyamānaḥ pañcabhiḥ sva guṇaiḥ prasannaiḥ sarvāṇi mān dhārayiṣyasi svāhā
translated: Spreading out the earth, crossing over, desiring, being nourished by the five pure qualities, you will support all beings with your own, svāhā.
To the earth, hum phat, svāhā.
I dissolve the earth into the waters.
I meditate on the form of Aniruddha.

original: tvaṃ jīvas tvam āpas sarveṣāṃ janitā tvam āhāraḥ
analyzed: tvam jīvaḥ tvam āpaḥ sarveṣām janitā tvam āhāraḥ
translated: You are life, you are the waters, the progenitor of all, you are food.

analyzed: tvam viṣṇo śrama apanudāya caturguṇāya svāhā
translated: O Viṣṇu, for the removal of fatigue, for the one with four qualities, svāhā.
To the immortal, hum phat, svāhā.
I dissolve the fire into the waters.
I meditate on the form of Acyuta.

original: tvam agne triguṇo variṣṭhaḥ paraṃ brahma paraṃ jyotiḥ
analyzed: tvam agne triguṇaḥ variṣṭhaḥ param brahma param jyotiḥ
translated: O Agni, you are threefold, supreme, the highest Brahman, the highest light.

original: sarveṣāṃ tvaṃ pālanāya hutam amṛtaṃ vahiṣyase svāhā
analyzed: sarveṣām tvam pālanāya hutam amṛtam vahiṣyase svāhā
translated: You will carry the immortal oblation for the protection of all, svāhā.
To Agni, hum phat, svāhā.
I dissolve Vāyu into Agni.
I meditate on the form of truth.

original: yo vā vāyur dviguṇo 'ntarātmā sarveṣām antaś caratīha viṣṇo

analyzed: sa tvam devān manuṣyān mṛtān parisaṃjīvase svāhā
translated: You revive the gods and humans who have died, svāhā.

I dissolve Vāyu into space.
I meditate on the form of Puruṣa.

translated: Men invoke Indra, the one to be remembered, when they yoke their thoughts for the sake of the next world.

original: śūro nṛṣātā śavasaś cakāna ā gomati vraje bhajā tvaṃ naḥ
analyzed: śūraḥ nṛṣātā śavasaḥ cakānaḥ ā gomati vraje bhaja tvam naḥ
translated: The hero, desiring strength, who is victorious over men, favor us in the cow-rich home.

original: indriyāṇi śatakrato yā te janeṣu pañcasu
analyzed: indriyāṇi śatakrato yā te janeṣu pañcasu
translated: The powers, O Shatakratu, that you have in the five peoples,
O Indra, I choose those for myself.

original: anu te dāyi maha indriyāya satrā te viśvam anuvṛtra hatyai
analyzed: anu te dāyi mahe indriyāya satrā te viśvam anuvṛtra
translated: Grant you great power for ever, for the slaying of Vrtra, for ever.

original: anu kṣatram anu saho yajatrendra devebhir an ute nṛṣahye
analyzed: anu kṣatram anu sahaḥ yajatra indra devebhiḥ an ute nṛṣahye
translated: After the lordship, after the strength, O holy Indra, together with the gods, together with men,
He yokes the chariot, seeking the cows,

original: ṃ haribhyām upa brahmāṇi jujuṣāṇam asthuḥ
analyzed: ṃ haribhyām upa brahmāṇi jujuṣāṇam asthuḥ
translated: The two bay horses, the Brahmanas who desire him, have come.

original: vi bādhiṣṭā sya rodasī mahitvā indro vṛtrāṇy apratī jaghanvān
analyzed: vi sya rodasī mahitvā indraḥ vṛtrāṇi apratī
translated: He has filled the two world-halves with his greatness, Indra, the crusher of the Dasyus, the invincible.
For the slaying
He has filled.

original: VMP divides this verse making the second line the first line of chapter / The numbering is adjusted so that the complete verse comes
analyzed: divides this verse making the second line the first line of chapter  the numbering is adjusted so that the complete verse comes
translated: The VMP divides this verse, making the second line the first line of the chapter. The numbering is adjusted so that the complete verse comes
At the end of the chapter.
Men yoke Indra to the chariot

original: jagṛbhṇā te dakṣiṇam indra hastam vasūyavo vasupate vasūnām
analyzed: te dakṣiṇam indra hastam vasūyavaḥ vasu pate vasūnām
translated: They have grasped your right hand, O Indra, the givers of wealth, O lord of wealth, of treasures.
For we know you as the lord of cattle,

original: ṃ śūra gonām asmabhyaṃ citraṃ vṛṣaṇagṃ rayiṃ dāḥ
analyzed: ṃ śūra gonām asmabhyam citram vṛṣaṇagm rayim dāḥ
translated: O hero, grant us wealth, O wondrous, powerful Indra.

original: tavedaṃ viśvam abhitaḥ paśavyam yat paśyasi cakṣuṣā sūryasya
analyzed: tava idam viśvam abhitas paśavyam yat paśyasi cakṣuṣā sūryasya
translated: This entire world around, which you see with the eye of the sun, is yours, O Indra,

original: gavām asi gopatir eka indraḥ bhakṣīmahi te prayatasya vasvaḥ🔽RV / jagṛbhmā / TB / jagṛbhṇā
analyzed: gavām asi gopatiḥ ekaḥ indraḥ bhakṣīmahi te prayatasya 🔽ru jagṛbhma tb jagṛbhṇā
translated: You are the lord of cattle, the one Indra. We will enjoy your offered wealth.

original: VMP divides this verse making the second line the first line of chapter / The numbering is adjusted so that the complete verse comes
analyzed: divides this verse making the second line the first line of chapter  the numbering is adjusted so that the complete verse comes
translated: Dividing this verse, making the second line the first line of chapter 1. The numbering is adjusted so that the complete verse comes
VMP divides this verse, making the second line the first line of chapter 1. The numbering is adjusted so that the complete verse comes at the end of chapter 1.

original: sam indra ṇo manasā neṣi gobhiḥ sag
analyzed: sam indra naḥ manasā neṣi gobhiḥ sag
translated: O Indra, lead us with thy mind to the cattle,

original: ṃ sūribhir maghavanth saggṃ svastyā🔽saṃ brahmaṇā devakṛtaṃ yad asti saṃ devānāg
analyzed: ṃ sūribhiḥ  sam brahmaṇā yat asti sam deva anāk
translated: with the princes, O bountiful one, to the good,
with the Brahman that is the work of the gods, with the favour of the worshipful gods.

original: ārāc chatrum apa bādhasva dūram ugro yaś śambaḥ puruhūta tena🔽asme dhehi yavamad gomad indra kṛdhī dhiyaṃ jaritre vājaratnām
analyzed: ārāt śatrum apa bādhasva dūram ugraḥ yaḥ puruhūta tena  asme dhehi yavamat gomat indra kṛdhi dhiyam jaritre vāja ratnām
translated: Drive the foe away from us, O mighty one, far away with that thunderbolt which thou hast, O much-invoked one.🔽Bestow upon us, O Indra, wealth in barley and in cattle; make the singer's thought rich in booty.

original: indra śreṣṭhāni draviṇāni dhehi cittiṃ dakṣasya subhagatvam asme
analyzed: indra śreṣṭhāni draviṇāni dhehi cittim dakṣasya subhaga tvam asme
translated: O Indra, bestow on us the best treasures, the mind of Daksha, and good fortune.

original: poṣaṃ rayīṇām ariṣṭiṃ tanūnāṃ svādmānaṃ vācas sudinatvam ahnām
analyzed: poṣam rayīṇām ariṣṭim tanūnām svādmānam vācaḥ sudina tvam ahnām
translated: The increase of riches, the safety of our bodies, the sweetness of speech, and the fair days of the year.

original: bhuvas tvam indra brahmaṇā mahān bhuvo viśveṣu savaneṣu yajñiyaḥ
analyzed: bhuvaḥ tvam indra brahmaṇā mahān bhuvaḥ viśveṣu savaneṣu yajñiyaḥ
translated: Thou, O Indra, art great by the holy power (Brahman); thou art to be worshipped at all the libations (Savana);

original: bhuvo nṝgṃś cyautno viśvasmin bhare jyeṣṭhaś ca mantro viśvacarṣaṇe
analyzed: bhuvaḥ nṝn cyautnaḥ viśvasmin bhare jyeṣṭhaḥ ca mantraḥ viśvacarṣaṇe
translated: thou art the lord of men, the shaker, in every contest; and the best prayer, O thou who art worshipped by all.

analyzed: indram praṇayantam vapuḥ indraggh  ṃ sravantag
translated: Indra, the one who is praised, the one who is powerful,🔽Indra, the one who flows,
may Indra, the one who is Savita, the one who is Indra,

original: śakras sukṛtaṣya lokam indraṃ manye pitaraṃ mātārañ ca
analyzed: śakraḥ sukṛtaṣya lokam indram manye pitaram mātāram ca
translated: I consider Indra, the one who is Shakra, the one who is the world of good deeds, the one who is the father, the one who is the mother,
Indra, the one who is successful,

analyzed: ṃ ra yik  ṃ sa jitvā anag  varṣiṣṭham ūtaye bhara
translated: the one who is wealth,🔽the one who is victorious,🔽bring the best for help.
O Hariva!
O Svasti!🔽O Hita!🔽Edition. Shambhu.
Edition. O Shambhu!
O Tsa. Sada-sah. Vmp. Sada-sah.

original: jujuṣāṇam asthur eka indro 'sme sapta ca
analyzed: jujuṣāṇam asthuḥ eke indraḥ sme sapta ca
translated: They have chosen the one who is agreeable, Indra is one for us, and seven.

original: agne naya supathā rāye asmān viśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān
analyzed: agne naya su pathā rāye asmān viśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān
translated: O Agni, lead us by the good path to wealth, O god, knowing all the ways,

original: yuyodhy asmaj juhurāṇam eno bhūyiṣṭhān te namauktiṃ vidhema
analyzed: yuyodhi asmat juhurāṇam enaḥ bhūyiṣṭhān te namauktim vidhema
translated: remove from us the sin that we may live. We will offer you the most abundant homage.
Bring forth your pure oblation to the bright light,

original: ṃ havyaṃ matiṃ cāgnaye supūtam🔽yo daivyāni mānuṣā janūg
analyzed: ṃ havyam matim ca agnaye su pūtam  yaḥ daivyāni mānuṣā janūk
translated: and your pure thought as an offering to Agni,🔽who with his knowledge goes between the divine and human generations,
penetrating all things.

original: acchā giro matayo devayantīr agniṃ yanti draviṇaṃ bhikṣamāṇāḥ🔽susaṃdṛśag🔽ṃ supratīkagg
analyzed: giraḥ matayaḥ devayantīḥ agnim yanti draviṇam bhikṣamāṇāḥ  su saṃdṛśak  ṃ su pratīka g
translated: The songs and hymns that are inspired by the gods go to Agni, seeking wealth.
The well-formed, the beautiful, the self-moving,
the bearer of oblations, the envoy of men,

original: agne tvam asmad yuyodhy amīvā anagnitrā abhyamanta kṛṣṭīḥ🔽punar asmabhyag
analyzed: agne tvam asmat yuyodhi amīvāḥ anagnitrāḥ abhyamanta kṛṣṭīḥ  punar asmabhyak
translated: O Agni, keep far from us these diseases, the hostilities of those who have no fire.

original: ṃ suvitāya deva kṣāṃ viśvebhir ajarebhir yajatra
analyzed: ṃ suvitāya deva kṣām viśvebhiḥ ajarebhiḥ yajatra
translated: Again to us, O God, for prosperity, with all the undecaying ones, O worthy of sacrifice,

original: agne tvaṃ pārayā navyo asmān svastibhir ati durgāṇi viśvā
analyzed: agne tvam pāraya navyaḥ asmān svastibhiḥ ati durgāṇi viśvā
translated: O Agni, lead us by good paths to wealth, O God, thou who art skilled in holy rites.

original: pūś ca pṛthvī bahulā na urvī bhavā tokāya tanayāya śaṃ yoḥ
analyzed: pūḥ ca pṛthvī bahulā naḥ urvī bhava tokāya tanayāya śam yoḥ
translated: Wide and rich in food be the earth for us, for the welfare of our offspring and of our progeny.
(You) have come, (you) have come.
(You) bearer of oblations, VMP. Invoker of oblations.

original: pra kāravo mananā vacyamānā devadrīcīṃ nayatha devayantaḥ🔽dakṣiṇāvāḍ vājinī prācy eti havir bharanty agnaye ghṛtācī
analyzed: pra kāravaḥ mananā vacyamānāḥ devadrīcīm devayantaḥ  dakṣiṇāvāṭ vājinī prācī eti haviḥ bharantī agnaye ghṛtācī
translated: The singers, being praised, lead you to the gods' direction, you who are devoted to the gods.🔽The sacrificial fee, the strong one, goes to the east, they bring oblations to Agni, the ghee-licker.

original: agna ā yāhi vītaye gṛṇāno havyadātaye
analyzed: agne ā yāhi vītaye gṛṇānaḥ havya dātaye
translated: O Agni, come for the feast, being praised, for the offering of oblations.
Sit as the Hotar on the strew.

original: agnim īḷe purohitaṃ yajñasya devam ṛtvijam
analyzed: agnim īḍe purohitam yajñasya devam ṛtvijam
translated: I praise Agni, the priest, the god, the officiant of the sacrifice,
The Hotar, the bestower of treasures.

original: agniḥ pūrvebhir ṛṣibhir īḍyo nūtanir uta
analyzed: agniḥ pūrvebhiḥ ṛṣibhiḥ īḍyaḥ nūtaniḥ uta
translated: Agni is to be worshipped by the ancient seers and by the new ones.
He will lead the gods hither.

original: agninā rayim aśnavat poṣam eva divedive
analyzed: agninā rayim aśnavat poṣam eva dive dive
translated: By Agni one may win wealth and prosperity day by day,
Glorious, most rich in heroes.
(You) lead (them).

original: agne yaṃ yajñam adhvaraṃ viśvataḥ paribhūr asi
analyzed: agne yam yajñam adhvaram viśvatas paribhūḥ asi
translated: O Agni, whatever sacrifice or worship thou dost encompass on all sides,
That one goes to the gods.

analyzed: agniḥ hotā kavi kratuḥ satyaḥ citra śravastamaḥ
translated: Agni is the priest, of wise resolve, true, most famous for his splendor,
The god has come with the gods.
Agni is the sage, the purifier, the kinsman of the five peoples, the priest,
Him we implore, the great lord of wealth.

original: agne pavasva svapā asme varcas suvīryam
analyzed: agne pavasva su apāḥ asme varcaḥ su vīryam
translated: O Agni, purify thyself, give us splendor and good strength,
Bestowing wealth and nourishment upon me.

original: agnir mūrdhā divaḥ kakut patiḥ pṛthivyā ayam🔽apāgṃ retāg
analyzed: agniḥ mūrdhā divaḥ kakud patiḥ pṛthivyāḥ ayam  apāk retāk
translated: Agni is the head of the sky, the summit, the lord of this earth,

original: ṃsi jinvati🔽ud buddhyasvāgne prati jāgṛhy enam iṣṭāpūrte sag
analyzed: ṃsi jinvati  ud buddhyasva agne prati jāgṛhi enam iṣṭāpūrte sag
translated: He quickens the seed of the waters.
Rise up, O Agni, be watchful over this one, unite me with the fruits of sacrifice,
And again make me thy son, O father, young, following the wind,
I shall weave this thread in thee,

original: śaṃ yor vīravattamaṃ jinvati dve ca
analyzed: śam yos vīravattamam jinvati dve ca
translated: The most heroic of the two, he quickens.

original: āyātu devas sumanābhir ūtibhir yamo haveha prayatābhir aktā
analyzed: āyātu devaḥ sumanābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ yamaḥ havā iha prayatābhiḥ aktā
translated: May the god come with well-disposed aids, Yama with well-prepared offerings,

original: ā sīdatāgṃ suprayate ha barhiṣy ūrjāya jātyai mama śatruhatyai
analyzed: ā sīdata āgṃ su prayate ha barhiṣi ūrjāya jātyai mama śatru hatyai
translated: Sit down, O Agni, in the well-prepared grass, for strength, for birth, for the slaying of my enemies.

original: yame iva yatamāne yad aitaṃ pra vām bharan mānuṣā devayantaḥ
analyzed: yame iva yatamāne yat aitam pra vām bharan mānuṣāḥ devayantaḥ
translated: As if striving like Yama, when they came, the men who delight in the gods carried you forth,

original: ā sīdataggṃ svam u lokaṃ vidāne svāsasthe bhavatam indave naḥ🔽yamāya somag
analyzed: ā sīdataggm svam u lokam vidāne svāsasthe bhavatam indave naḥ  yamāya soma g
translated: Sit down in your own world, O Indra, and make room for us, O you who are seated in your own place.🔽Press out the Soma for Yama, O Soma-pressers.

original: ṃ sunuta yamāya juhutā haviḥ🔽yamagṃ ha yajño gacchaty agnidūto araṃkṛtaḥ
analyzed: ṃ sunuta yamāya juhuta haviḥ  yamagm ha yajñaḥ gacchati agni dūtaḥ araṃkṛtaḥ
translated: Press out the Soma for Yama, O Soma-pressers.🔽Offer oblations to Yama.🔽The sacrifice goes to Yama, sent by Agni as his messenger.

original: yamāya ghṛtavad dhavir juhota pra ca tiṣṭhata
analyzed: yamāya ghṛtavat haviḥ juhota pra ca tiṣṭhata
translated: Offer ghee-rich oblations to Yama and step forward.

original: so no deveṣv ā yamad dīrgham āyuḥ pra jīvase🔽yamāya madhumattamag
analyzed: saḥ naḥ deveṣu ā yamat dīrgham āyuḥ pra jīvase  yamāya madhumattamak
translated: May he lead us to the gods, to a long life, to live.
To Yama, the king, offer the sweetest Soma oblation.

original: idaṃ nama ṛṣibhyaḥ pūrvajebhyaḥ pūrvebhyaḥ pathikṛdbhyaḥ
analyzed: idam namaḥ ṛṣibhyaḥ pūrva jebhyaḥ pūrvebhyaḥ pathikṛdbhyaḥ
translated: This homage to the Rishis of the past, to the path-makers of old,

original: yo 'sya kauṣṭhya jagataḥ pārthivasyaika idvaśī🔽yamaṃ bhaṅgyaśravo gāya yo rājā anaparodhyaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ sya kauṣṭhya jagataḥ pārthivasya ekaḥ id vaśī  yamam bhaṅgyaśravaḥ gāya yaḥ rājā an aparodhyaḥ
translated: He who is the sole lord of this earthly world,🔽Sing to Yama, O Bhangya-Ashrava, the king who is not to be surpassed.

original: yamaṃ gāya bhaṅgyaśravo yo rājā anaparodhyaḥ
analyzed: yamam gāya bhaṅgyaśravaḥ yaḥ rājā an aparodhyaḥ
translated: Sing to Yama, O Bhangya-Ashrava, the king who is not to be surpassed.

original: yenāpo nadyo dhanvāni yena dyauḥ pṛthivī dṛḍhā
analyzed: yena apaḥ nadyaḥ dhanvāni yena dyauḥ pṛthivī dṛḍhā
translated: By whom the waters, the rivers, the deserts, by whom the sky and the earth are firmly established.

analyzed: hiraṇya kakṣyān su dhurān hiraṇya akṣān ayaḥ śaphān
translated: The horses with golden harnesses, well-harnessed, with golden eyes, with iron hooves,

original: aśvān anaśyato dānaṃ yamo rājā abhitiṣṭhati
analyzed: aśvān an aśyataḥ dānam yamaḥ rājā abhitiṣṭhati
translated: The gift of the horses that do not perish, King Yama presides over.

original: yamo dādhāra pṛthivīṃ yamo viśvam idaṃ jagat
analyzed: yamaḥ dādhāra pṛthivīm yamaḥ viśvam idam jagat
translated: Yama upholds the earth, Yama this entire world,

original: yamāya sarvam it trasthe yat prāṇad vāyurakṣitam
analyzed: yamāya sarvam id yat prāṇat vāyu rakṣitam
translated: To Yama belongs everything that stands here, all that breathes and moves on the earth.

original: yathā pañca yathā ṣaḍ yathā pañcadaśarṣayaḥ
analyzed: yathā pañca yathā ṣaṭ yathā pañcadaśā ṛṣayaḥ
translated: As five, as six, as fifteen sages,

original: yamaṃ yo vidyāth sa brūyād yathaika ṛṣir vijānate
analyzed: yamam yaḥ vidyāt sa brūyāt yathā ekaḥ ṛṣiḥ vijānate
translated: he who knows Yama should speak, as one sage knows.

original: TA / trasthe / KS / tasthe / VMP / rasthe
analyzed: ta trasthe ks tasthe vmp rasthe
translated: There stands, Kxs. stood, Vmp. stood

original: trikadrukebhiḥ patati ṣaḍ urvīr ekam id bṛhat
analyzed: trikadrukebhiḥ ṣaḍ urvīḥ ekam id bṛhat
translated: He flies with the Trikakudkas, six are the expanses, one is indeed great.
The Gayatri, the Tristubh, the Chandas,

original: ṃsi sarvā tā yama āhitā🔽aharahar nayamāno gām aśvaṃ puruṣaṃ jagat
analyzed: sarvā tā yame āhitā  ahar ahar nayamānaḥ gām aśvam puruṣam jagat
translated: all of them are offered to Yama.

original: vaivasvato na tṛpyati pañcabhir mānavair yamaḥ
analyzed: vaivasvataḥ na tṛpyati pañcabhiḥ mānavaiḥ yamaḥ
translated: Yama, the son of Vivasvat, is not satisfied with the five human beings, the cow, the horse, the man, and the world, which are brought to him day after day.

original: vaivasvate vivicyante yame rājani te janāḥ
analyzed: vaivasvate vivicyante yame rājani te janāḥ
translated: In the presence of Yama, the son of Vivasvat, those people are examined,

original: ye ceha satyenecchante ya u cānṛtavādinaḥ
analyzed: ye ca iha satyena icchante ye u ca anṛta vādinaḥ
translated: those who desire (heaven) by truth here, and those who speak untruth.

original: te rājann iha vivicyante 'thāyanti tvām upa
analyzed: te rājan iha vivicyante tvām upa
translated: O king, they are examined here, and then they come to you.

original: devāgṃś ca ye namasyanti brāhmaṇāg🔽ṃś cāpacityati
analyzed: ca ye namasyanti brāhmaṇāg  ṅ ca apacityati
translated: Those who worship the gods and the Brahmanas,

original: yasmin vṛkṣe supalāśe devais saṃpibate yamaḥ
analyzed: yasmin vṛkṣe su palāśe devaiḥ saṃpibate yamaḥ
translated: in that tree with good leaves, where Yama drinks with the gods,

original: atrā no viśpatiḥ pitā purāṇā anu venati
analyzed: atrā naḥ viśpatiḥ pitā anu venati
translated: there our lord of the house, our father, the ancient one, desires (to go).

original: yamo dādhāra pṛthivīṃ yamo dyām uta sūryaḥ
analyzed: yamaḥ dādhāra pṛthivīm yamaḥ dyām uta
translated: Yama supports the earth, Yama the sky, and the sun.

original: yamas sarvamṛtyus te naḥ prāṇānāṃ vāyūnām
analyzed: yamaḥ sarva mṛtyuḥ te prāṇānām vāyūnām
translated: Yama, the lord of all death, of our life breaths, of our winds,
falls. He falls.
The Tristubh meter, the Gayatri.
The text. It moves.
The ancient ones.
The sun.

original: cf / VMP / / / stenaḥ instead of te naḥ
translated: Cf. VMP... instead of te naḥ
The path-makers, the wise, the two, and the two,

original: namas sute nirṛte viśvarūpe 'yasmayaṃ vi cṛtā bandham etam
analyzed: namaḥ sute nirṛte viśvarūpe yasmayam vi cṛta bandham etam
translated: Homage to the pressed-out Nirriti of all forms, loosen this iron bond.

original: yamena tvaṃ yamyā saṃvidānottaman nākam adhi rohayemam
analyzed: yamena tvam yamyā saṃvidānā uttaman nākam adhi rohaya imam
translated: In agreement with Yama and Yamî, O Nirriti, raise this one to the highest vault.

original: yat te devī niṛṛtir ābabandha dāma grīvāsv avicartyam
analyzed: yat te devī niṛṛtiḥ ābabandha dāma grīvāsu a vicartyam
translated: What bond, O goddess Nirriti, thou hast bound on his neck that cannot be loosened,

original: idaṃ te tad vi ṣyāmy āyuṣo na madhyād athā jīvaḥ pitum addhi pramuktaḥ
analyzed: idam te tat vi syāmi āyuṣaḥ na madhyāt athā jīvaḥ pitum addhi pramuktaḥ
translated: that will I loosen for thee from the middle of his life. Now, released, live thou and eat.

original: yasyāste asyāḥ krūra āsañ juhomy eṣāṃ bandhānām avasarjanāya
analyzed: yasyāḥ te asyāḥ krūraḥ āsam juhomi eṣām bandhānām avasarjanāya
translated: To the cruel one of this thy bond I offer, for the loosing of these bonds.

original: bhūmir iti tvā janā vidur nirṛtir iti tvāhaṃ pari veda viśvataḥ
analyzed: bhūmiḥ iti tvā janāḥ viduḥ nirṛtiḥ iti tvā aham pari veda viśvatas
translated: As 'earth' the people know thee, as 'Nirriti' I know thee on all sides.

analyzed: a sunvantam a yajamānam iccha stenasya ityām taskarasya anveṣi
translated: Seek him who has not offered a sacrifice, who has not made a libation, the track of the thief, the robber.

original: anyam asmad iccha sā ta ityā namo devi nirṛte tubhyam astu
analyzed: anyam asmat iccha sā te ityā namaḥ devi nirṛte tubhyam astu
translated: Seek him other than us. That is thine. Homage to thee, O goddess Nirriti, be to thee!

original: devīm ahaṃ nirṛtiṃ vandamānaḥ piteva putraṃ dasaye vacobhiḥ
analyzed: devīm aham nirṛtim vandamānaḥ pitā iva putram dasaye vacobhiḥ
translated: I, praising the goddess Nirriti, with words like a father to a son,

original: viśvasya yā jāyamānasya veda śiraśśiraḥ prati sūrī vicaṣte
analyzed: viśvasya yā jāyamānasya veda śiraḥ śiraḥ prati sūrī vicaṣte
translated: She who knows all that is born in the universe, the sage arranges each head in its place.

original: niveśanas saṃgamano vasūnāṃ viśvā rūpābhicaṣṭe śacībhiḥ
analyzed: niveśanaḥ saṃgamanaḥ vasūnām viśvā rūpā abhicaṣṭe śacībhiḥ
translated: The abode, the gatherer of treasures, she beholds all forms with her powers.
O wife of the hero, drive away the difficulties and dangers.

original: yamena yamy āyuṣā saṃvidānā piteva putram abhirakṣatan naḥ
analyzed: yamena yami āyuṣā pitā iva putram abhirakṣatat naḥ
translated: In accord with Yama, the controller, may she, like a father protecting a son, watch over us.

original: namas te nirṛtaye ghanatejāya tasmai visṛja bandhanāt
analyzed: namaḥ te nirṛtaye ghana tejāya tasmai visṛja bandhanāt
translated: Homage to you, Nirriti, of dense splendor. Untie him from the bonds.
O Yama, lead him.

original: ṃ savitā deva uttamān anīke abhirocaya yāyinām
analyzed: ṃ savitā devaḥ uttamān anīke abhirocaya yāyinām
translated: May Savitar, the god, illuminate the best of the moving ones in the highest place.
The Vasus are the first of the gods.

analyzed: ṃ saḥ sya prajām paśūn pāhi
translated: Protect his offspring and cattle.

original: ato devebhyaḥ paśubhir yo vai vasavas svasty astu
analyzed: atas devebhyaḥ paśubhiḥ yaḥ vai vasavaḥ svasti astu
translated: From them, the gods, with the cattle. He who is the Vasus, may he be well.

original: sahasrākṣo vā ayam agniḥ pitaro devatānām
analyzed: sahasra akṣaḥ vai ayam agniḥ pitaraḥ devatānām
translated: This Agni is the thousand-eyed one. The ancestors are the gods.

original: vasūn yatra vasavo bhūtānāṃ pālayanti tasmā anyavasubhyaḥ
analyzed: vasūn yatra vasavaḥ bhūtānām pālayanti tasmai anya vasubhyaḥ
translated: Where the Vasus, the lords of beings, protect, therefore, from the other Vasus.
Edition. Samvidhanas.
Edition. Samvidanas
Beholds. Eight and

original: astabhnād dyām ṛṣabho antarikṣam amimīta varīmāṇaṃ pṛthivyā
analyzed: dyām ṛṣabhaḥ antarikṣam amimīta varīmāṇam pṛthivyā
translated: The Bull hath propped the sky, the atmosphere hath he measured, and the breadth of earth.

original: āsīdad viśvā bhuvanāni saṃrāḍ viśvet tāni varuṇasya vratāni
analyzed: āsīdat viśvā bhuvanāni saṃrāj viśvā id tāni varuṇasya vratāni
translated: He hath sat down encompassing all the worlds: all these are Varuna's ordinances.

original: yac cid dhi te viśo yathā pra deva varuṇa vratam
analyzed: yat cit hi te viśaḥ yathā pra deva varuṇa vratam
translated: Whatever, God Varuna, we have transgressed, O God, thy law, as men,
We make amends for it, O thou of heaven, for heaven is thine.

original: yat kiṃ cedaṃ varuṇa daivye jane 'bhidrohaṃ manuṣyāś carāmasi
analyzed: yat kim ca idam varuṇa daivye jane bhidroham manuṣyāḥ carāmasi
translated: Whatever sin we have committed, O Varuna, in the divine race, or in the race of men,

original: acittī yat tava dharmā yuyopima mā nas tasmād enaso deva rīriṣaḥ
analyzed: acittī yat tava dharmā yuyopima mā naḥ tasmāt enasaḥ deva rīriṣaḥ
translated: When we have disregarded thy laws, O God, afflict us not with that sin.

original: kitavāso yad riripur na dīvi yad vā ghā satyam uta yan na vidma
analyzed: kitavāsaḥ yat riripuḥ na dīvi yat vā gha satyam uta yat na vidma
translated: If we have sinned in gambling, or in divination, or if we know not what is true,

original: sarvā tā vi ṣya śithireva devāthā te syāma varuṇa piyāsaḥ
analyzed: sarvā tā vi sya śithirā iva te syāma varuṇa piyāsaḥ
translated: All these, O Gods, do thou loosen and untie, and then may we be dear to thee, O Varuna.

original: ava te heḍo varuṇa namobhir ava yajñebhir īmahe havirbhiḥ
analyzed: ava te heḍaḥ varuṇa namobhiḥ ava yajñebhiḥ īmahe havirbhiḥ
translated: Thy wrath, O Varuna, we appease with homage, with sacrifices, with oblations.

original: kṣayann asmabhyam asura praceto rājann enāg
translated: Be gracious unto us, O Asura, O far-seeing King,

analyzed: ṃsi śiśrathaḥ kṛtāni  text astabhnā  ru deva adhā
translated: and loose the sins that we have committed.🔽The Gods have propped the sky,🔽the far-seeing Gods,
the far-seeing Gods.

original: ud uttamaṃ varuṇa pāśam asmad avādhamaṃ vi madhyamaggṃ śrathāya
analyzed: ud uttamam varuṇa pāśam asmat ava adhamam vi madhyamaggṃ śrathāya
translated: Loosen thou from us, O Varuna, the highest, loosen the lowest, loosen the middle bond.

original: athā vayam āditya vrate tavānāgaso aditaye syāma
analyzed: athā vayam āditya vrate tava anāgasaḥ aditaye syāma
translated: Then may we, O Āditya, in your vow, be sinless to Aditi.

original: imaṃ me varuṇa śrudhī havam adyā ca mṛḍaya
analyzed: imam me varuṇa śrudhi havam adya ca mṛḍaya
translated: Hear this my call, O Varuṇa, and today be gracious to me.
I have come to you as one in need.

original: tat tvā yāmi brahmaṇā vandamānas tad ā śāste yajamāno havirbhiḥ
analyzed: tvā yāmi brahmaṇā vandamānaḥ tat ā śāste yajamānaḥ havirbhiḥ
translated: To you I come, worshipping with prayer, to you the sacrificer with oblations commands.

analyzed: a heḍamānaḥ varuṇa iha bodhi uruśak
translated: Be not wrathful, O Varuṇa, be thoughtful here, O wide-ruler.

original: ṃsa mā na āyuḥ pra moṣīḥ
analyzed: ṃsa mā naḥ āyuḥ pra moṣīḥ
translated: Do not deprive us of our life.

original: tvaṃ no agne varuṇasya vidvān devasya heḍo 'va yāsisīṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: tvam naḥ agne varuṇasya vidvān devasya heḍaḥ vaḥ yāsisīṣṭhāḥ
translated: You, O Agni, knowing Varuṇa's law, may you best carry us away from the god's wrath.

original: yajiṣṭho vahnitamaś śośucāno viśvā dveṣāg🔽ṃsi pra mumugdhy asmat🔽sa tvaṃ no agne 'vamo bhavotī nediṣṭho asyā uṣaso vyuṣṭau
analyzed: yajiṣṭhaḥ vahnitamaḥ śośucānaḥ viśvā dveṣā ak  pra mumugdhi asmat  sa tvam naḥ agne vamaḥ bhava ūtī nediṣṭhaḥ asyāḥ uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭau
translated: Best sacrificer, most purifying, shining, drive away all enmities from us.🔽And you, O Agni, be our nearest protector, most near at this dawn's shining.

original: ava yakṣva no varuṇag🔽ṃ rarāṇo vīhi mṛḍīkag🔽ṃ suhavo na edhi
analyzed: ava yakṣva naḥ varuṇak  ṃ rarāṇaḥ mṛḍīka g  ṃ su havaḥ naḥ edhi
translated: Carry our oblation to the gods, O Agni, and bring us good fortune.🔽Carry our oblation to the gods, O Agni, and bring us good fortune.

original: tvam agne ayāsy ayā san manasā hitaḥ
analyzed: tvam agne ayāsi ayā san manasā hitaḥ
translated: You, O Agni, are the impeller, impelled by the mind,

original: ayā san havyam ūhiṣe ayā no dhehi bheṣajam
analyzed: ayā san havyam ūhiṣe ayā naḥ dhehi bheṣajam
translated: impelled, you carry the oblation. Impel us to health.

original: ye te śataṃ varuṇa ye sahasraṃ yajñiyāḥ pāśā vitatāḥ purutrā
analyzed: ye te śatam varuṇa ye sahasram yajñiyāḥ pāśāḥ vitatāḥ purutrā
translated: Your hundred, O Varuṇa, your thousand, your sacrificial nooses spread in many places,

original: tebhyo na indras savitota viṣṇur viśvedevā muñcantu marutas svastyā🔽Text / ta
analyzed: tebhyaḥ naḥ indraḥ savitā uta viṣṇuḥ viśve devāḥ muñcantu marutaḥ svastyā 🔽text ta
translated: From these may Indra, Savitar, and Vishṇu, the All-gods, the Maruts, set us free with welfare.

analyzed: rayivṛdhaḥ sumedhāḥ śvetaḥ siṣakti niyutām abhiśrīḥ
translated: The fat one, the one with fire, the one who increases wealth, the wise one, the white one, the one who moves to the assembled, the one with splendor

original: te vāyave samanaso vi tasthur viśven naras svapatyāni cakruḥ
analyzed: te vāyave samanasaḥ vi tasthuḥ viśvā id naraḥ su apatyāni cakruḥ
translated: They have stood apart, with one mind, for Vayu, all the men have performed their own duties

original: rāye inu yaṃ jajñatū rodasī ubhe rāye devī dhiṣaṇā dhāti devam
analyzed: rāye inu yam jajñatuḥ ubhe rāye devī dhiṣaṇā dhāti devam
translated: For wealth, indeed, the two worlds were born, for wealth the divine Dhisana supports the god

analyzed: vāyum niyutaḥ saścata svāḥ uta śvetam vasu dhitim

analyzed: ā vāyo bhūṣa śuci pāḥ upa naḥ sahasram te niyutaḥ viśva vāra
translated: O Vayu, come to us, O you who drink the pure, with your thousand teams, O you who give all boons

analyzed: upa u te andhaḥ madyam ayāmi yasya deva dadhiṣe pūrvapeyam
translated: I bring you the intoxicating drink, of which, O god, you have the first drink
With which you go, O you who are to be invoked

original: ṃsam acchā niyudbhir vāyav iṣṭaye duroṇe🔽ni no rayigṃ subhojasaṃ yuveha ni vīravad gavyam aśviyaṃ ca rādhaḥ🔽pra vāyum acchā bṛhatī manīṣā bṛhadrayiṃ viśvavārāg
analyzed: ṃsam acchā niyudbhiḥ vāyo iṣṭaye duroṇe  ni naḥ rayigm su bhojasam yuva iha ni gavyam aśviyam ca rādhaḥ  pra vāyum acchā bṛhatī manīṣā bṛhat rayim viśva vārā
translated: Come to us, O Vayu, with your teams, for the sake of the house🔽Bestow on us here wealth with good food, and a gift of cattle and horses with heroes
The lofty thought goes to Vayu, to the one with great wealth, to the one who is to be invoked in all matters, to the one who is drawn by chariots

analyzed: dutadyāmā niyutaḥ patyamānaḥ kaviḥ kavim iyakṣasi prayajyo

analyzed: ru pīvaḥ annām  ru rodasi ime

translated: all-giving🔽Come to our sacrifice with your yokes, with your hundredfold,
with your thousandfold (gifts).

original: vāyo asmin haviṣi mādayasva yūyaṃ pāta svastibhis sadā naḥ
analyzed: vāyo asmin haviṣi mādayasva yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: O Vayu, rejoice in this oblation. Do you all protect us with your blessings always.
O Vayu, enjoy the hundred tawny horses that are to be nourished,

original: uta vā te sahasriṇo ratha ā yātu pājasā
analyzed: uta vā te sahasriṇaḥ rathaḥ ā yātu pājasā
translated: Or may your thousand-fold chariot come with speed.

original: pra yā vājaṃ na heṣantaṃ perum asyasy arjuni
analyzed: pra yā vājam na heṣantam perum asyasi arjuni
translated: You who neigh like a horse, go forth to the swift one's race, O Arjuna.

original: ṛdūdareṇa sakhyā saceya yo mā na riṣyed dharyaśva pītaḥ
analyzed: ṛdūdareṇa sakhyā saceya yaḥ mā na riṣyet hari aśva pītaḥ
translated: I would be united with a friend with a round belly, with whom I may not perish, O Haryaśva, O drinker of the Soma.

original: prakramyātha ūrdhvaṃ puruṣajo viveśa prajāsu vṛtyāya asūn dadāti
analyzed: ūrdhvam puruṣa jaḥ viveśa prajāsu vṛtyāya asūn dadāti

I am he, I will sacrifice in this, may he protect.

analyzed: yaḥ mātariśvā viyat ṃśakaḥ vṛtaḥ hūyate
translated: He who is Mātariśvan, born from the sky, is measured out, is offered.
With whose hundredfold (gifts) may he be satisfied.

original: marutaḥ paramātmā paramā gatiḥ paraṃ brahma paraṃ yogam
analyzed: marutaḥ parama ātmā paramā gatiḥ param brahma param yogam
translated: The Maruts are the supreme self, the supreme goal, the supreme Brahman, the supreme yoga.

analyzed: paramātmānam manye ajaram yaḥ gniḥ aham annam vāyave
translated: I consider the supreme self to be the imperishable Agni, I am the food for Vayu.

original: maruto gaṇānāṃ prathamas saptadhānāṃ mūrdhā vāyo anyam ajaragṃ śriyam
analyzed: marutaḥ gaṇānām prathamaḥ saptadhānām mūrdhā vāyo anyam ajaragm śriyam

analyzed: hotāram vai rayan tvā āhuḥ agne havyam marudbhyaḥ
translated: They call the priest Agni, the oblation to the Maruts
Having approached,

original: edition / viyajñāto instead of viyaj jāto
translated: The edition has viyajñāta instead of viyaj jāta
The one to be worshipped should come together with the four

analyzed: adbhyaḥ tirodhā ajāyata tava vaiśravaṇaḥ sadā

analyzed: tirodhehi sapatnān naḥ ye apaḥ aśnanti kecana

analyzed: yasmai bhūtāni balim āvahanti dhanam gāvaḥ hasti hiraṇyam aśvān

original: asāma sumatau yajñiyasya śriyaṃ bibhrato innamukhīṃ virājam
analyzed: asāma sumatau yajñiyasya śriyam bibhrataḥ inna mukhīm virājam
translated: May we be in the favor of the worthy one, bearing the prosperity of the shining one with a beautiful face

original: sudarśane ca krauñce ca maināge ca mahāgirau🔽sata dvāṭṭāragamantā sag
analyzed: sudarśane ca krauñce ca maināge ca mahā girau  sata sag
translated: On the beautiful mountain Krauncha and the great mountain Mainaka🔽Having gone to the two doors of your city
Which is to be enjoyed
Thus the mantras. The ritual is from here onwards

original: yadi baligṃ hared dhiraṇyanābhaye vitudaye kauberāyāyaṃ baliḥ
analyzed: yadi haret hiraṇyanābhaye kauberāya ayam baliḥ
translated: If one should offer the Bali, this Bali is for Hiranyana, for Vitu, for Kubera

original: All of / / is a continuous quote from TA / / only /🔽sarvabhūtādhipataye nama ity atha balig
analyzed: all of is a continuous quote from ta only  sarva bhūta adhipataye namaḥ iti atha bali g

Having taken the oblation, one should worship with the words Salutations to the Lord of all beings.

original: kṣatraṃ kṣatraṃ vaiśravaṇo brāhmaṇā vayaggṃ smaḥ🔽namas te astu mā mā hig
analyzed: kṣatram kṣatram vaiśravaṇaḥ brāhmaṇāḥ vayaggn smaḥ  namaḥ te astu mā mā hik
translated: The Kshatriya is Vaiśravaṇa, we are the Brahmins.

analyzed: ṃsīḥ asmāt praviśya annam addhi iti
translated: Salutations to you, do not injure me. Having entered this food, eat it.

original: atha tam agnim ādadhīta yasminn etat karma prayuñjīta🔽tirodhā bhūs tirodhā bhuvaḥ
analyzed: atha tam agnim ādadhīta yasmin etat karma prayuñjīta  tirodhāḥ bhūḥ tirodhāḥ bhuvaḥ
translated: Then one should kindle that fire in which one would perform this rite.🔽The earth is hidden, the atmosphere is hidden.

original: tirodhās svas tirodhā bhūr bhuvas svaḥ🔽sarveṣāṃ lokānām ādhipatye sīdety atha tam agnim indhīta
analyzed: svar tirodhāḥ bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar  sarveṣām lokānām ādhipatye sīda iti atha tam agnim indhīta
translated: The heaven is hidden, the earth, atmosphere, and heaven are hidden.

original: yasminn etat karma prayuñjīta tirodhā bhūs svāhā
analyzed: yasmin etat karma prayuñjīta tirodhāḥ bhūḥ svāhā
translated: One should sit in lordship over all the worlds. Then one should kindle that fire in which one would perform this rite. The earth is hidden, svāhā.

original: tirodhā bhuvas svāhā tirodhā svas svāhā tirodhā bhūr bhuvas svas svāhā yasminn asya kāle sarvā āhutīr hutā bhaveyuḥ

Tirodhā. Corrected to tirodhās.
The version in T.

original: api brāhmaṇamukhīnās tasminn ahnaḥ kāle prayuñjīta
analyzed: api brāhmaṇa mukhīnāḥ tasmin ahnaḥ kāle prayuñjīta
translated: Even those with the face of a Brahmin, one should perform this rite at that time of the day.

original: paras suptajanād vepi mā sma pramādyantam ādhyāpayet
analyzed: paras supta janāt vepi mā sma pramādyantam
translated: One should not teach him who is careless, even if he is superior to one who is asleep.

analyzed: sarva arthāḥ siddhyante yaḥ evam veda
translated: All goals are accomplished for one who knows this.

original: kṣudhyann idam ajānatāṃ sarvāthā na siddhyante
analyzed: kṣudhyan idam a jānatām sarvāthā na
translated: For one who does not know this, all goals are not accomplished while hungry.

analyzed: yaḥ te vighātukaḥ bhrātā mama antar hṛdaye śritaḥ

analyzed: rāja adhirājāya prasahya sāhine namaḥ vayam vaiśravaṇāya kurmahe

analyzed: sa me kāmān kāma kāmāya mahyam kāma īśvaraḥ vaiśravaṇaḥ

Homage to Kubera, Vaiśravaṇa, the great king.

original: rāyas poṣāyāyuṣā tvā nidhīśo bhrātṛvyāṇāṃ mahasāṃ cādhipatyai
analyzed: rāyaḥ poṣāya āyuṣā tvā nidhi īśaḥ bhrātṛvyāṇām mahasām

translated: O great one, you stand in the lofty abodes of heaven. The dark one turns towards you.

analyzed: ye te rātrī nṛ cakṣasaḥ navatiḥ nava
translated: O Night, those of yours who are men-seers, who are yoked, ninety-nine,

original: aśītis saṃtv aṣṭā uto te sapta saptatīḥ
analyzed: aśītiḥ aṣṭau uta u te sapta saptatīḥ
translated: eighty, and also eight, and to you seven times seven.

analyzed: rātrīm pra padye jananīm sarva bhūta niveśanīm
translated: I go to Night, the mother who houses all beings,

original: bhadrāṃ bhagavatīṃ kṛṣṇāṃ viśvasya jagato niśām
analyzed: bhadrām bhagavatīm kṛṣṇām viśvasya jagataḥ niśām
translated: The auspicious, blessed, dark one, the night of the entire universe,
The one who makes one lie down, who restrains, who is adorned with planets and stars,

original: prapanno 'ham śivāṃ rātrīṃ bhadre pāram aśīmahi bhadre pāram aśīmahy oṃ namaḥ
analyzed: prapannaḥ ham śivām rātrīm bhadre pāram aśīmahi bhadre pāram aśīmahi om namaḥ
translated: I have gone to auspicious Night. O good one, may we reach the other shore. O good one, may we reach the other shore. Om, salutations.
In the Vrkika

original: VMP / vā / RV / TB / etc / gā
analyzed: vmp vā ru tb e t c gā
translated: Vmp. Va. Rv. Tbh. Etc. Ga

original: Verses / / / correspond to verses / / of the Ṛg Veda Khila /
analyzed: verses correspond to verses of the ṛg veda khila
translated: The verses correspond to verses of the Rig Veda Khil.

original: the Rātrī Khila / Verses / / / also correspond to AV / / and / / respectively / In Coburn's Devi Māhātmya /
analyzed: the rātrī khila verses also correspond to av and respectively in coburns devi māhātmya
translated: The Ratri Khil. Verses also correspond to Av. And respectively. In Coburn's Devi Mahatmya.

original: he says that the sole variant between RVKh and AV is the AV's reading of draṣṭāro for yuktāso / However in Whitney's Atharva Veda Saṃhitā /
analyzed: he says that the sole varant between rvkh and av is the avs reading of draṣṭāraḥ for yuktāsaḥ however in atharvan veda saṃhitā
translated: He says that the only variant between Rvkh and Av is Av's reading of drastaro for yuktaso. However, in Whitneya's Atharva Veda Samhita.🔽Vol.
Voh.🔽P.🔽

original: he indicates another variant is AV's reading of santi for santu /
analyzed: he indicates another varant is av reading of santi for santu
translated: He indicates another variant is Av's reading of santi for santu.
Vmp. Pitaraḥ prayu. Av.
Rvkh. Pitur aprayi
Av. Drastaro
Av. Santi
The one who leads into
The one who restrains
The seven and thirty who seek

analyzed: hiraṇya garbhe āpaḥ ha yat prajāpate
translated: O Hiranyagarbha, when the waters
He knows as the son of his father
He is the mother

original: ṃ sa sūnur bhuvat sa bhuvat punarmaghaḥ
analyzed: ṃ sa sūnuḥ bhuvat sa bhuvat punarmaghaḥ
translated: He was the son, he was the one with renewed wealth
He wove the sky, the atmosphere

original: ṃ sa suvas sa viśvā bhuvo abhavat sa ā bhavat
analyzed: ṃ sa suvar sa viśvāḥ bhuvaḥ abhavat saḥ ā bhavat
translated: He became all that exists, he became

analyzed: sa pratna vat navīyasā agne dyumnena
translated: O Agni, with your new and ancient glory, be united
You have extended your light far and wide

original: ni kāvyā vedhasaś śaśvatas kar haste dadhāno naryā purūṇi
analyzed: ni kāvyā śaśvataḥ kaḥ haste dadhānaḥ naryā purūṇi
translated: Holding in your hand the eternal and wise creator's many manly deeds

analyzed: agniḥ bhuvat rayi patiḥ rayīṇām ak
translated: Agni has become the lord of riches,
always creating all the immortal things

original: hiraṇyapāṇim ūtaye savitāram upa hvaye sa cettā devatā padam🔽vāmam adya savitar vāmam u śvo divedive vāmam asmabhyagṃ sāvīḥ
analyzed: hiraṇya pāṇim ūtaye savitāram upa hvaye sa cettā devatā padam  vāmam adya savitar vāmam u śvas dive dive vāmam asmabhyagm sāvīḥ
translated: I invoke Savitar, golden-handed, for help. He is the god who knows the place.🔽O Savitar, today the good, tomorrow the good, day by day the good, do thou grant to us.

original: vāmasya hi kṣayasya deva bhūrer ayā dhiya vāmabhājas syama
analyzed: vāmasya hi kṣayasya deva bhūreḥ ayā dhiya vāma bhājaḥ syama
translated: For, O god, we are the possessors of the good, the vast wealth of the good. May our thoughts be sharers of the good.

original: baḍ itthā parvatānāṃ khidraṃ bibharṣi pṛthivi
analyzed: baṭ itthā parvatānām khidram bibharṣi pṛthivi
translated: O Earth, thou bearest in this place the hidden strength of the mountains.

original: pra yā bhūmi pravatvati mahnā jinoṣi mahini
analyzed: pra yā bhūmi pravatvati mahnā jinoṣi
translated: O great one, thou conquerest by thy greatness the earth that is to be conquered.

original: The and editions of the VMP text here insert a footnote that reads /
analyzed: the  and  editions of the vmp text here insert a footnote that reads
translated: The edition of the VMP text here inserts a footnote that reads:
Udito yam citram.

original: which is the only part missing in an otherwise continuous quote from TS / / / Keith's translation for this pratīka his TS / /
analyzed: is the only part missing in an otherwise continuous quote from ts keiths translation for this pratīka his ts
translated: Which is the only part missing in an otherwise continuous quote from TS... Keith's translation for this pratika his TS...
Is. The radiant.
Text. Vetasas

original: VMP divides this verse making the second line the first line of chapter / The numbering is adjusted so that the complete verse comes
analyzed: divides this verse making the second line the first line of chapter  the numbering is adjusted so that the complete verse comes
translated: VMP divides this verse, making the second line the first line of chapter. The numbering is adjusted so that the complete verse comes
At the end of chapter.

original: stomāsas tvā vicāriṇi prati ṣṭobhanty aktubhiḥ
analyzed: stomāsaḥ tvā vicāriṇi prati stobhanti aktubhiḥ
translated: The Stoma-s praise you, O discerning one, with their rays.

original: pra yā vājaṃ na heṣantaṃ perum asyasy arjuni
analyzed: pra yā vājam na heṣantam perum asyasi arjuni
translated: You who go like a neighing horse, the swift one, O Arjuna.

original: ṛdūdareṇa sakhyā saceya yo mā na riṣyed dharyaśva pītaḥ
analyzed: ṛdūdareṇa sakhyā saceya yaḥ mā na riṣyet hari aśva pītaḥ
translated: I would associate with the one with a slender belly, O Haryaśva, the one who would not harm me, the drunk one.

original: ayaṃ yas somo nyadhāyy asme tasmā indraṃ pratiram emy accha
analyzed: ayam yaḥ somaḥ nyadhāyi asme tasmai indram pratiram emi accha
translated: This Soma that has been placed here for us, from it I approach Indra for support.

original: āpāntamanyus tṛpalaprabharmā dhuniś śimīvāñ charumāgṃ ṛjīṣī
analyzed: āpāntamanyuḥ tṛpala prabharmā dhuniḥ śimīvān ṛjīṣī
translated: With anger reaching to the end, with the power to crush the strong, with shaking, with the speed of an arrow, with a sharp weapon.

original: somo viśvāny atasā vanāni nārvāg indraṃ pratimānāni debhuḥ
analyzed: somaḥ viśvāni atasā vanāni na arvāk indram pratimānāni debhuḥ
translated: Soma, all the forests that are far away have not turned away from Indra, the measures of worship have not turned away.

original: pra suvānas soma ṛtayuś ciketendrāya brahma jamadagnir arcann
analyzed: pra suvānaḥ somaḥ ṛtayuḥ ciketa indrāya brahma jamadagniḥ arcan
translated: Soma, being pressed, has shone forth, righteous, Jamadagni, praising, has offered prayer to Indra.

original: vṛṣāyantāsi śavasas turasyāntar yaccha gṛṇate dhartraṃ dṛgṃha
analyzed: vṛṣāyantā asi śavasaḥ turasya antar yaccha gṛṇate dhartram dṛgṃha
translated: You are the one who makes strong, restrain the swift one, give the supporter to the singer.

original: sabādhas te madaṃ ca śuṣmayaṃ ca brahma naro brahmakṛtas saparyan
analyzed: sabādhaḥ te madam ca śuṣmayam ca brahma naraḥ brahma kṛtaḥ saparyan
translated: The men who have made the prayer have served your intoxicating drink and your strength, O you who are to be praised.

original: arko vā yat turate somacakṣās tatred indro dadhate pṛtsu turyām
analyzed: arkaḥ vā yat turate soma cakṣāḥ tatra id indraḥ dadhate
translated: When the sun, looking at Soma, hastens, there Indra places his fourth (part) in the contests.
In the contests.

original: VMP divides this verse making the second line the first line of chapter / The numbering is adjusted so that the complete verse comes
analyzed: divides this verse making the second line the first line of chapter  the numbering is adjusted so that the complete verse comes
translated: The text divides this verse, making the second line the first line of the chapter. The numbering is adjusted so that the complete verse comes
at the end of the chapter.

original: vaṣaṭ te viṣṇav āsa ā kṛṇomi tan me juṣasva śipiviṣṭa havyam
analyzed: vaṣaṭ te viṣṇo āsaḥ ā kṛṇomi tat me juṣasva śipiviṣṭa havyam
translated: I offer you the Vasat call, O Vishnu, be pleased with that oblation of mine, O Shikhandin.

original: vardhantu tvā suṣṭutayo giro me yūyaṃ pāta svastibhis sadā naḥ
analyzed: vardhantu tvā suṣṭutayaḥ giraḥ me yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May my praisesongs, well-sung, strengthen you. You, protect us always with your blessings.

original: pra tat te adya śipiviṣṭa nāmāryaś śag
analyzed: pra tat te adya śipiviṣṭa nāma aryaḥ śak
translated: That name of yours, O Shikhandin, which the noble one
knows, O you who know the ways, I will praise today.

original: taṃ tvā gṛṇāmi tavasam atavīyān kṣayantam asya rajasaḥ parāke
analyzed: tam tvā gṛṇāmi tavasam a tavīyān kṣayantam asya rajasaḥ parāke
translated: I sing to you, O mighty one, the most powerful, dwelling far away in this region

original: kim it te viṣṇo paricakṣyaṃ bhūt pra yad vavakṣe śipiviṣṭo asmi
analyzed: kim id te viṣṇo paricakṣyam bhūt pra yat vavakṣe śipiviṣṭaḥ asmi
translated: What is there to be said about you, O Viṣṇu, when I, Śipiviṣṭa, have expanded?

original: mā varpo asmad apa gūha etad yad anyarūpas samithe babhūtha🔽agne dā daśuṣe rayiṃ vīravantaṃ parīṇasaṃ śiśīhi nas sūnumataḥ
analyzed: mā varpaḥ asmat apa gūha etat yat anya rūpaḥ samithe babhūtha  agne dāḥ daśuṣe rayim vīravantam parīṇasam śiśīhi naḥ sūnumataḥ
translated: Do not hide from us this deception, that you have become of another form in the assembly🔽O Agni, give wealth to the worshipper, with good offspring, sharpen us for the sake of offspring

original: dā no agne śatino dās sahasriṇo duro na vājagg🔽ṃ śrutyā apā vṛdhi
analyzed: dāḥ naḥ agne śatinaḥ dāḥ sahasriṇaḥ duraḥ na vājagg  ṃ śrutyāḥ apa ā vṛdhi
translated: Give us, O Agni, hundreds, give thousands, lead us to the good path, O you who are to be praised

original: prācī dyāvāpṛthivī brahmaṇā kṛdhi suvarṇa śukram uṣaso vi didyutuḥ
analyzed: prācī dyāvāpṛthivī brahmaṇā kṛdhi suvarṇa śukram uṣasaḥ vi didyutuḥ
translated: Make the eastern heaven and earth fit for sacrifice by means of the sacred hymn. The bright golden light of the dawns shines forth

original: agnir dā draviṇaṃ vīrapeśā agnir ṛṣiṃ yas sahasrā sanoti
analyzed: agniḥ dāḥ draviṇam vīra peśāḥ agniḥ ṛṣim yaḥ sahasrā sanoti
translated: Agni gives wealth that delights in heroes, Agni gives the seer who wins a thousand

original: agnir divi havyam ā ta tanāgner dhāmāni vibhṛtā purutrā
analyzed: agniḥ divi havyam ā te tanā agneḥ dhāmāni vibhṛtā purutrā
translated: Agni's oblation is in the sky, Agni's abodes are spread out in many places

original: mā no mardhīr ā tū bhara
analyzed: mā naḥ mardhīḥ ā tu bhara
translated: Do not be angry with us, but bring (us wealth)

original: ghṛtaṃ na pūtaṃ tanūr arepāś śuci hiraṇyam tat te rukmo na rocata svadhāvaḥ
analyzed: ghṛtam na pūtam tanūḥ arepāḥ śuci hiraṇyam tat te rukmaḥ na rocata svadhāvas
translated: Like pure ghee, your body is unblemished. That bright golden color shines forth for you, O self-existent one

original: ubhe suścandra sarpiṣo darvī śrīṇīṣa āsani
analyzed: ubhe su ścandra sarpiṣaḥ darvī śrīṇīṣe āsani
translated: O you of very beautiful form, you fill both ladles with ghee in the fire

original: uto na utpupūryā uktheṣu śavasas pata iṣagg
analyzed: uta u naḥ utpupūryāḥ uktheṣu śavasaḥ pate iṣak
translated: And you, O lord of power, are to be praised in our hymns for food
Bring to the praisers

original: vāyo śatagṃ harīṇāṃ yuvasva poṣyāṇām uta vā te sahasriṇo ratha ā yātu pājasā
analyzed: vāyo śatagm harīṇām yuvasva poṣyāṇām uta vā te sahasriṇaḥ rathaḥ ā yātu pājasā
translated: O Vayu, yoke thy hundred or thy thousand tawny (steeds) that are to be nourished: let thy chariot come hither with its flag.
With which thou goest, O giver of gifts,

original: ṃsam acchā niyudbhir vāyav iṣṭaye duroṇe
analyzed: ṃsam acchā niyudbhiḥ vāyo iṣṭaye duroṇe
translated: Come hither, O Vayu, to the house for worship, with thy teams,

original: ni no rayigṃ subhojasaṃ yuveha ni vīravad gavyam aśviyaṃ ca rādhaḥ
analyzed: ni naḥ rayigm su bhojasam yuva iha ni vīravat gavyam aśviyam ca rādhaḥ
translated: Bestow on us here wealth that is good to enjoy, and a gift consisting of brave sons, of cattle, and of horses.

original: revatīr nas sadhamāda indre santu tuvivājāḥ kṣumanto yābhir madema
analyzed: revatīḥ naḥ sadhamādaḥ indre santu tuvi vājāḥ kṣumantaḥ yābhiḥ madema
translated: Let there be for us, with Indra, rich drinking-feast, with abundant food, with which we may rejoice.

original: revāgṃ id revatas stotā syāt tvāvato maghonaḥ pred u harivas śrutasya
analyzed: revāgn id revataḥ stotā syāt tvāvataḥ maghonaḥ pra id u harivas śrutasya
translated: The praiser of you, O rich one, O you who have abundant wealth, should be rich, O you who have bay steeds, of you who are renowned.

original: pṛthivis saparyan vididyutuś ca rādhaś catvāri ca
analyzed: pṛthiviḥ saparyan vididyutuḥ ca rādhaḥ catvāri ca
translated: Having worshipped the four quarters, the light, and the gift,

original: viśvajite dhanajite svarjite satrājite nṛjita urvarājite
analyzed: viśva jite dhana jite svar jite satrā jite nṛ jite urvarā jite
translated: To the conqueror of the universe, the conqueror of wealth, the conqueror of heaven, the conqueror of battles, the conqueror of men, the conqueror of the wide earth,

original: aśvajite gojite abjite bharendrāya somaṃ yajatāya haryatam
analyzed: aśva jite go jite ap jite bhara indrāya somam yajatāya haryatam
translated: To the conqueror of horses, the conqueror of cattle, the conqueror of waters, to Indra, to the worshipped, offer the Soma, rejoice.

analyzed: abhibhuve bhibhaṃgāya vanvate sālhāya sahamānāya vedhase
translated: To the overcomer, the conqueror, the victorious, the strong, the enduring, the wise,

original: tuvigraye vahnaye duṣṭarītave satrāsāhe nama indrāya vocata
analyzed: tuvigraye vahnaye duṣṭarītave satrāsāhe namaḥ indrāya vocata
translated: To the mighty, the burning, the hard to subdue, the fearless, to Indra utter your homage.

original: satrāsāho janabhakṣo janaṃsahaś cyavano yudhmo anu joṣam ukṣitaḥ vṛtaṃcayas sahurir vikṣvārita indrasya vocaṃ pra kṛtāni
analyzed: satrāsāhaḥ jana bhakṣaḥ janaṃsahaḥ cyavanaḥ yudhmaḥ anu joṣam ukṣitaḥ vṛtaṃcayaḥ sahuriḥ indrasya vocam pra kṛtāni
translated: The unconquered, the people-devourer, the people-conqueror, the one who turns away, the warrior, anointed according to his desire, the gatherer of wealth, the one who is praised in many places - I will tell of Indra's deeds.

original: anānudo vṛṣabho dodhato vadho gaṃbhīra ṛṣvo asamaṣṭakāvyaḥ
analyzed: anānudaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ dodhataḥ vadhaḥ gaṃbhīraḥ ṛṣvaḥ a samaṣṭa kāvyaḥ
translated: The unconquered bull, the killer of the rushing (enemy), the deep, lofty one, whose wisdom is unassailable,

original: radhracodaś śnathano vīlitas pṛthur indras suyajña uṣasas svar janat
analyzed: radhra codaḥ śnathanaḥ vīlitaḥ pṛthuḥ indraḥ su yajñaḥ uṣasaḥ svar janat
translated: The one who impels the slow, the one who binds, the wide one, Indra, the one with good sacrifices, has created the light of the dawns.

original: yajñena gātum apturo vividrire dhiyo hinvānā uśijo manīṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: yajñena gātum apturaḥ vividrire dhiyaḥ hinvānāḥ uśijaḥ manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: With sacrifice the swift ones have extended their path, the wise ones, the eager ones, with their thoughts impelling.

original: abhisvarā niṣadā gā avasyava indre hinvānā draviṇāny āśata
analyzed: abhisvarā niṣadā gāḥ avasyavaḥ indre hinvānāḥ draviṇāni āśata
translated: The singers, the sitters, the cows, the desires - impelling Indra, they have attained the riches.
Praised in many places

original: indra śreṣṭhāni draviṇāni dhehi cittiṃ dakṣasya subhagatvam asme
analyzed: indra śreṣṭhāni draviṇāni dhehi cittim dakṣasya subhaga tvam asme
translated: O Indra, bestow the best riches upon us, the mind of Daksha, and good fortune.

original: poṣaṃ rayīṇām ariṣṭiṃ tanūnāṃ svādmānaṃ vācas sudinatvam ahnām
analyzed: poṣam rayīṇām ariṣṭim tanūnām svādmānam vācaḥ sudina tvam ahnām
translated: The nourishment of wealth, the protection of our bodies, the sweetness of speech, and the goodness of the days.

analyzed: trikadrukeṣu mahiṣaḥ yava āśiram tuvi śuṣmaḥ
translated: On the Trikadrukas, the strong one, the one who eats barley, the mighty one,

analyzed: tṛpat somam apibat viṣṇunā sutam yathā vaśat
translated: Having drunk the Soma to his fill, Vishnu's son, as he desired,

original: sa īṃ mamāda mahi karma kartave mahām uruṃ
analyzed: saḥ īm mamāda mahi karma kartave mahām urum
translated: He drank it to perform great deeds, the great, the wide one,

original: sainaṃ saścad devo devaṃ satyam indraṃ satya induḥ
analyzed: sa enam saścat devaḥ devam satyam indram satyaḥ induḥ
translated: The god, the true one, shall win the god, the true Indra, the true moon.
Then, with his might, he united the two glowing halves of the sacrificial stake in battle

original: ā rodasī apṛṇad asya majmanā pra vāvṛdhe
analyzed: ā rodasī apṛṇat asya majmanā pra vāvṛdhe
translated: He filled the two world-halves with his greatness, he grew in strength

analyzed: adhatta anyam jaṭhare pra īm aricyata
translated: He placed another in his belly, then he went forth

original: sainaṃ saścad devo devam satyam indraṃ satya induḥ
analyzed: sa enam saścat devaḥ devam satyam satyaḥ induḥ
translated: The true Moon, the god, has united with the true Indra, the god

original: sākaṃ jātaḥ kratunā sākam ojasā vavakṣitha
analyzed: sākam jātaḥ kratunā sākam ojasā vavakṣitha
translated: Together with power you grew, together with strength you waxed

original: sākaṃ vṛddho vīryais sāsahir mṛdho vicarṣaṇiḥ
analyzed: sākam vṛddhaḥ vīryaiḥ sāsahiḥ mṛdhaḥ vicarṣaṇiḥ
translated: Together with manly powers you grew, the all-active, the conqueror of foes🔽The giver of wealth, of lovely treasure, to the praiser

original: dātā rādhas stuvate kāmyaṃ vasu sainaṃ saścad devo devam satyam indraṃ satya induḥ
analyzed: dātā rādhaḥ stuvate kāmyam vasu sa enam saścat devaḥ devam satyam satyaḥ induḥ
translated: The true Moon, the god, has united with the true Indra, the god

original: tava tyan naryaṃ nṛto 'pa indra prathamaṃ pūrvyaṃ divi pravācyaṃ kṛtam
analyzed: tava tyad nṛto pa indra prathamam pūrvyam divi pravācyam kṛtam
translated: That manly deed of yours, O Indra, the first, the ancient, to be proclaimed in heaven,

original: yad devasya śavasā prāriṇā asuṃ riṇaṃn apaḥ
analyzed: yat devasya śavasā prāriṇāḥ asum riṇan apaḥ
translated: When by the power of the god you drove away the foe and the waters

original: bhuvad viśvam abhy ādevam ojasā vidād ūrjaṃ śatakratu vidād iṣam
analyzed: bhuvat viśvam abhī ā a devam ojasā vidāt ūrjam śatakratu vidāt iṣam
translated: You became all-surpassing by your might, O god, the powerful one found food and strength
The glowing one

original: VMP omits saścad devo devam satyam indraṃ /
analyzed: omit saścat devaḥ devam satyam indram
translated: The true Moon, the god, has united with the true Indra, the god,
which is in RV.

original: and has in its place in the text /
analyzed: and has in its place in the text
translated: and has in its place in the text.

original: VMP omits devo devam satyam indraṃ /
translated: The true Moon, the god, has united with the true Indra, the god,
which is in RV.

original: and has in its place in the text /
analyzed: and has in its place in the text
translated: and has in its place in the text.
Text. Nar

analyzed: draviṇāni āśata apaḥ ekam ca  viṣṇave svāhā

The two Śamans
