original: namo vāce yā coditā yā cānūditā tasyai vāce namo namo vāce namo vācaspataye
analyzed: namaḥ vāce yā ca uditā yā ca anūditā tasyai vāce namaḥ namaḥ vāce namaḥ vācaspataye
translated: Salutations to speech, both that which is uttered and that which is not uttered. Salutations to that speech. Salutations to speech. Salutations to the lord of speech.

original: nama ṛṣibhyo mantrakṛdbhyo mantrapatibhyo mā mām ṛṣayo mantrakṛto mantrapatayaḥ
analyzed: namaḥ ṛṣibhyaḥ mantra kṛdbhyaḥ mantra patibhyaḥ mā mām ṛṣayaḥ mantra kṛtaḥ mantra patayaḥ
translated: Salutations to the sages, the creators of mantras, the lords of mantras. May the sages, the creators of mantras, the lords of mantras not abandon me.

original: parādur māham ṛṣīn mantrakṛto mantrapatīs parādāṃ vaiśvadevīṃ vācam udyāsag
analyzed: parāduḥ mā aham ṛṣīn mantra kṛtaḥ mantra patīḥ parādām vaiśvadevīm vācam udya asakṛt
translated: May I not abandon the sages, the creators of mantras, the lords of mantras. I will speak the speech belonging to the All-gods.

original: ṃ śivām adastāṃ juṣṭāṃ devebhyaś śarma me dyauś śarma pṛthivī śarma viśvam idaṃ jagat
analyzed: ṃ śivām a dastām juṣṭām devebhyaḥ śarma me dyauḥ śarma pṛthivī śarma viśvam idam jagat
translated: May it be auspicious, pleasing to the gods. May heaven grant me protection, may earth grant protection, may this entire world grant protection.

original: śarma candraś ca sūryaś ca śarma brahmaprajāpatī
analyzed: śarma candraḥ ca sūryaḥ ca śarma brahma prajāpatī
translated: May the moon and the sun grant protection, may Brahman and Prajapati grant protection.

original: bhūtaṃ vadiṣye bhuvanaṃ vadiṣye tejo vadiṣye yaśo vadiśye tapo vadiṣye
analyzed: bhūtam vadiṣye bhuvanam vadiṣye tejaḥ vadiṣye yaśaḥ vadiṣye tapaḥ vadiṣye
translated: I will speak of the past, I will speak of the present, I will speak of splendor, I will speak of fame, I will speak of austerity.

original: brahma vadiṣye satyaṃ vadiṣye tasmā aham idam upastaraṇam upastṛṇa upastaraṇaṃ me
analyzed: brahma vadiṣye satyam vadiṣye tasmai aham idam upastaraṇam upastṛṇe upastaraṇam me
translated: I will speak of Brahman, I will speak of truth. Therefore, I spread out this covering for him. This covering is mine.

original: prajāyai paśūnāṃ bhūyād upastaraṇam ahaṃ prajāyai paśūnāṃ bhūyāsaṃ prāṇāpānau mṛtyor
analyzed: prajāyai paśūnām bhūyāt upastaraṇam aham prajāyai paśūnām bhūyāsam prāṇa apānau mṛtyoḥ
translated: May I be the spreading for offspring and cattle. May I be for offspring and cattle. O expiration and inspiration, protect me from death.

original: mā pātaṃ prāṇāpānau mā mā hāsiṣṭaṃ madhu maniṣye madhu janiṣye madhu vakṣyāmi madhu🔽vadiṣyāmi madhumatīṃ devebhyo vācam udyāsag
analyzed: mā pātam prāṇa apānau mā mā hāsiṣṭam madhu maniṣye madhu janiṣye madhu vakṣyāmi madhu  vadiṣyāmi madhumatīm devebhyaḥ vācam
translated: Do not abandon me, O expiration and inspiration. I will speak sweetness, I will produce sweetness, I will utter sweetness.

original: ṃ śuśrūṣeṇyāṃ manuṣyebhyas taṃ mā devā avantu śobhāyai pitaro inu madantu oṃ śāntiś śāntiś śāntiḥ
analyzed: śuśrūṣeṇyām manuṣyebhyaḥ tam mā devāḥ avantu śobhāyai pitaraḥ inu madantu om śāntiḥ śāntiḥ śāntiḥ
translated: I will utter sweet words to the gods. I will utter sweet words to men. May the gods favor me for splendor. May the ancestors rejoice. Om peace, peace, peace.
Salutations to speech. Four

original: śaṃ no mitraś śaṃ varuṇaḥ śaṃ no bhavatv aryamā
analyzed: śam naḥ mitraḥ śam varuṇaḥ śam naḥ bhavatu aryamā
translated: May Mitra be auspicious to us, may Varuna be auspicious to us, may Aryaman be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ na indro bṛhaspatiḥ śaṃ no viṣṇur urukramaḥ
analyzed: śam naḥ indraḥ bṛhaspatiḥ śam naḥ viṣṇuḥ uru kramaḥ
translated: May Indra be auspicious to us, may Brihaspati be auspicious to us, may Vishnu of wide stride be auspicious to us.
Salutations to Brahman.

original: namas te vāyo🔽tvam eva pratyakṣaṃ brahmāsi
analyzed: namaḥ te vāyo  tvam eva pratyakṣam brahma asi
translated: Salutations to you, O Vayu.🔽You alone are Brahman manifest.

original: tvām eva pratyakṣaṃ brahma vadiṣyāmi🔽ṛtaṃ vadiṣyāmi
analyzed: tvām eva pratyakṣam brahma vadiṣyāmi  ṛtam vadiṣyāmi
translated: I will speak to you alone, Brahman manifest.🔽I will speak the truth.
I will speak the truth.
May that protect me.
May that protect the speaker.
May it protect me.
May it protect the speaker.
Om peace, peace, peace.

original: śaṃ no vātaḥ pavatāṃ mātariśvā śaṃ nas tapatu sūryaḥ
analyzed: śam naḥ vātaḥ pavatām śam naḥ tapatu sūryaḥ
translated: May the wind blow auspiciously for us, may the sun shine auspiciously for us,

original: ahāni śaṃ bhavantu naś śag🔽ṃ rātriḥ prati dhīyatām🔽śam uṣā no vyucchatu śam āditya udetu naḥ
analyzed: ahāni śam bhavantu naḥ śak  ṃ rātriḥ prati dhīyatām  śam uṣāḥ naḥ vyucchatu śam ādityaḥ udetu naḥ
translated: May the days be auspicious for us, may the night be auspicious for us.🔽May the dawn shine auspiciously for us, may the sun rise auspiciously for us.

original: śivā naś śantamā bhava sumṛḍīkā sarasvatī
analyzed: śivā naḥ śantamā bhava su mṛḍīkā sarasvatī
translated: Be auspicious and most auspicious for us, O Sarasvatī, be kind to us.

original: mā te vyoma saṃdṛśi🔽iḍāyai vāstv asi vāstumad vāstumanto bhūyāsma mā vāstoś cith sma hy avāstus sa bhuyād yo 'smān dveṣṭi yañ ca vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ
analyzed: mā te vyoma saṃdṛśi  iḍāyai vāstu asi vāstumat vāstumantaḥ bhūyāsma mā vāstoḥ cith sma hi a vāstuḥ sa bhuyāt yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam ca vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: Do not look upon the sky as empty.🔽You are the abode of the oblation, be full of abodes, may we be full of abodes. Let him be without an abode who hates us and whom we hate.

original: pratiṣṭhāsi pratiṣṭhāvanto bhūyāsma mā pratiṣṭhāyāś cith sma hy apratiṣṭhas sa bhūyād yo 'smān dveṣṭi yañ ca vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ
analyzed: pratiṣṭhā asi pratiṣṭhāvantaḥ bhūyāsma mā pratiṣṭhāyāḥ sma hi apratiṣṭhaḥ sa bhūyāt yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam ca vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: You are the foundation, may we be possessed of foundations. Let him be without a foundation who hates us and whom we hate.

original: ā vāta vāhi bheṣajaṃ vi vāta vāhi yad rapaḥ
analyzed: ā vāta vāhi bheṣajam vi vāta vāhi yat rapaḥ
translated: O Wind, blow the remedy, blow away whatever ailment there is.

original: tvagṃ hi viśvabheṣajo devānāṃ dūta īyase
analyzed: tvacam hi viśva bheṣajaḥ devānām dūtaḥ īyase
translated: For you are the universal remedy, you go as the messenger of the gods.

original: dvāv imau vātau vāta ā sindhor ā parāvataḥ🔽dakṣaṃ me anya ā vātu parānyo vātu yad rapaḥ
analyzed: dvau imau vātau vātaḥ ā sindhoḥ ā parāvataḥ  dakṣam anyaḥ ā vātu parā anyaḥ vātu yat
translated: These two winds blow, O Wind, from the river and from afar.
Let one wind blow me strength, let the other blow away whatever ailment there is.

original: VMP divides this verse making the second line the first line of chapter / The numbering is adjusted so that the complete verse comes
analyzed: divides this verse making the second line the first line of chapter  the numbering is adjusted so that the complete verse comes
translated: The verse is divided in the sky, making the second line the first line of the chapter. The numbering is adjusted so that the complete verse comes
at the end of the chapter.

original: yad ado vāta te gṛhe 'mṛtasya nidhir hitaḥ
analyzed: yat adaḥ vāta te gṛhe mṛtasya nidhiḥ hitaḥ
translated: The treasure of immortality that is in your house, O wind,

original: tato no dehi jīvase tato no dhehi bheṣajam🔽tato no maha āvaha vāta ā vātu bheṣajam
analyzed: tatas naḥ dehi jīvase tatas naḥ dhehi bheṣajam  tatas naḥ mahaḥ āvaha vātaḥ ā vātu bheṣajam
translated: from that give us for life, from that give us medicine.🔽From that, O wind, bring us great prosperity, let the wind blow medicine for us.

original: śaṃbhūr mayobhūr no hṛde pra ṇa āyūg
analyzed: śaṃbhūḥ mayobhūḥ naḥ hṛde pra naḥ āyūk
translated: May it be auspicious and free from disease in our heart, may it unite us with long life.
May it deliver us from all sin.

original: indrasya gṛho 'si taṃ tvā prapadye sagus sāśvaḥ
analyzed: indrasya gṛhā u si tam tvā prapadye saguḥ sa aśvaḥ
translated: You are Indra's house, I enter you with my cattle, horses,
and whatever else I have.

original: bhūḥ prapadye bhuvaḥ prapadye suvaḥ prapadye bhūr bhuvas suvaḥ prapadye
analyzed: bhūḥ prapadye bhuvaḥ prapadye suvar prapadye bhūḥ bhuvaḥ suvar prapadye
translated: I enter the earth, I enter the atmosphere, I enter the sky, I enter the earth, atmosphere, and sky.

original: vāyuṃ prapadye inārtāṃ devatāṃ prapadye 'śmānam ākhaṇaṃ prapadye prajāpater brahmakośaṃ
analyzed: vāyum prapadye ina ārtām devatām prapadye śmānam ākhaṇam prapadye prajāpateḥ brahma kośam
translated: I enter Vayu, I enter the distressed deity, I enter the uncarved stone, I enter Prajapati's treasure of Brahman.
I enter the Brahman, I enter Om.

original: antarikṣaṃ ma urv antaraṃ bṛhad agnayaḥ parvatāś ca yayā vātas svastyā svastimān tayā svastyā svastimān asāni
analyzed: antarikṣam me uru antaram bṛhat agnayaḥ parvatāḥ ca yayā vātaḥ svastyā svastimān tayā svastyā svastimān asāni
translated: The vast space between the worlds, the great fires and mountains by which the wind blows with prosperity, by that prosperity may I be prosperous.

original: prāṇāpānau mṛtyor mā pātaṃ prāṇāpānau mā mā hāsiṣṭaṃ
analyzed: prāṇa apānau mṛtyoḥ mā pātam prāṇa apānau mā mā hāsiṣṭam
translated: May the in-breath and out-breath protect me from death. May the in-breath and out-breath not abandon me.🔽In me let wisdom, in me offspring, in me let Agni place radiance. In me let wisdom, in me offspring, in me

original: mayi medhāṃ mayi prajāṃ mayy agnis tejo dadhātu mayi medhāṃ mayi prajāṃ mayīndra indriyaṃ dadhātu mayi medhāṃ mayi prajāṃ mayi
analyzed: mayi medhām prajām mayi agniḥ tejaḥ dadhātu mayi medhām mayi prajām mayi indraḥ indriyam dadhātu mayi medhām mayi prajām mayi
translated: let Indra place power. In me let wisdom, in me offspring, in me
let the sun place splendor.
[The text omits this verse.]

original: dyubhir aktubhiḥ pari pātam asmān ariṣṭebhir aśvinā saubhagebhiḥ
analyzed: dyubhiḥ aktubhiḥ pari pātam asmān ariṣṭebhiḥ aśvinā saubhagebhiḥ
translated: With your bright rays, O Asvins, protect us with your infallible, auspicious rays.

original: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditis sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: May Mitra, Varuna, Aditi, the ocean, the earth, and the sky grant this to us.

original: kayā naś citra ā bhuvad ūtī sadāvṛdhas sakhā
analyzed: kayā naḥ citraḥ ā bhuvat ūtī sadāvṛdhaḥ sakhā
translated: By what wondrous help, O ever-waxing friend, wilt thou come to us?

original: kayā śaciṣṭhayāvṛtā🔽kas tvā satyo madānāṃ mag
analyzed: kayā śaciṣṭhayā āvṛtā  kaḥ tvā satyaḥ madānām magh
translated: By what most mighty aid?🔽Who, O true one, of the gladdening drinks
is best to be pressed, to be mixed with the juice?

original: dṛḍhā cid āruje vasu🔽abhī ṣu ṇas sakhīnām avitā jaritṝṇām
analyzed: dṛḍhā cit āruje vasu  abhī su naḥ sakhīnām avitā jaritṝṇām
translated: Thou hast burst open even the firm treasures.🔽Be thou, O friend, the protector of us thy praisers.
Be thou a hundredfold with thy aids.

original: vayas suparṇā upa sedur indraṃ priyamedhā ṛṣayo nādhamānāḥ
analyzed: vayaḥ suparṇāḥ upa seduḥ indram priyamedhāḥ ṛṣayaḥ nādhamānāḥ
translated: The birds of fair prayer, the Rsis, have come to Indra, to the friend who ever waxes great.

original: apa dhvāntam ūrṇuhi pūrdhi cakṣur mumugdhy asmān nidhayeva baddhān
analyzed: apa dhvāntam ūrṇuhi pūrdhi cakṣuḥ mumugdhi asmān nidhayā iva baddhān
translated: Drive away the darkness, make our sight clear, deliver us as 'twere from a pitfall.
[RV_1,1.1:] The one who is to be pressed.🔽[RV_1,1.2:] The one who is to be mixed with the juice.

original: śaṃ no devīr abhiṣṭaya āpo bhavantu pītaye
analyzed: śam naḥ devīḥ abhiṣṭaye āpaḥ bhavantu pītaye
translated: May the waters be for our welfare and drinking,
May they flow to us for our welfare.
Mistresses of precious things, flowing to the people,
I ask the waters for healing.

original: sumitrā na āpa oṣadhayas santu durmitrās tasmai bhūyāsur yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ
analyzed: su mitrāḥ naḥ āpaḥ oṣadhayaḥ santu durmitrāḥ tasmai bhūyāsuḥ yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam ca vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: May the waters and plants be friendly to us. Unfriendly may they be to him who hates us and whom we hate.

original: āpo hi ṣṭhā mayobhuvas tā na ūrje dadhātana
analyzed: āpaḥ hi stha mayobhuvaḥ tāḥ naḥ ūrje dadhātana
translated: Ye waters, verily, are beneficent: for our strength
Do ye provide, for the great joy of vision.

original: yo vaś śivatamo rasas tasya bhājayateha naḥ
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ śivatamaḥ rasaḥ tasya bhājayata iha naḥ
translated: Of your most gracious juice vouchsafe us a share,
Ye who are like eager mothers.

original: tasmā araṃ gamāma vo yasya kṣayāya jinvatha
analyzed: tasmai aram gamāma vaḥ yasya kṣayāya jinvatha
translated: To him we come to you, for whose enjoyment ye quicken us.
O waters, do ye generate us.

original: VMP divides this verse making the second line the first line of chapter / The numbering is adjusted so that the complete verse comes
analyzed: divides this verse making the second line the first line of chapter  the numbering is adjusted so that the complete verse comes
translated: The second line of this verse is made the first line of the chapter. The numbering is adjusted so that the complete verse comes
at the end of the chapter.

original: pṛthivī śāntā sāgninā śāntā sā me śāntā śucagṃ śamayatu
analyzed: pṛthivī śāntā sā agninā śāntā sā me śāntā śucagm śamayatu
translated: The earth is peaceful, it is peaceful with fire, may that peaceful one pacify me with good purity.

original: antarikṣag🔽ṃ śāntaṃ tad vāyunā śāntaṃ tan me śāntag
analyzed: antarikṣa g  ṃ śāntam tat vāyunā śāntam tat me śānta g
translated: The atmosphere
is peaceful, it is peaceful with wind, may that peaceful one pacify me with good purity.

original: dyauś śāntā sādityena śāntā sā me śāntā śucagṃ śamayatu🔽pṛthivī śāntir antarikṣag
analyzed: dyauḥ śāntā sā ādityena śāntā sā me śāntā śucak śamayatu  pṛthivī śāntiḥ antarikṣa g
translated: The peaceful heaven with the sun is peaceful, may that peaceful (heaven) with the sun pacify me peacefully.
The earth is peace, the atmosphere is peace, the sky is peace.

original: diśaś śāntir avāntaradiśāś śāntir agniś śāntir vāyuś śāntir ādityaś śāntiś candramāś śāntir nakṣatrāṇi śāntir
analyzed: diśaḥ śāntiḥ avāntaradiśāḥ śāntiḥ agniḥ śāntiḥ vāyuḥ śāntiḥ ādityaḥ śāntiḥ candramāḥ śāntiḥ nakṣatrāṇi śāntiḥ
translated: The directions are peace, the intermediate directions are peace, fire is peace, wind is peace, the sun is peace, the moon is peace, the stars are peace.

original: āpaś śāntir oṣadhayaś śāntir vanaspatayaś śāntir
analyzed: āpaḥ śāntiḥ oṣadhayaḥ śāntiḥ vanaspatayaḥ śāntiḥ
translated: The waters are peace, the plants are peace, the trees are peace.

original: gauś śāntir ajā śāntir aśvaś śāntiḥ puruṣaś śāntir brahmā śāntir brāhmanaś śāntiś śāntir eva śāntiś śāntir me astu śāntiḥ
analyzed: gauḥ śāntiḥ ajā śāntiḥ aśvaḥ śāntiḥ puruṣaḥ śāntiḥ brahmā śāntiḥ brāhmanaḥ śāntiḥ śāntiḥ eva śāntiḥ śāntiḥ me astu śāntiḥ
translated: The cow is peace, the goat is peace, the horse is peace, the man is peace, the Brahman is peace, the Brahmin is peace, peace is indeed peace, may there be peace for me, peace.

original: tayāhagṃ śāntyā sarvaśāntyā mahyaṃ dvipade catuṣpade ca śāntiṃ karomi śāntir me astu śāntiḥ🔽eha śrīś ca hrīś ca dhṛtiś ca tapo medhā pratiṣṭhā śraddhā satyaṃ dharmaś caitāni mottiṣṭhantam anūttiṣṭhantu mā māg
analyzed: tayā ahagṃ śāntyā sarva śāntyā mahyam dvipade catuṣpade ca śāntim karomi śāntiḥ me astu śāntiḥ  ā iha śrīḥ ca hrīḥ ca dhṛtiḥ ca tapaḥ medhā pratiṣṭhā śraddhā satyam dharmaḥ ca etāni mā uttiṣṭhantam anūttiṣṭhantu mā mā ag
translated: By that peace, by all peace, I make peace for myself, for the two-footed and the four-footed. May there be peace for me, peace.🔽Here may prosperity, modesty, steadiness, austerity, intelligence, foundation, faith, truth, and righteousness follow me as I rise up. Let them not leave me.

original: ṃ śrīś ca hrīś ca dhṛtiś ca tapo medhā pratiṣṭhā śraddhā satyaṃ dharmaś caitāni mā mā hāsiṣuḥ
analyzed: ṃ śrīḥ ca hrīḥ ca dhṛtiḥ ca tapaḥ medhā pratiṣṭhā śraddhā satyam dharmaḥ ca etāni mā mā hāsiṣuḥ
translated: May prosperity, modesty, steadiness, austerity, intelligence, foundation, faith, truth, and righteousness not forsake me.

analyzed: ud āyuṣā su āyuṣā ud oṣadhīnāj
translated: With life, with my own life, with the sap of the plants,
with the strength of Parjanya have I risen, following the immortal.

original: tac cakṣur devahitaṃ purastāc chukram uccarat
analyzed: tat cakṣuḥ deva hitam śukram uccarat
translated: That eye which is friendly to the gods, the pure one, shines forth in front.

original: paśyema śaradaś śataṃ jīvema śaradaś śataṃ nandāma śaradaś śataṃ modāma śaradaś śataṃ bhavāma śaradaś śatag
analyzed: paśyema śaradaḥ śatam jīvema śaradaḥ śatam nandāma śaradaḥ śatam modāma śaradaḥ śatam bhavāma śaradaḥ śatagu
translated: May we see a hundred autumns, may we live a hundred autumns, may we rejoice a hundred autumns, may we delight a hundred autumns, may we be a hundred autumns.

original: ṃ śṛṇavāma śaradaś śataṃ prabravāma śaradaś śatam ajītās syāma śaradaś śataṃ jyok ca sūryaṃ dṛśe
analyzed: ṃ śṛṇavāma śaradaḥ śatam prabravāma śaradaḥ śatam a jītāḥ syāma śaradaḥ śatam jyok ca sūryam dṛśe
translated: May we hear a hundred autumns, may we speak a hundred autumns, may we be free from debt a hundred autumns, may we long see the sun a hundred autumns.

original: ya udagān mahato 'rṇavād vibhrājamānas sarirasya madhyāth sa mā vṛṣabho lohitākṣas sūryo vipaścin manasā punātu
analyzed: yaḥ udagāt mahataḥ rṇavāt vibhrājamānaḥ sarirasya madhyāt sa mā vṛṣabhaḥ lohita akṣaḥ sūryaḥ vipaścit manasā punātu
translated: He who has risen from the great ocean, shining from the midst of the waters, may that bull, the red-eyed sun, purify me with his mind, with his thought.

original: brahmaṇaś ścotany asi brahmaṇa āṇī stho brahmaṇa āvapanam asi dhāriteyaṃ pṛthivī brahmaṇā mahī dhāritam enena mahad antarikṣaṃ 🔽divaṃ dādhāra pṛthivīg
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ asi brahmaṇaḥ āṇī sthaḥ brahmaṇaḥ āvapanam asi dhāritā iyam pṛthivī brahmaṇā mahī dhāritam enena mahat antarikṣam  divam dādhāra pṛthivīk
translated: You are the descendant of Brahman, you are the offspring of Brahman, you are the covering of Brahman. This great earth is supported by Brahman, this great earth is supported by him.

original: ṃ sadevāṃ yad ahaṃ veda tad ahaṃ dhārayāṇi mā mad vedo 'dhi visrasat
analyzed: sa devām yat aham veda tat aham dhārayāṇi mā mat vedaḥ hi visrasat
translated: He supports the heaven, he supports the earth, he supports the gods. What I know, that I shall support. Let not my knowledge be lost.
Let the two, thought and understanding, enter me.

original: ṃ samīcī bhūtasya bhavyasyāvaruddhyai sarvam āyur ayāṇi sarvam āyur ayāṇi
analyzed: ṃ samīcī bhūtasya bhavyasya avaruddhyai sarvam āyuḥ ayāṇi sarvam āyuḥ ayāṇi
translated: for the attainment of the past and the future. I have attained the whole life, I have attained the whole life.

original: ābhir gīrbhir yad ato na ūnam āpyāyaya harivo vardhamānaḥ
analyzed: ābhiḥ gīrbhiḥ yat atas naḥ ūnam āpyāyaya harivas vardhamānaḥ
translated: By these hymns, whatever is not deficient here, O bountiful one, increase, growing.

original: yadā stotṛbhyo mahi gotrā rujāsi bhūyiṣṭhabhājo adha te syāma
analyzed: yadā stotṛbhyaḥ mahi gotrā rujāsi bhūyiṣṭha bhājaḥ adha te syāma
translated: When you crush the great lineage for the praisers, may we be the most prosperous of you.

original: brahma prāvādiṣma tan no mā hāsīt
analyzed: brahma prāvādiṣma tat naḥ mā hāsīt
translated: We have uttered the Brahman, may it not fail us.
Om peace, peace, peace.
RV omits
Brahman and Chotan

original: parāvato dadhātu baddhāñ jinvatha dṛśe sapta ca
analyzed: parāvataḥ dadhātu baddhām jinvatha dṛśe sapta ca
translated: May he from afar bestow, quicken the bound, for sight the seven

original: tam ekanemim ud vayan tamasa dhārāsu saptāgniś śucivratatamaś śuciḥ
analyzed: tam eka nemim ud vayan tamasa dhārāsu sapta agniḥ śuci vratatamaḥ śuciḥ
translated: That one with a single wheel, rising up, in the seven streams of darkness, the fire with the purest vow, pure🔽That Vishnu, I enter, may I have splendor. I praise Savitar, the son of heaven, three times, O god, of Vishnu

original: pra tad viṣṇur bhūḥ prapadye tejovat syāvas savitur agnim īḷe trir deva viṣṇor nu🔽kam āśāsu saptasu vāstoṣpate śucī vo havyodyantaṃ vā hiraṇyagarbhas sam avartatendraṃ🔽vo 'gne naya āyātu deva namas sute 'stabhnād yā pīvonnā madbhyas tirodhāstu
analyzed: pra tat viṣṇuḥ bhūḥ prapadye tejovat syāvaḥ savituḥ agnim īḍe tris deva viṣṇoḥ nu 🔽kam āśāsu saptasu vāstoṣpate śucī vaḥ havyā udyantam vā hiraṇyagarbhaḥ sam avartata indram 🔽vaḥ gne nayaḥ āyātu deva namaḥ sute stabhnāt yā pīvonnā madbhyaḥ
translated: In the seven hopes, O lord of the house. Pure for you is the oblation. The rising smoke. I praise Agni, the son of heaven, three times, O god, of Vishnu🔽O Agni, lead us by a good path to the gods, O god, come to the offered oblation. He established the seven. May the smoke rise up. original: hi śrutaṃ kanikradad īṅkārāyāgodānād omāsa rātrī vyakhyad āyatī hiraṇyagarbha
analyzed: hi śrutam kanikradat īṅkārāya a godānāt omā āsa rātrī vyakhyat āyatī hiraṇya garbha
translated: The sound of the cow's lowing has been heard. From the giving of gifts, the night has dawned. The future is clear.

original: viśvajite viṣṇave svāhā nārāyaṇāya namo brahmaṇe tac chaṃ yor namo vāce śaṃ no mitraś
analyzed: viśvajite viṣṇave svāhā nārāyaṇāya namaḥ brahmaṇe tat śam yos namaḥ vāce śam naḥ mitraḥ
translated: To Vishnu, the conqueror of the universe, hail! Salutations to Narayana! To Brahman, that auspicious pair, salutations to speech. May Mitra be auspicious to us.
May the wind blow for us, purifying the fire.
Thirty-seven.
In the book
text. May it be obstructed.

original: tam ekanemiṃ śaṅkhaṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmi pūtaḥ pūtāntar bali rakṣakāyāgniś
analyzed: tam eka nemim śaṅkham pratiṣṭhāpayāmi pūtaḥ pūta antar bali rakṣakāya agniḥ
translated: I establish that one-spoked wheel, pure within the pure, the oblation for the Rakshas, the fire.

original: śucivratatama yo vā saṃyoga idaṃ viṣṇus tejovat syāvas savitur devasya tvā viṣṇor
analyzed: śuci vratatama yaḥ vā saṃyoge idam viṣṇuḥ tejovat syāvaḥ savituḥ devasya tvā viṣṇoḥ
translated: Most pure in vow, or that which is the union, this is Vishnu. May it be full of splendor. Of the god Savita, I invoke you.
What wondrous thing of the gods?

original: ṃ śaṃ no devī raktāmbaradharam āvāhayāmi nārāyaṇāyodyantaṃ vā trikadrukebhir ā vo rājā notthitāya svāhā viśvajite nārāyaṇāya śaṃ no mitrag
analyzed: ṃ śam naḥ devī rakta ambara dharam āvāhayāmi nārāyaṇāya udyantam vā trikadrukebhiḥ ā vaḥ rājā na utthitāya svāhā viśvajite nārāyaṇāya śam naḥ mitra gaṇa
translated: I invoke the red-robed goddess. May she be auspicious to us. I invoke Narayana, the rising sun. To the three mountains, your king, who has arisen, hail! To the conqueror of the universe, to Narayana, may Mitra,
The one hundred and sixth.
That one-spoked wheel, with three spokes,

original: ṃ ṣoḍaśāntam oṃ śāntiś śāntiś śāntiḥ
analyzed: ṃ ṣoḍaśāntam om śāntiḥ śāntiḥ śāntiḥ
translated: Up to sixteen. Om. Peace, peace, peace.
Hari, Om.
That which is.
May it be dedicated to Lord Krishna.
